/app/src/ast.rs:
    1|       |//! Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) for C11 compiler.
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the core AST data structures and APIs for representing
    4|       |//! C11 programs. The AST is designed as a flattened storage system for efficiency,
    5|       |//! with index-based references to child nodes and types.
    6|       |//!
    7|       |//! ## Architecture
    8|       |//!
    9|       |//! The AST is organized into focused submodules for better maintainability:
   10|       |//!
   11|       |//! - [`nodes`]: Node definitions, constructors, and builder patterns for AST nodes
   12|       |//! - [`types`]: Type system representation and utilities for semantic analysis
   13|       |//!
   14|       |//! ## Key Features
   15|       |//!
   16|       |//! - **Flattened Storage**: All AST nodes are stored in contiguous vectors with index-based references
   17|       |//! - **Interior Mutability**: Uses `Cell` for type annotations without requiring mutable AST access
   18|       |//! - **Builder Patterns**: Ergonomic constructors for complex AST nodes
   19|       |//! - **Type System**: Canonical types distinct from syntactic type specifiers
   20|       |//!
   21|       |
   22|       |use std::num::NonZeroU32;
   23|       |
   24|       |/// Represents an interned string using symbol_table crate.
   25|       |/// Alias for GlobalSymbol from symbol_table crate with global feature.
   26|       |pub type NameId = symbol_table::GlobalSymbol;
   27|       |pub type StringId = NameId;
   28|       |
   29|       |use crate::semantic::{QualType, ScopeId, SemanticInfo, SymbolRef, TypeRef, ValueCategory};
   30|       |pub use crate::source_manager::{SourceId, SourceLoc, SourceSpan};

   66|      2|        let index = self.kinds.len() as u32 + 1; // Start from 1 for NonZeroU32
   67|      2|        self.kinds.push(kind);
   68|      2|        self.spans.push(span);
   69|      2|        NodeRef::new(index).expect("NodeRef overflow")

  129|       |    #[inline]

  131|      1|        NodeRefRange {
  132|      1|            current: self.get(),
  133|      1|            end: self.get() + len.into(),

  138|       |/// An iterator over a contiguous range of `NodeRef`s.
  139|       |#[derive(Clone, Debug)]
  140|       |pub struct NodeRefRange {
  141|       |    current: u32,
  142|       |    end: u32,
  143|       |}
  144|       |
  145|       |impl Iterator for NodeRefRange {
  146|       |    type Item = NodeRef;
  147|       |
  148|       |    #[inline]
  149|      2|    fn next(&mut self) -> Option<Self::Item> {
  150|      2|        if self.current < self.end {
  151|      1|            let node = NodeRef::new(self.current).expect("NodeRef overflow in range");
  152|      1|            self.current += 1;
  153|      1|            Some(node)
  154|       |        } else {
  155|      1|            None
  156|       |        }
  157|      2|    }
  158|       |
  159|       |    #[inline]
  160|      0|    fn size_hint(&self) -> (usize, Option<usize>) {
  161|      0|        let len = (self.end - self.current) as usize;
  162|      0|        (len, Some(len))
  163|      0|    }
  164|       |}
  165|       |
  166|       |impl ExactSizeIterator for NodeRefRange {}
  167|       |

   53|       |impl<'a> fmt::Display for TypeRegistryDisplay<'a> {
   54|      0|    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
   55|       |        // Collect all TypeRefs used in the AST
   56|      0|        let mut used_type_refs = HashSet::new();
   57|       |
   58|      0|        for kind in &self.ast.kinds {
   59|      0|            AstDumper::collect_type_refs_from_node(kind, &mut used_type_refs);
   60|      0|        }
   61|       |
   62|      0|        if used_type_refs.is_empty() {
   63|      0|            return Ok(());
   64|      0|        }
   65|       |
   66|       |        // Print header
   67|      0|        writeln!(f, "\n=== TypeRegistry (Used TypeRefs) ===")?;
   68|       |
   69|       |        // Sort TypeRefs for consistent output
   70|      0|        let mut sorted_type_refs: Vec<_> = used_type_refs.into_iter().collect();
   71|      0|        sorted_type_refs.sort_by_key(|ty_ref| ty_ref.get());
   72|       |
   73|       |        // Dump each used TypeRef with user-friendly formatting
   74|      0|        for ty_ref in sorted_type_refs {
   75|      0|            let ty = self.registry.get(ty_ref);
   76|      0|            let formatted_type = AstDumper::format_type_kind_user_friendly(&ty.kind, self.registry);
   77|      0|            writeln!(f, "TypeRef({}): {}", ty_ref.base(), formatted_type)?;
   78|       |        }
   79|      0|        Ok(())
   80|      0|    }
   81|       |}

  102|       |    /// Format TypeKind in a user-friendly way for TypeRegistry dump
  103|       |    #[allow(clippy::only_used_in_recursion)]

  105|      0|        match kind {
  106|       |            // Basic types - use the existing dump format
  107|      0|            TypeKind::Builtin(b) => match b {

  114|      0|                BuiltinType::UShort => "unsigned short".to_string(),
  115|      0|                BuiltinType::Int => "int".to_string(),
  116|      0|                BuiltinType::UInt => "unsigned int".to_string(),
  117|      0|                BuiltinType::Long => "long".to_string(),
  118|      0|                BuiltinType::ULong => "unsigned long".to_string(),
  119|      0|                BuiltinType::LongLong => "long long".to_string(),
  120|      0|                BuiltinType::ULongLong => "unsigned long long".to_string(),
  121|      0|                BuiltinType::Float => "float".to_string(),
  122|      0|                BuiltinType::Double => "double".to_string(),
  123|      0|                BuiltinType::LongDouble => "long double".to_string(),
  124|      0|                BuiltinType::Signed => "signed".to_string(),
  125|      0|                BuiltinType::VaList => "__builtin_va_list".to_string(),
  126|      0|                BuiltinType::Complex => "_Complex (marker)".to_string(),
  127|       |            },
  128|      0|            TypeKind::Complex { .. } => "_Complex".to_string(),
  129|      0|            TypeKind::Error => "<error>".to_string(),
  130|       |
  131|       |            // Complex types - provide more detailed information
  132|      0|            TypeKind::Pointer { pointee } => {
  133|      0|                let current_type = registry.get(pointee.ty());
  134|      0|                format!(
  135|      0|                    "{}*",
  136|      0|                    Self::format_type_kind_user_friendly(&current_type.kind, registry)
  137|       |                )
  138|       |            }
  139|      0|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, size } => {
  140|      0|                let element_str = Self::format_type_kind_user_friendly(&registry.get(*element_type).kind, registry);
  141|      0|                match size {
  142|      0|                    ArraySizeType::Constant(len) => format!("{}[{}]", element_str, len),
  143|      0|                    ArraySizeType::Incomplete => format!("{}[]", element_str),
  144|      0|                    ArraySizeType::Variable(_) => "<VLA>".to_string(),

  146|       |                }
  147|       |            }

  151|      0|                is_variadic,

  157|      0|                    let param_str =
  158|      0|                        Self::format_type_kind_user_friendly(&registry.get(param.param_type.ty()).kind, registry);
  159|      0|                    param_strs.push(param_str);
  160|      0|                }

  163|      0|                format!("{}({}{})", return_str, params, variadic)
  164|       |            }

  166|      0|                let kind_str = if *is_union { "union" } else { "struct" };

  168|      0|                    format!("{} {}", kind_str, tag_name)
  169|       |                } else {
  170|      0|                    format!("{} (anonymous)", kind_str)

  172|       |            }
  173|      0|            TypeKind::Enum { tag, .. } => {

  179|       |            }
  180|       |        }
  181|      0|    }

  300|      0|        format!("func_{}", symbol_ref.get())
  301|      0|    }
  302|       |
  303|       |    /// Format a DesignatedInitializer for display
  304|      0|    fn format_designated_initializer(init: &DesignatedInitializer, ast: &Ast) -> String {
  305|      0|        let mut result = String::new();
  306|      0|        for designator_ref in init.designator_start.range(init.designator_len) {
  307|      0|            match ast.get_kind(designator_ref) {
  308|      0|                NodeKind::Designator(d) => match d {
  309|      0|                    Designator::FieldName(name) => {
  310|      0|                        result.push_str(&format!(".{}", name));
  311|      0|                    }
  312|      0|                    Designator::ArrayIndex(index) => {
  313|      0|                        result.push_str(&format!("[{}]", index.get()));
  314|      0|                    }
  315|      0|                    Designator::GnuArrayRange(start, end) => {
  316|      0|                        result.push_str(&format!("[{} ... {}]", start.get(), end.get()));
  317|      0|                    }
  318|       |                },
  319|      0|                _ => result.push_str("<invalid designator>"),
  320|       |            }
  321|       |        }
  322|       |
  323|      0|        if init.designator_len > 0 {
  324|      0|            result.push_str(" = ");
  325|      0|        }
  326|       |
  327|      0|        result.push_str(&init.initializer.get().to_string());
  328|      0|        result
  329|      0|    }

  331|       |    /// Dump a single parsed parsed node kind
  332|      0|    fn dump_parsed_node_kind(f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>, kind: &ParsedNodeKind, ast: &ParsedAst) -> fmt::Result {
  333|      0|        match kind {
  334|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Literal(literal) => match literal {
  335|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Int { val, suffix } => {
  336|      0|                    writeln!(f, "LiteralInt({:?}, {:?})", val, suffix)
  337|       |                }
  338|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Float { val, suffix } => {
  339|      0|                    writeln!(f, "LiteralFloat({}, {:?})", val, suffix)
  340|       |                }
  341|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::String(s) => writeln!(f, "LiteralString(\"{}\")", s),
  342|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Char(c) => writeln!(
  343|      0|                    f,
  344|      0|                    "LiteralChar('{}')",
  345|      0|                    char::from_u32(*c as u32).unwrap_or(char::REPLACEMENT_CHARACTER)
  346|       |                ),
  347|       |            },
  348|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Ident(name) => writeln!(f, "Ident({})", name),
  349|       |
  350|       |            // Expressions
  351|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::UnaryOp(op, node) => writeln!(f, "UnaryOp({:?}, {})", op, node.get()),
  352|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BinaryOp(op, l, r) => {
  353|      0|                writeln!(f, "BinaryOp({:?}, {}, {})", op, l.get(), r.get())
  354|       |            }
  355|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::TernaryOp(c, t, e) => {
  356|      0|                writeln!(f, "TernaryOp({}, {}, {})", c.get(), t.get(), e.get())
  357|       |            }
  358|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::GnuStatementExpression(stmt, expr) => {
  359|      0|                writeln!(f, "GnuStatementExpression({}, {})", stmt.get(), expr.get())
  360|       |            }
  361|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::PostIncrement(node) => writeln!(f, "PostIncrement({})", node.get()),
  362|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::PostDecrement(node) => writeln!(f, "PostDecrement({})", node.get()),
  363|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Assignment(op, l, r) => {
  364|      0|                writeln!(f, "Assignment({:?}, {}, {})", op, l.get(), r.get())
  365|       |            }
  366|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::FunctionCall(callee, args) => {
  367|      0|                let args_str = args.iter().map(|a| a.get().to_string()).collect::<Vec<_>>().join(", ");

  369|       |            }
  370|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::MemberAccess(obj, field, arrow) => writeln!(
  371|      0|                f,
  372|      0|                "MemberAccess({}, {}, {})",
  373|      0|                obj.get(),
  374|       |                field,
  375|      0|                if *arrow { "->" } else { "." }
  376|       |            ),
  377|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::IndexAccess(arr, idx) => {
  378|      0|                writeln!(f, "IndexAccess({}, {})", arr.get(), idx.get())
  379|       |            }
  380|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Cast(ty, expr) => writeln!(f, "Cast({:?}, {})", ty, expr.get()),
  381|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::SizeOfExpr(expr) => writeln!(f, "SizeOfExpr({})", expr.get()),
  382|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::SizeOfType(ty) => writeln!(f, "SizeOfType({:?})", ty),
  383|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::AlignOf(ty) => writeln!(f, "AlignOf({:?})", ty),
  384|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::CompoundLiteral(ty, init) => {
  385|      0|                writeln!(f, "CompoundLiteral({:?}, {})", ty, init.get())
  386|       |            }
  387|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinVaArg(ty, expr) => {
  388|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaArg({:?}, {})", ty, expr.get())
  389|       |            }
  390|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinVaStart(ap, last) => {
  391|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaStart({}, {})", ap.get(), last.get())
  392|       |            }
  393|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinVaEnd(ap) => {
  394|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaEnd({})", ap.get())
  395|       |            }
  396|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinVaCopy(dst, src) => {
  397|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaCopy({}, {})", dst.get(), src.get())
  398|       |            }
  399|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::BuiltinExpect(exp, c) => {
  400|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinExpect({}, {})", exp.get(), c.get())
  401|       |            }
  402|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::AtomicOp(op, args) => {
  403|      0|                let args_str = args.iter().map(|a| a.get().to_string()).collect::<Vec<_>>().join(", ");
  404|      0|                writeln!(f, "AtomicOp({:?}, args=[{}])", op, args_str)
  405|       |            }
  406|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::GenericSelection(ctrl, assocs) => {
  407|      0|                writeln!(f, "GenericSelection({}, {:?})", ctrl.get(), assocs)
  408|       |            }
  409|       |
  410|       |            // Statements
  411|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::CompoundStatement(stmts) => {
  412|      0|                let stmts_str = stmts.iter().map(|s| s.get().to_string()).collect::<Vec<_>>().join(", ");
  413|      0|                writeln!(f, "CompoundStatement(stmts=[{}])", stmts_str)
  414|       |            }
  415|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::If(data) => writeln!(f, "If({:?})", data),
  416|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::While(data) => writeln!(f, "While({:?})", data),
  417|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::DoWhile(body, cond) => {
  418|      0|                writeln!(f, "DoWhile(body={}, cond={})", body.get(), cond.get())
  419|       |            }
  420|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::For(data) => writeln!(f, "For({:?})", data),
  421|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Return(expr) => writeln!(
  422|      0|                f,
  423|      0|                "Return({})",
  424|      0|                expr.map(|e| e.get().to_string()).unwrap_or("void".to_string())
  425|       |            ),
  426|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Break => writeln!(f, "Break"),
  427|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Continue => writeln!(f, "Continue"),
  428|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Goto(label) => writeln!(f, "Goto({})", label),
  429|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Label(label, stmt) => writeln!(f, "Label({}, {})", label, stmt.get()),
  430|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Switch(cond, body) => {
  431|      0|                writeln!(f, "Switch({}, {})", cond.get(), body.get())
  432|       |            }
  433|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Case(val, stmt) => writeln!(f, "Case({}, {})", val.get(), stmt.get()),
  434|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::CaseRange(start, end, stmt) => {
  435|      0|                writeln!(f, "CaseRange({}, {}, {})", start.get(), end.get(), stmt.get())
  436|       |            }
  437|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Default(stmt) => writeln!(f, "Default({})", stmt.get()),
  438|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::ExpressionStatement(expr) => writeln!(
  439|      0|                f,

  442|       |            ),

  444|       |
  445|       |            // Declarations & Definitions
  446|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Declaration(data) => writeln!(f, "Declaration({:?})", data),
  447|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::FunctionDef(data) => writeln!(f, "FunctionDef({:?})", data),
  448|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::EnumConstant(name, val) => writeln!(

  453|       |            ),

  456|       |                {

  465|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::TranslationUnit(decls) => {
  466|      0|                let decls_str = decls.iter().map(|d| d.get().to_string()).collect::<Vec<_>>().join(", ");

  468|       |            }
  469|       |
  470|       |            // InitializerList
  471|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::InitializerList(inits) => writeln!(f, "InitializerList({:?})", inits),
  472|       |
  473|      0|            ParsedNodeKind::Dummy => writeln!(f, "Dummy"),
  474|       |        }
  475|      0|    }

  477|       |    /// Dump a single AST node kind
  478|      0|    fn dump_parser_kind(
  479|      0|        f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>,
  480|      0|        kind: &NodeKind,
  481|      0|        ast: &Ast,
  482|      0|        symbol_table: Option<&SymbolTable>,
  483|      0|    ) -> fmt::Result {
  484|      0|        match kind {
  485|      0|            NodeKind::TranslationUnit(tu_data) => {
  486|      0|                let start = tu_data.decl_start.get();
  487|      0|                if tu_data.decl_len > 0 {
  488|      0|                    let last = start + tu_data.decl_len as u32 - 1;
  489|      0|                    writeln!(f, "TranslationUnit(decls={}..{}) (parser kind)", start, last)
  490|       |                } else {
  491|      0|                    writeln!(f, "TranslationUnit(decls=[]) (parser kind)")
  492|       |                }
  493|       |            }
  494|      0|            NodeKind::Literal(literal) => match literal {
  495|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Int { val, suffix } => {
  496|      0|                    writeln!(f, "LiteralInt({:?}, {:?})", val, suffix)
  497|       |                }
  498|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Float { val, suffix } => {
  499|      0|                    writeln!(f, "LiteralFloat({}, {:?})", val, suffix)
  500|       |                }
  501|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::String(s) => writeln!(f, "LiteralString({})", s),
  502|      0|                crate::ast::literal::Literal::Char(c) => writeln!(
  503|      0|                    f,
  504|      0|                    "LiteralChar('{}')",
  505|      0|                    char::from_u32(*c as u32).unwrap_or(char::REPLACEMENT_CHARACTER)
  506|       |                ),
  507|       |            },
  508|      0|            NodeKind::Ident(sym, _) => writeln!(f, "Ident({})", sym),
  509|      0|            NodeKind::UnaryOp(op, operand) => writeln!(f, "UnaryOp({:?}, {})", op, operand.get()),
  510|      0|            NodeKind::BinaryOp(op, left, right) => {
  511|      0|                writeln!(f, "BinaryOp({:?}, {}, {})", op, left.get(), right.get())
  512|       |            }
  513|      0|            NodeKind::TernaryOp(cond, then, else_) => {
  514|      0|                writeln!(f, "TernaryOp({}, {}, {})", cond.get(), then.get(), else_.get())
  515|       |            }
  516|      0|            NodeKind::PostIncrement(expr) => writeln!(f, "PostIncrement({})", expr.get()),
  517|      0|            NodeKind::PostDecrement(expr) => writeln!(f, "PostDecrement({})", expr.get()),
  518|      0|            NodeKind::Assignment(op, lhs, rhs) => {
  519|      0|                writeln!(f, "Assignment({:?}, {}, {})", op, lhs.get(), rhs.get())
  520|       |            }
  521|      0|            NodeKind::FunctionCall(call_expr) => {
  522|      0|                let start = call_expr.arg_start.get();
  523|      0|                if call_expr.arg_len > 0 {
  524|      0|                    let last = start + call_expr.arg_len as u32 - 1;
  525|      0|                    writeln!(
  526|      0|                        f,
  527|      0|                        "FunctionCall(callee={}, args={}..{})",
  528|      0|                        call_expr.callee.get(),
  529|       |                        start,
  530|       |                        last
  531|       |                    )
  532|       |                } else {
  533|      0|                    writeln!(f, "FunctionCall(callee={}, args=[])", call_expr.callee.get())
  534|       |                }
  535|       |            }
  536|       |
  537|      0|            NodeKind::MemberAccess(obj, field, is_arrow) => writeln!(
  538|      0|                f,
  539|      0|                "MemberAccess({}, {}, {})",
  540|      0|                obj.get(),
  541|       |                field,
  542|      0|                if *is_arrow { "->" } else { "." }
  543|       |            ),
  544|      0|            NodeKind::IndexAccess(array, index) => {
  545|      0|                writeln!(f, "IndexAccess({}, {})", array.get(), index.get())
  546|       |            }
  547|      0|            NodeKind::Cast(ty, expr) => writeln!(f, "Cast({}, {})", ty, expr.get()),
  548|      0|            NodeKind::SizeOfExpr(expr) => writeln!(f, "SizeOfExpr({})", expr.get()),
  549|      0|            NodeKind::SizeOfType(ty) => writeln!(f, "SizeOfType({})", ty),
  550|      0|            NodeKind::AlignOf(ty) => writeln!(f, "AlignOf({})", ty),
  551|      0|            NodeKind::CompoundLiteral(ty, init) => {
  552|      0|                writeln!(f, "CompoundLiteral({}, {})", ty, init.get())
  553|       |            }
  554|      0|            NodeKind::BuiltinVaArg(ty, expr) => {
  555|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaArg({}, {})", ty, expr.get())
  556|       |            }
  557|      0|            NodeKind::BuiltinVaStart(ap, last) => {
  558|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaStart({}, {})", ap.get(), last.get())
  559|       |            }
  560|      0|            NodeKind::BuiltinVaEnd(ap) => {
  561|      0|                writeln!(f, "BuiltinVaEnd({})", ap.get())

  570|      0|                let start = args_start.get();

  580|      0|                let start = gs.assoc_start.get();

  582|      0|                    let last = start + gs.assoc_len as u32 - 1;

  584|      0|                        f,

  619|      0|            NodeKind::If(if_stmt) => writeln!(

  704|       |            }
  705|      0|            NodeKind::EnumConstant(name, value) => writeln!(

   80|       |/// Parse hexadecimal floating-point literal (C99/C11)
   81|      0|fn parse_hex_float_literal(text: &str) -> Option<f64> {
   82|       |    // Format: 0[xX][hexdigits][.hexdigits][pP[+|-]digits][fFlL]
   83|      0|    let mut chars = text.chars().peekable();
   84|       |
   85|       |    // Skip "0x"
   86|      0|    if chars.next() != Some('0') {
   87|      0|        return None;
   88|      0|    }
   89|      0|    let x = chars.next()?;
   90|      0|    if x != 'x' && x != 'X' {
   91|      0|        return None;
   92|      0|    }
   93|       |
   94|      0|    let mut result = 0.0f64;
   95|      0|    let mut exponent = 0i32;
   96|      0|    let mut has_dot = false;
   97|      0|    let mut fraction_digits = 0;
   98|      0|    let mut has_digits = false;
   99|       |
  100|       |    // Parse significand
  101|      0|    while let Some(&c) = chars.peek() {
  102|      0|        if let Some(digit) = c.to_digit(16) {
  103|      0|            result = result * 16.0 + digit as f64;
  104|      0|            if has_dot {
  105|      0|                fraction_digits += 1;
  106|      0|            }
  107|      0|            has_digits = true;
  108|      0|            chars.next();
  109|      0|        } else if c == '.' {
  110|      0|            if has_dot {
  111|      0|                return None;
  112|      0|            } // Double dot
  113|      0|            has_dot = true;
  114|      0|            chars.next();
  115|      0|        } else if c == 'p' || c == 'P' {
  116|      0|            break;
  117|       |        } else {
  118|      0|            return None; // Invalid character
  119|       |        }
  120|       |    }
  121|       |
  122|      0|    if !has_digits {
  123|      0|        return None;
  124|      0|    }
  125|       |
  126|       |    // Parse exponent
  127|      0|    if let Some('p' | 'P') = chars.peek() {
  128|      0|        chars.next();
  129|      0|        let mut exp_sign = 1;
  130|      0|        if let Some(&c) = chars.peek() {
  131|      0|            if c == '-' {
  132|      0|                exp_sign = -1;
  133|      0|                chars.next();
  134|      0|            } else if c == '+' {
  135|      0|                chars.next();
  136|      0|            }
  137|      0|        }
  138|       |
  139|      0|        let mut exp_val = 0i32;
  140|      0|        let mut has_exp_digits = false;
  141|      0|        while let Some(&c) = chars.peek() {
  142|      0|            if let Some(d) = c.to_digit(10) {
  143|      0|                exp_val = exp_val.checked_mul(10)?.checked_add(d as i32)?;
  144|      0|                has_exp_digits = true;
  145|      0|                chars.next();
  146|       |            } else {
  147|      0|                break;
  148|       |            }
  149|       |        }
  150|      0|        if !has_exp_digits {
  151|      0|            return None;
  152|      0|        }
  153|      0|        exponent = exp_val * exp_sign;
  154|      0|    }
  155|       |
  156|       |    // Apply adjustments
  157|      0|    if fraction_digits > 0 {
  158|      0|        result /= 16.0f64.powi(fraction_digits);
  159|      0|    }
  160|      0|    if exponent != 0 {
  161|      0|        result *= 2.0f64.powi(exponent);
  162|      0|    }
  163|       |
  164|      0|    Some(result)
  165|      0|}

  320|       |

   36|       |    },
   37|       |

   42|       |    InvalidUnaryOperator { span: SourceSpan },

   47|       |
   48|       |impl ParseError {
   49|      0|    pub(crate) fn span(&self) -> SourceSpan {

  493|       |impl ErrorFormatter {
  494|      0|    fn format_location(&self, diag: &Diagnostic, source_manager: &SourceManager) -> String {
  495|      0|        let path = source_manager
  496|      0|            .get_file_info(diag.span.source_id())
  497|      0|            .map(|fi| fi.path.to_str().unwrap_or("<unknown>"))
  498|      0|            .unwrap_or("<unknown>");
  499|       |
  500|       |        // Get line and column information
  501|      0|        let line_col = source_manager.get_line_column(diag.span.start());
  502|      0|        if let Some((line, col)) = line_col {
  503|      0|            format!("{}:{}:{}", path, line, col)
  504|       |        } else {
  505|      0|            path.to_string()
  506|       |        }
  507|      0|    }
  508|       |
  509|      0|    fn level<'a>(&self, diag: &Diagnostic) -> Level<'a> {
  510|      0|        match diag.level {
  511|      0|            DiagnosticLevel::Error => Level::ERROR,
  512|      0|            DiagnosticLevel::Warning => Level::WARNING,
  513|      0|            DiagnosticLevel::Note => Level::NOTE,
  514|       |        }
  515|      0|    }
  516|       |
  517|      0|    fn create_snippet<'a>(
  518|      0|        &self,
  519|      0|        span: SourceSpan,
  520|      0|        message: &'a str,
  521|      0|        source_manager: &'a SourceManager,

  528|      0|            .unwrap_or("<unknown>");

  531|       |

  536|      0|                .span(span.start().offset() as usize..span.end().offset() as usize)

  539|       |
  540|      0|        snippet
  541|      0|    }

  543|       |    /// Format a single diagnostic with rich source code context
  544|      0|    fn format_diagnostic(&self, diag: &Diagnostic, source_manager: &SourceManager) -> String {
  545|      0|        let renderer = if self.use_colors {
  546|      0|            Renderer::styled().decor_style(DecorStyle::Unicode)
  547|       |        } else {
  548|      0|            Renderer::plain()
  549|       |        };
  550|       |
  551|       |        // If it's a built-in source ID (e.g. command line define), simple print
  552|      0|        if diag.span.is_source_id_builtin() {
  553|      0|            return format!("{}: {}", self.format_location(diag, source_manager), diag.message);
  554|      0|        }
  555|       |
  556|       |        // Primary error snippet
  557|      0|        let snippet = self.create_snippet(diag.span, &diag.message, source_manager);
  558|       |        // Use primary_title instead of title
  559|      0|        let mut group = self.level(diag).primary_title(&diag.message).element(snippet);
  560|       |
  561|      0|        for hint in &diag.hints {
  562|      0|            group = group.element(Level::HELP.message(hint));
  563|      0|        }
  564|       |
  565|       |        // Handle macro expansion history
  566|       |        // We must collect strings first to ensure they live long enough for the snippets
  567|      0|        let mut expansion_history = Vec::new();
  568|      0|        let mut current_id = diag.span.source_id();
  569|       |
  570|      0|        while let Some(file_info) = source_manager.get_file_info(current_id) {
  571|      0|            if let Some(include_loc) = file_info.include_loc {
  572|       |                // Determine if this is a macro expansion (virtual file) or an include
  573|      0|                let is_macro = file_info.path.to_str().is_some_and(|s| s.starts_with("<macro_"));
  574|      0|                let note_msg = if is_macro {
  575|      0|                    let macro_name = file_info
  576|      0|                        .path
  577|      0|                        .to_str()
  578|      0|                        .unwrap()
  579|      0|                        .trim_start_matches("<macro_")
  580|      0|                        .trim_end_matches('>');
  581|      0|                    format!("expanded from macro '{}'", macro_name)
  582|       |                } else {
  583|      0|                    "included from here".to_string()
  584|       |                };
  585|       |
  586|       |                // For visualization, use a 1-char span at the include/expansion location
  587|      0|                let exp_span = SourceSpan::new_with_length(include_loc.source_id(), include_loc.offset(), 1);
  588|      0|                expansion_history.push((exp_span, note_msg));
  589|       |
  590|      0|                current_id = include_loc.source_id();
  591|       |            } else {
  592|      0|                break;
  593|       |            }
  594|       |        }
  595|       |
  596|      0|        for (span, msg) in &expansion_history {
  597|      0|            let exp_snippet = self.create_snippet(*span, msg, source_manager);
  598|      0|            group = group.element(exp_snippet);
  599|      0|        }
  600|       |
  601|      0|        let report = &[group];
  602|      0|        renderer.render(report).to_string()
  603|      0|    }
  604|       |
  605|       |    /// Print all diagnostics to stderr
  606|      0|    pub(crate) fn print_diagnostics(&self, diagnostics: &[Diagnostic], source_manager: &SourceManager) {
  607|      0|        for diag in diagnostics {
  608|      0|            let formatted = self.format_diagnostic(diag, source_manager);
  609|      0|            eprintln!("{}", formatted);
  610|      0|        }
  611|      0|    }

   17|      0|                    std::process::exit(1);
   18|       |                }
   19|       |            }
   20|       |        }
   21|      0|        Err(e) => {

    1|       |//! Mid-level Intermediate Representation (MIR) for C11 compiler.
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the MIR data structures and APIs for representing
    4|       |//! C11 programs after semantic analysis. The MIR is designed to be:
    5|       |//! - Typed: All entities have explicit types
    6|       |//! - Explicit: All C semantics are made explicit
    7|       |//! - Cranelift-friendly: Easy to lower to Cranelift IR
    8|       |//! - Non-SSA: Uses basic blocks with explicit control flow
    9|       |
   10|       |use hashbrown::HashMap;

  626|       |    /// Set the terminator for the current block
  627|      0|    pub(crate) fn set_terminator(&mut self, terminator: Terminator) {

  629|      0|            && let Some(block) = self.blocks.get_mut(&block_id)

   39|       |/// Returns None for void types, as they don't have a representation in Cranelift
   40|      0|fn convert_type(mir_type: &MirType) -> Option<Type> {
   41|      0|    match mir_type {
   42|      0|        MirType::Void => None,
   43|      0|        MirType::Bool => Some(types::I8), // Booleans as i8 (standard C)
   44|       |
   45|      0|        MirType::I8 | MirType::U8 => Some(types::I8),
   46|      0|        MirType::I16 | MirType::U16 => Some(types::I16),
   47|      0|        MirType::I32 | MirType::U32 => Some(types::I32),
   48|      0|        MirType::I64 | MirType::U64 => Some(types::I64),
   49|      0|        MirType::F32 => Some(types::F32),
   50|      0|        MirType::F64 => Some(types::F64),
   51|      0|        MirType::F80 | MirType::F128 => Some(types::F128),
   52|      0|        MirType::Pointer { .. } => Some(types::I64), // Pointers are 64-bit on most modern systems
   53|       |
   54|      0|        MirType::Array { .. } | MirType::Record { .. } => None,
   55|      0|        MirType::Function { .. } => Some(types::I64), // Function pointers
   56|       |    }

   79|      0|        MirType::Array { layout, .. } => Ok(layout.size as u32),
   80|      0|        MirType::Record { layout, .. } => Ok(layout.size as u32),
   81|      0|        MirType::Bool => Ok(1),
   82|      0|        MirType::Void => Ok(0),

   84|      0|        _ => Ok(4), // Default size for other types

  147|      0|fn f64_to_f128_bytes(val: f64) -> [u8; 16] {
  148|      0|    let bits = val.to_bits();
  149|      0|    let sign = (bits >> 63) & 1;
  150|      0|    let exp = (bits >> 52) & 0x7FF;
  151|      0|    let mant = bits & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF;
  152|       |
  153|      0|    let (new_exp, new_mant) = if exp == 0 {
  154|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  155|       |            // Zero
  156|      0|            (0, 0)
  157|       |        } else {
  158|       |            // Subnormal f64 -> Normal f128
  159|       |            // mant is 0.bbbb... (52 bits)
  160|      0|            let lz = mant.leading_zeros() - (64 - 52);
  161|      0|            let shift = lz + 1;
  162|      0|            let normalized_mant = mant << shift;
  163|      0|            let payload = normalized_mant & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF; // 52 bits
  164|       |
  165|      0|            let unbiased_exp = -1022 - (shift as i32);
  166|      0|            let biased_exp = unbiased_exp + 16383;
  167|       |
  168|      0|            (biased_exp as u64, (payload as u128) << (112 - 52))
  169|       |        }
  170|      0|    } else if exp == 0x7FF {
  171|       |        // Inf or NaN
  172|      0|        (0x7FFF, (mant as u128) << (112 - 52))
  173|       |    } else {
  174|       |        // Normal
  175|      0|        let unbiased_exp = (exp as i32) - 1023;
  176|      0|        let biased_exp = unbiased_exp + 16383;
  177|      0|        (biased_exp as u64, (mant as u128) << (112 - 52))
  178|       |    };
  179|       |
  180|      0|    let sign_bit = (sign as u128) << 127;
  181|      0|    let exp_bits = (new_exp as u128) << 112;
  182|      0|    let mant_bits = new_mant;
  183|       |
  184|      0|    let result = sign_bit | exp_bits | mant_bits;
  185|      0|    result.to_le_bytes()
  186|      0|}
  187|       |
  188|      0|fn f64_to_x87_bytes(val: f64) -> [u8; 16] {
  189|      0|    let bits = val.to_bits();
  190|      0|    let sign = (bits >> 63) & 1;
  191|      0|    let exp = (bits >> 52) & 0x7FF;
  192|      0|    let mant = bits & 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFF;
  193|       |
  194|      0|    let mut out = [0u8; 16];
  195|       |
  196|      0|    if exp == 0 {
  197|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  198|       |            // Zero
  199|      0|            if sign == 1 {
  200|      0|                out[9] = 0x80;
  201|      0|            }
  202|      0|            return out;
  203|      0|        }
  204|       |
  205|       |        // Subnormal f64
  206|       |        // Calculate leading zeros in the 52-bit mantissa
  207|       |        // 12 zeros because u64 has 64 bits but mant only 52
  208|      0|        let lz = mant.leading_zeros() - 12;
  209|       |
  210|       |        // Shift to make MSB 1 (integer bit for x87)
  211|       |        // We want to put the first '1' at bit 63.
  212|       |        // Currently it is at (51 - lz).
  213|       |        // Shift left by 63 - (51 - lz) = 12 + lz.
  214|      0|        let new_mant = mant << (12 + lz);
  215|       |
  216|       |        // Exponent calculation
  217|       |        // Real exponent of f64 subnormal is -1022.
  218|       |        // We effectively shifted left by (lz + 1) to normalize (because we moved 0.1... to 1.0...)
  219|       |        // So we must subtract (lz + 1) from exponent.
  220|      0|        let real_exp = -1022 - (lz as i32 + 1);
  221|       |
  222|       |        // x87 bias 16383
  223|      0|        let new_exp_biased = (real_exp + 16383) as u16;
  224|       |
  225|      0|        out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  226|      0|        out[8..10].copy_from_slice(&new_exp_biased.to_le_bytes());
  227|      0|        if sign == 1 {
  228|      0|            out[9] |= 0x80;
  229|      0|        }
  230|      0|        return out;
  231|      0|    } else if exp == 0x7FF {
  232|       |        // Inf or NaN
  233|      0|        out[8] = 0xFF;
  234|      0|        out[9] = 0x7F | ((sign as u8) << 7);
  235|       |
  236|      0|        if mant == 0 {
  237|      0|            // Infinity: Integer bit 1, mantissa 0
  238|      0|            out[7] = 0x80;
  239|      0|        } else {
  240|      0|            // NaN: Set integer bit 1
  241|      0|            // f64 mantissa is 52 bits. x87 is 63 bits.
  242|      0|            // Shift left by 11.
  243|      0|            let new_mant = (1u64 << 63) | (mant << 11);
  244|      0|            out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  245|      0|        }
  246|      0|        return out;
  247|      0|    }
  248|       |
  249|       |    // Normal f64
  250|      0|    let unbiased_exp = (exp as i32) - 1023;
  251|      0|    let new_exp = (unbiased_exp + 16383) as u16;
  252|       |
  253|       |    // Explicit integer bit 1 for Normal numbers in x87
  254|      0|    let new_mant = (1u64 << 63) | (mant << 11);
  255|       |
  256|      0|    out[0..8].copy_from_slice(&new_mant.to_le_bytes());
  257|      0|    out[8..10].copy_from_slice(&new_exp.to_le_bytes());
  258|       |
  259|       |    // Sign bit in byte 9, bit 7
  260|      0|    if sign == 1 {
  261|      0|        out[9] |= 0x80;
  262|      0|    }
  263|       |
  264|      0|    out
  265|      0|}

  294|       |/// Helper to emit struct constants
  295|      0|fn emit_const_struct(
  296|      0|    fields: &[(usize, ConstValueId)],
  297|      0|    ty: &MirType,
  298|      0|    output: &mut Vec<u8>,
  299|      0|    ctx: &EmitContext,
  300|      0|    mut module: Option<&mut ObjectModule>,
  301|      0|    mut data_description: Option<&mut DataDescription>,
  302|      0|    base_offset: u32,
  303|      0|) -> Result<(), String> {
  304|      0|    match ty {
  305|       |        MirType::Record {
  306|      0|            layout: record_layout,
  307|       |            field_types: _,
  308|       |            ..
  309|       |        } => {
  310|       |            // Initialize the entire struct with zeros
  311|      0|            let struct_size = record_layout.size as usize;
  312|      0|            let mut struct_bytes = vec![0u8; struct_size];
  313|       |
  314|       |            // Emit each field at its proper offset
  315|      0|            for (field_index, field_const_id) in fields {
  316|      0|                if *field_index < record_layout.field_offsets.len() {
  317|      0|                    let field_offset = record_layout.field_offsets[*field_index] as usize;
  318|       |
  319|      0|                    let mut field_bytes = Vec::new();

  321|      0|                        *field_const_id,
  322|      0|                        &mut field_bytes,
  323|      0|                        ctx,
  324|      0|                        reborrow_module(&mut module),
  325|      0|                        reborrow_data_description(&mut data_description),
  326|      0|                        base_offset + field_offset as u32,
  327|      0|                    )?;
  328|       |
  329|       |                    // Copy the field bytes into the struct buffer
  330|      0|                    let required_size = field_offset + field_bytes.len();
  331|      0|                    if required_size > struct_bytes.len() {
  332|      0|                        struct_bytes.resize(required_size, 0);
  333|      0|                    }
  334|      0|                    struct_bytes[field_offset..field_offset + field_bytes.len()].copy_from_slice(&field_bytes);
  335|      0|                }
  336|       |            }
  337|      0|            output.extend_from_slice(&struct_bytes);
  338|      0|            Ok(())
  339|       |        }
  340|      0|        _ => Err("StructLiteral with non-record type".to_string()),
  341|       |    }

  344|       |/// Helper to emit array constants
  345|      0|fn emit_const_array(
  346|      0|    elements: &[ConstValueId],
  347|      0|    ty: &MirType,
  348|      0|    output: &mut Vec<u8>,
  349|      0|    ctx: &EmitContext,
  350|      0|    mut module: Option<&mut ObjectModule>,
  351|      0|    mut data_description: Option<&mut DataDescription>,
  352|      0|    base_offset: u32,
  353|      0|) -> Result<(), String> {
  354|      0|    match ty {
  355|       |        MirType::Array {
  356|      0|            element,
  357|      0|            size,
  358|      0|            layout: array_layout,
  359|       |        } => {
  360|       |            // Emit each element according to the array layout
  361|      0|            for (i, element_const_id) in elements.iter().enumerate() {
  362|      0|                if i >= *size {
  363|      0|                    break; // Don't emit more elements than the array size
  364|      0|                }
  365|       |
  366|      0|                let element_type = ctx.mir.get_type(*element);
  367|      0|                let element_size = mir_type_size(element_type, ctx.mir)? as usize;
  368|       |
  369|       |                // Calculate offset for this element
  370|      0|                let element_offset = (i * array_layout.stride as usize) as u32;
  371|       |
  372|      0|                emit_const(
  373|      0|                    *element_const_id,
  374|      0|                    output,
  375|      0|                    ctx,
  376|      0|                    reborrow_module(&mut module),
  377|      0|                    reborrow_data_description(&mut data_description),
  378|      0|                    base_offset + element_offset,
  379|      0|                )?;
  380|       |
  381|       |                // Add padding if needed for stride > element size
  382|      0|                if array_layout.stride as usize > element_size {
  383|      0|                    let padding = array_layout.stride as usize - element_size;
  384|      0|                    output.extend_from_slice(&vec![0u8; padding]);
  385|      0|                }
  386|       |            }
  387|       |

  389|      0|            let emitted_size = elements.len() * array_layout.stride as usize;

  391|      0|                let remaining = array_layout.size as usize - emitted_size;
  392|      0|                output.extend_from_slice(&vec![0u8; remaining]);
  393|      0|            }
  394|      0|            Ok(())
  395|       |        }
  396|      0|        _ => Err("ArrayLiteral with non-array type".to_string()),
  397|       |    }

  454|      0|            Ok(())

  499|       |/// Returns Some(count) of I64 registers needed (max 2)
  500|      0|fn get_struct_packing(mir_type: &MirType, mir: &MirProgram) -> Option<usize> {

  507|      0|        return None;

  569|      0|            None => types::I32, // Should not happen for valid MIR
  570|       |        };
  571|      0|        sig.params.push(AbiParam::new(param_type));
  572|       |    }

  582|      0|                let num_slots = size.div_ceil(8) as usize; // Round up to nearest 8 bytes
  583|      0|                for _ in 0..num_slots {

  585|      0|                }

  588|       |

  611|      0|            }

  617|      0|        }
  618|       |

  621|      0|            if is_variadic && arg_type.is_int() && arg_type.bits() < 64 {

  636|      0|                for _ in 0..(total_variadic_slots - current_gpr_count) {

  638|      0|                }
  639|      0|            }
  640|      0|        }
  641|      0|    }

  646|       |/// Helper to resolve arguments for a call, handling variadic struct expansion if needed
  647|      0|fn resolve_call_args(
  648|      0|    args: &[Operand],
  649|      0|    fixed_param_count: usize,
  650|      0|    sig: &Signature,
  651|      0|    ctx: &mut BodyEmitContext,
  652|      0|    is_variadic: bool,
  653|      0|    split_f128: bool,
  654|      0|    triple: &Triple,
  655|      0|) -> Result<Vec<Value>, String> {
  656|      0|    let mut arg_values = Vec::new();
  657|      0|    let mut sig_idx = 0;
  658|      0|    let mut xmm_used = 0;
  659|       |
  660|       |    // Count XMM usage from fixed parameters first (checking signatures from ctx.mir logic if needed)
  661|       |    // But here we iterate all args. We need to distinguish fixed params.
  662|       |    // We can assume first `fixed_param_count` args match `sig`'s first params,
  663|       |    // but `sig` might have split params.
  664|       |    // Simpler: iterate fixed_param_count args and check types.
  665|      0|    for i in 0..fixed_param_count {
  666|      0|        if let Some(arg) = args.get(i)
  667|      0|            && let Ok(type_id) = get_operand_type_id(arg, ctx.mir)
  668|       |        {
  669|      0|            let mir_type = ctx.mir.get_type(type_id);
  670|      0|            if is_xmm_argument(mir_type) {
  671|      0|                xmm_used += 1;
  672|      0|            }
  673|      0|        }
  674|       |    }
  675|       |
  676|      0|    for (arg_idx, arg) in args.iter().enumerate() {
  677|      0|        if sig_idx >= sig.params.len() {
  678|      0|            break;
  679|      0|        }
  680|       |
  681|       |        // Check operand type
  682|      0|        let arg_type_id = get_operand_type_id(arg, ctx.mir).ok();
  683|       |
  684|       |        // Check for struct packing in fixed parameters
  685|      0|        if arg_idx < fixed_param_count
  686|      0|            && let Some(type_id) = arg_type_id
  687|      0|            && let Some(count) = get_struct_packing(ctx.mir.get_type(type_id), ctx.mir)
  688|       |        {
  689|       |            // Resolve struct to address
  690|      0|            let struct_addr = resolve_operand(arg, ctx, types::I64)?;
  691|      0|            let size = mir_type_size(ctx.mir.get_type(type_id), ctx.mir).unwrap_or(8u32);
  692|       |
  693|      0|            for i in 0..count {
  694|       |                // If it's the last chunk, we might need partial load
  695|      0|                let offset = (i * 8) as i32;
  696|      0|                let remaining = size.saturating_sub((i * 8) as u32);
  697|       |
  698|      0|                let val = if remaining >= 8 {
  699|      0|                    ctx.builder.ins().load(types::I64, MemFlags::new(), struct_addr, offset)
  700|       |                } else {
  701|       |                    // Partial load
  702|      0|                    let mut current_val = ctx.builder.ins().iconst(types::I64, 0);
  703|      0|                    for b in 0..remaining {
  704|      0|                        let byte_val =
  705|      0|                            ctx.builder
  706|      0|                                .ins()
  707|      0|                                .load(types::I8, MemFlags::new(), struct_addr, offset + b as i32);
  708|      0|                        let byte_ext = ctx.builder.ins().uextend(types::I64, byte_val);
  709|      0|                        let shift_amt = ctx.builder.ins().iconst(types::I64, (b * 8) as i64);
  710|      0|                        let shifted = ctx.builder.ins().ishl(byte_ext, shift_amt);
  711|      0|                        current_val = ctx.builder.ins().bor(current_val, shifted);
  712|      0|                    }
  713|      0|                    current_val
  714|       |                };
  715|      0|                arg_values.push(val);
  716|       |            }
  717|       |
  718|      0|            sig_idx += count;
  719|      0|            continue;
  720|      0|        }
  721|       |
  722|       |        // Check if F128 splitting is needed
  723|      0|        if split_f128
  724|      0|            && let Some(type_id) = arg_type_id
  725|      0|            && matches!(ctx.mir.get_type(type_id), MirType::F80 | MirType::F128)
  726|       |        {
  727|      0|            let val = resolve_operand(arg, ctx, types::F128)?;
  728|       |            // Split val into lo, hi by storing to stack and reloading
  729|      0|            let slot = ctx
  730|      0|                .builder
  731|      0|                .create_sized_stack_slot(StackSlotData::new(StackSlotKind::ExplicitSlot, 16, 0));
  732|      0|            ctx.builder.ins().stack_store(val, slot, 0);

  737|      0|            arg_values.push(hi);

 1070|       |/// Helper function to emit a type conversion in Cranelift
 1071|      0|fn emit_type_conversion(val: Value, from: Type, to: Type, is_signed: bool, builder: &mut FunctionBuilder) -> Value {
 1072|      0|    if from == to {
 1073|      0|        return val;
 1074|      0|    }
 1075|       |
 1076|       |    // Float to Float
 1077|      0|    if from.is_float() && to.is_float() {
 1078|      0|        let from_width = from.bits();
 1079|      0|        let to_width = to.bits();
 1080|      0|        if from_width < to_width {
 1081|      0|            return builder.ins().fpromote(to, val);
 1082|      0|        } else if from_width > to_width {
 1083|      0|            return builder.ins().fdemote(to, val);
 1084|       |        } else {
 1085|      0|            return val;
 1086|       |        }
 1087|      0|    }
 1088|       |
 1089|       |    // Integer to Float
 1090|      0|    if from.is_int() && to.is_float() {
 1091|      0|        return if is_signed {
 1092|      0|            builder.ins().fcvt_from_sint(to, val)
 1093|       |        } else {
 1094|      0|            builder.ins().fcvt_from_uint(to, val)
 1095|       |        };
 1096|      0|    }
 1097|       |
 1098|       |    // Float to Integer
 1099|      0|    if from.is_float() && to.is_int() {
 1100|      0|        let to_width = to.bits();
 1101|      0|        if to_width < 32 {
 1102|       |            // Cranelift x64 backend doesn't support fcvt_to_sint/uint for < 32-bit targets
 1103|       |            // Convert to I32 first, then reduce
 1104|      0|            let intermediate = if is_signed {
 1105|      0|                builder.ins().fcvt_to_sint(types::I32, val)
 1106|       |            } else {
 1107|      0|                builder.ins().fcvt_to_uint(types::I32, val)
 1108|       |            };
 1109|      0|            return builder.ins().ireduce(to, intermediate);
 1110|      0|        }
 1111|       |
 1112|      0|        return if is_signed {
 1113|      0|            builder.ins().fcvt_to_sint(to, val)
 1114|       |        } else {
 1115|      0|            builder.ins().fcvt_to_uint(to, val)
 1116|       |        };
 1117|      0|    }
 1118|       |
 1119|       |    // General Integer/Pointer/Bool conversions (Extension/Reduction/Bitcast)
 1120|      0|    let from_width = from.bits();
 1121|      0|    let to_width = to.bits();
 1122|       |
 1123|      0|    if from_width < to_width {
 1124|       |        // Extension
 1125|      0|        if is_signed {
 1126|      0|            builder.ins().sextend(to, val)
 1127|       |        } else {
 1128|      0|            builder.ins().uextend(to, val)
 1129|       |        }
 1130|      0|    } else if from_width > to_width {
 1131|       |        // Reduction
 1132|      0|        builder.ins().ireduce(to, val)
 1133|       |    } else {
 1134|       |        // Same width, diff types (e.g. I64 <-> F64 bitcast, or I32 <-> F32 bitcast, or Pointer types)
 1135|       |        // Note: Float bitcasts usually handled above if involving floats, but check standard bitcast rules.
 1136|       |        // Actually bitcast works for any same-sized types.
 1137|      0|        builder.ins().bitcast(to, MemFlags::new(), val)
 1138|       |    }

 1341|       |/// Helper function to resolve a MIR place to a Cranelift value
 1342|      0|fn resolve_place(place: &Place, ctx: &mut BodyEmitContext, expected_type: Type) -> Result<Value, String> {
 1343|      0|    match place {
 1344|      0|        Place::Local(local_id) => {
 1345|       |            // A local place is resolved by loading from its stack slot
 1346|      0|            if let Some(stack_slot) = ctx.stack_slots.get(local_id) {
 1347|      0|                Ok(ctx.builder.ins().stack_load(expected_type, *stack_slot, 0))
 1348|       |            } else {
 1349|      0|                Err(format!("Stack slot not found for local {}", local_id.get()))
 1350|       |            }
 1351|       |        }
 1352|      0|        Place::Global(_global_id) => {
 1353|       |            // First, get the memory address of the global.
 1354|      0|            let addr = resolve_place_to_addr(place, ctx)?;
 1355|       |
 1356|       |            // Then, load the value from that address.
 1357|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1358|       |        }
 1359|      0|        Place::Deref(operand) => {
 1360|       |            // The address is the value of the operand, so we load from that value
 1361|      0|            let addr = resolve_operand(operand, ctx, types::I64)?;
 1362|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1363|       |        }
 1364|      0|        Place::StructField(base_place, field_index) => {
 1365|       |            // Get the address of the struct field
 1366|      0|            let addr = resolve_place_to_addr(&Place::StructField(base_place.clone(), *field_index), ctx)?;
 1367|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1368|       |        }
 1369|      0|        Place::ArrayIndex(base_place, index_operand) => {
 1370|       |            // Get the address of the array element
 1371|      0|            let addr = resolve_place_to_addr(&Place::ArrayIndex(base_place.clone(), index_operand.clone()), ctx)?;
 1372|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().load(expected_type, MemFlags::new(), addr, 0))
 1373|       |        }
 1374|       |    }

 1377|       |/// Helper function to get the Cranelift Type of an operand
 1378|      0|fn get_operand_clif_type(operand: &Operand, mir: &MirProgram) -> Result<Type, String> {
 1379|      0|    match operand {
 1380|      0|        Operand::Constant(const_id) => {
 1381|      0|            let const_value = mir.constants.get(const_id).expect("constant id not found");
 1382|      0|            let mir_type = mir.get_type(const_value.ty);
 1383|       |
 1384|       |            // If we have a specific type for the constant, use that to determine the Cranelift type
 1385|      0|            if let Some(clif_type) = convert_type(mir_type) {
 1386|      0|                return Ok(clif_type);
 1387|      0|            }
 1388|       |
 1389|       |            // Fallback to kind-based determination if type is not convertible (e.g., struct/array)
 1390|      0|            match &const_value.kind {
 1391|       |                // Integer literals in MIR are typically used in integer-sized contexts
 1392|       |                // Default to I32 so common small integer constants (like `4`) match i32
 1393|       |                // places instead of being treated as 64-bit immediates.
 1394|      0|                ConstValueKind::Int(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1395|      0|                ConstValueKind::Float(_) => Ok(types::F64),
 1396|      0|                ConstValueKind::Bool(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1397|       |                // Null/Zero/Global addresses are pointer-sized
 1398|      0|                ConstValueKind::Null | ConstValueKind::Zero | ConstValueKind::GlobalAddress(_) => Ok(types::I64),
 1399|      0|                ConstValueKind::FunctionAddress(_) => Ok(types::I64),
 1400|      0|                ConstValueKind::StructLiteral(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1401|      0|                ConstValueKind::ArrayLiteral(_) => Ok(types::I32),
 1402|       |            }
 1403|       |        }
 1404|      0|        Operand::Copy(place) => {
 1405|      0|            let place_type_id = get_place_type_id(place, mir);
 1406|      0|            let place_type = mir.get_type(place_type_id);
 1407|      0|            if place_type.is_aggregate() {
 1408|      0|                return Ok(types::I64);
 1409|      0|            }
 1410|      0|            convert_type(place_type).ok_or_else(|| format!("Unsupported place type: {:?}", place_type))
 1411|       |        }
 1412|      0|        Operand::Cast(type_id, _) => {
 1413|      0|            let mir_type = mir.get_type(*type_id);
 1414|      0|            if mir_type.is_aggregate() {
 1415|      0|                return Ok(types::I64);
 1416|      0|            }
 1417|      0|            Ok(convert_type(mir_type).unwrap_or(types::I32))
 1418|       |        }
 1419|      0|        Operand::AddressOf(_) => Ok(types::I64), // AddressOf always returns a pointer
 1420|       |    }
 1421|      0|}

 1423|       |/// Helper function to check if a MIR type is signed
 1424|      0|fn is_operand_signed(operand: &Operand, mir: &MirProgram) -> bool {
 1425|      0|    match operand {
 1426|      0|        Operand::Copy(place) => mir.get_type(get_place_type_id(place, mir)).is_signed(),
 1427|      0|        Operand::Cast(type_id, _) => mir.get_type(*type_id).is_signed(),
 1428|      0|        Operand::Constant(const_id) => {
 1429|      0|            let const_val = mir.constants.get(const_id).expect("constant id not found");
 1430|      0|            mir.get_type(const_val.ty).is_signed()
 1431|       |        }
 1432|      0|        _ => false,
 1433|       |    }

 1436|       |/// Helper function to get the TypeId of an operand
 1437|      0|fn get_operand_type_id(operand: &Operand, mir: &MirProgram) -> Result<TypeId, String> {
 1438|      0|    match operand {
 1439|      0|        Operand::Constant(const_id) => {
 1440|      0|            let const_value = mir.constants.get(const_id).expect("constant id not found");
 1441|      0|            Ok(const_value.ty)
 1442|       |        }
 1443|      0|        Operand::Copy(place) => Ok(get_place_type_id(place, mir)),
 1444|      0|        Operand::Cast(type_id, _) => Ok(*type_id),
 1445|      0|        Operand::AddressOf(place) => {
 1446|       |            // AddressOf returns a pointer to the place's type.
 1447|       |            // We need to find or create this pointer type in MIR.
 1448|       |            // Actually, for PtrAdd scaling, we only care about the base type of the pointer.
 1449|      0|            let place_type_id = get_place_type_id(place, mir);
 1450|       |            // We need the TypeId for ptr<place_type_id>
 1451|       |            // Let's see if we can find it in the type table.
 1452|      0|            for (id, ty) in &mir.types {
 1453|      0|                if let MirType::Pointer { pointee } = ty
 1454|      0|                    && *pointee == place_type_id
 1455|       |                {
 1456|      0|                    return Ok(*id);
 1457|      0|                }
 1458|       |            }
 1459|      0|            Err("Pointer type not found in MIR types".to_string())
 1460|       |        }
 1461|       |    }
 1462|      0|}

 1464|       |/// Helper function to get the TypeId of a place
 1465|      0|fn get_place_type_id(place: &Place, mir: &MirProgram) -> TypeId {
 1466|      0|    match place {
 1467|      0|        Place::Local(local_id) => mir.get_local(*local_id).type_id,
 1468|      0|        Place::Global(global_id) => mir.get_global(*global_id).type_id,
 1469|      0|        Place::Deref(operand) => {
 1470|       |            // To get the type of a dereference, we need the type of the operand,
 1471|       |            // which should be a pointer. The resulting type is the pointee.
 1472|      0|            let operand_type_id = get_operand_type_id(operand, mir).unwrap();
 1473|      0|            let operand_type = mir.get_type(operand_type_id);
 1474|      0|            match operand_type {
 1475|      0|                MirType::Pointer { pointee } => *pointee,
 1476|      0|                _ => panic!("Cannot determine type for deref operand"),
 1477|       |            }
 1478|       |        }
 1479|      0|        Place::StructField(base_place, field_index) => {
 1480|      0|            let base_type_id = get_place_type_id(base_place, mir);
 1481|      0|            let base_type = mir.get_type(base_type_id);
 1482|      0|            match base_type {
 1483|      0|                MirType::Record { field_types, .. } => field_types.get(*field_index).copied().unwrap(),
 1484|      0|                MirType::Pointer { pointee } => {
 1485|      0|                    let pointee_type = mir.get_type(*pointee);
 1486|      0|                    if let MirType::Record { field_types, .. } = pointee_type {
 1487|      0|                        field_types.get(*field_index).copied().unwrap()
 1488|       |                    } else {
 1489|      0|                        panic!("Base of StructField is not a struct type")
 1490|       |                    }
 1491|       |                }
 1492|      0|                _ => panic!("Base of StructField is not a struct type"),
 1493|       |            }
 1494|       |        }
 1495|      0|        Place::ArrayIndex(base_place, _) => {
 1496|      0|            let base_type_id = get_place_type_id(base_place, mir);
 1497|      0|            let base_type = mir.get_type(base_type_id);
 1498|      0|            match base_type {
 1499|      0|                MirType::Array { element, .. } => *element,
 1500|      0|                MirType::Pointer { pointee } => *pointee,
 1501|      0|                _ => panic!("Base of ArrayIndex is not an array or pointer"),
 1502|       |            }
 1503|       |        }
 1504|       |    }

 1507|       |/// Helper function to resolve a MIR place to a memory address
 1508|      0|fn resolve_place_to_addr(place: &Place, ctx: &mut BodyEmitContext) -> Result<Value, String> {
 1509|      0|    match place {
 1510|      0|        Place::Local(local_id) => {
 1511|      0|            if let Some(stack_slot) = ctx.stack_slots.get(local_id) {
 1512|      0|                Ok(ctx.builder.ins().stack_addr(types::I64, *stack_slot, 0))
 1513|       |            } else {
 1514|      0|                Err(format!("Stack slot not found for local {}", local_id.get()))
 1515|       |            }
 1516|       |        }
 1517|      0|        Place::Global(global_id) => {
 1518|      0|            let global = ctx.mir.get_global(*global_id);
 1519|      0|            let linkage = if global.initial_value.is_some() {
 1520|      0|                Linkage::Export
 1521|       |            } else {
 1522|      0|                Linkage::Import
 1523|       |            };
 1524|       |
 1525|      0|            let global_val = ctx
 1526|      0|                .module
 1527|      0|                .declare_data(global.name.as_str(), linkage, true, false)
 1528|      0|                .map_err(|e| format!("Failed to declare global data: {:?}", e))?;
 1529|      0|            let local_id = ctx.module.declare_data_in_func(global_val, ctx.builder.func);
 1530|       |            // Use I64 for addresses
 1531|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().global_value(types::I64, local_id))
 1532|       |        }
 1533|      0|        Place::Deref(operand) => {
 1534|       |            // The address is the value of the operand itself (which should be a pointer).
 1535|      0|            resolve_operand(operand, ctx, types::I64)
 1536|       |        }
 1537|      0|        Place::StructField(base_place, field_index) => {
 1538|       |            // Get the base address of the struct
 1539|      0|            let base_addr = resolve_place_to_addr(base_place, ctx)?;
 1540|       |
 1541|       |            // We need to find the type of the base_place to get the pre-computed field offset
 1542|      0|            let base_place_type_id = get_place_type_id(base_place, ctx.mir);
 1543|      0|            let base_type = ctx.mir.get_type(base_place_type_id);
 1544|       |
 1545|      0|            let (field_offset, is_pointer) = match base_type {
 1546|      0|                MirType::Record { layout, .. } => {
 1547|      0|                    let offset = layout
 1548|      0|                        .field_offsets
 1549|      0|                        .get(*field_index)
 1550|      0|                        .copied()
 1551|      0|                        .ok_or_else(|| format!("Field index {} out of bounds", field_index))?;
 1552|      0|                    (offset, false)
 1553|       |                }
 1554|      0|                MirType::Pointer { pointee } => {
 1555|      0|                    let pointee_type = ctx.mir.get_type(*pointee);
 1556|      0|                    if let MirType::Record { layout, .. } = pointee_type {
 1557|      0|                        let offset = layout
 1558|      0|                            .field_offsets
 1559|      0|                            .get(*field_index)
 1560|      0|                            .copied()
 1561|      0|                            .ok_or_else(|| format!("Field index {} out of bounds", field_index))?;
 1562|      0|                        (offset, true)
 1563|       |                    } else {
 1564|      0|                        return Err("Base of StructField is not a struct type".to_string());
 1565|       |                    }
 1566|       |                }
 1567|      0|                _ => return Err("Base of StructField is not a struct type".to_string()),
 1568|       |            };
 1569|       |
 1570|      0|            let final_addr = if is_pointer {
 1571|       |                // If the base is a pointer, we need to load the address it points to first
 1572|      0|                ctx.builder.ins().load(types::I64, MemFlags::new(), base_addr, 0)
 1573|       |            } else {
 1574|      0|                base_addr
 1575|       |            };
 1576|       |
 1577|      0|            let offset_val = ctx.builder.ins().iconst(types::I64, field_offset as i64);
 1578|      0|            Ok(ctx.builder.ins().iadd(final_addr, offset_val))
 1579|       |        }
 1580|      0|        Place::ArrayIndex(base_place, index_operand) => {
 1581|       |            // Get the base address of the array/pointer
 1582|      0|            let base_addr = resolve_place_to_addr(base_place, ctx)?;
 1583|       |
 1584|       |            // Resolve the index operand to a value
 1585|      0|            let index_val = resolve_operand(index_operand, ctx, types::I64)?;
 1586|       |
 1587|       |            // Determine the element size using pre-computed layout information
 1588|      0|            let base_place_type_id = get_place_type_id(base_place, ctx.mir);
 1589|      0|            let base_type = ctx.mir.get_type(base_place_type_id);
 1590|       |
 1591|       |            // If the base is a pointer, we must load the pointer value from the base address
 1592|       |            // before adding the element offset. For arrays, the base address is already
 1593|       |            // the address of the first element.
 1594|      0|            let (element_size, final_base_addr) = match base_type {
 1595|      0|                MirType::Array { layout, .. } => (layout.stride as u32, base_addr),
 1596|      0|                MirType::Pointer { pointee } => {
 1597|      0|                    let pointee_type = ctx.mir.get_type(*pointee);

 2321|      0|fn setup_signature(
 2322|      0|    func: &MirFunction,
 2323|      0|    mir: &MirProgram,
 2324|      0|    func_ctx: &mut Signature,
 2325|      0|) -> Result<(Option<Type>, Vec<Type>), String> {
 2326|       |    // Set up function signature using the actual return type from MIR
 2327|      0|    func_ctx.params.clear();
 2328|       |
 2329|       |    // Get the return type from MIR and convert to Cranelift type
 2330|      0|    let return_mir_type = mir.get_type(func.return_type);
 2331|      0|    let return_type_opt = match convert_type(return_mir_type) {
 2332|      0|        Some(t) => Some(t),
 2333|      0|        None if return_mir_type.is_aggregate() => Some(types::I64),
 2334|      0|        None => None, // Void
 2335|       |    };
 2336|       |
 2337|       |    // Add parameters from MIR function signature

 2344|      0|            for _ in 0..count {
 2345|      0|                func_ctx.params.push(AbiParam::new(types::I64));
 2346|      0|                param_types.push(types::I64);
 2347|      0|            }
 2348|      0|            continue;
 2349|      0|        }

 2351|      0|        if matches!(mir_type, MirType::F80 | MirType::F128) {
 2352|       |            // Split F128/F80 into 2 I64s for internal ABI

 2354|      0|            func_ctx.params.push(AbiParam::new(types::I64));
 2355|       |            // Track them as F128 in param_types for lower_function to know,
 2356|       |            // OR track split types? lower_function iterates MIR params.
 2357|       |            // It needs to know it consumes 2 slots.
 2358|       |            // We push F128 to param_types so lower_function knows the logic type.
 2359|       |            // BUT setup_signature return type `Vec<Type>` is used by lower_function

 2361|       |            // So we must push I64, I64 to param_types.
 2362|      0|            param_types.push(types::I64);
 2363|      0|            param_types.push(types::I64);
 2364|      0|            continue;
 2365|      0|        }
 2366|       |
 2367|      0|        let param_type = match convert_type(mir_type) {
 2368|      0|            Some(t) => t,
 2369|      0|            None if mir_type.is_aggregate() => types::I64,
 2370|      0|            None => return Err(format!("Unsupported parameter type for local {}", param_id.get())),
 2371|       |        };

 2373|      0|        param_types.push(param_type);
 2374|       |    }
 2375|       |
 2376|      0|    if func.is_variadic && matches!(func.kind, MirFunctionKind::Defined) {

 2378|       |        // This allows variadic functions to receive many struct args that expand to multiple I64s
 2379|      0|        let fixed_params_count = func.params.len();

 2381|      0|        if fixed_params_count < total_variadic_slots {
 2382|      0|            for _ in 0..(total_variadic_slots - fixed_params_count) {

 2384|      0|            }
 2385|      0|        }
 2386|      0|    }
 2387|       |
 2388|       |    // Only add return parameter if the function has a non-void return type
 2389|      0|    if let Some(return_type) = return_type_opt {
 2390|      0|        func_ctx.returns.push(AbiParam::new(return_type));

 2398|      0|    mir: &MirProgram,

 2413|      0|        if size > 0 {

 2415|      0|            clif_stack_slots.insert(local_id, slot);

 2615|       |        // Create a fresh context for this function

 2655|      0|                }

 2663|      0|                        for _ in 0..extra_count {

    1|       |//! MIR (Mid-level Intermediate Representation) Dumper
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides functionality to dump MIR in a human-readable format
    4|       |//! following the C11 compiler's specific conventions:
    5|       |//! - Local variables: %0, %1, %tmp3
    6|       |//! - Global variables: @g_var
    7|       |//! - Basic blocks: bb0, bb1
    8|       |//! - Constants: const 42, const null
    9|       |//! - Types: i8, i16, i32, i64, u8, u16, u32, u64, f32, f64, ptr<T>
   10|       |
   11|       |use std::fmt::Write;
   12|       |
   13|       |use super::{
   14|       |    BinaryFloatOp, CallTarget, ConstValueId, ConstValueKind, Global, GlobalId, LocalId, MirBlock, MirBlockId,
   15|       |    MirFunction, MirFunctionId, MirFunctionKind, MirStmt, MirType, Operand, Place, Rvalue, Terminator, TypeId,
   16|       |    UnaryFloatOp,
   17|       |};
   18|       |use crate::mir::MirProgram;
   19|       |
   20|       |/// Configuration for MIR dump output
   21|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
   22|       |pub struct MirDumpConfig {
   23|       |    pub include_header: bool,
   24|       |}

  131|      0|                    writeln!(output, "    {}: {}", local_name, local_type)?;
  132|      0|                }
  133|       |            }
  134|      0|            writeln!(output, "  }}")?;
  135|      0|        }
  136|       |

  140|      0|                self.dump_block(output, block_id, block)?;

  142|       |        }
  143|       |
  144|      0|        writeln!(output, "}}")?;
  145|      0|        Ok(())
  146|      0|    }

  172|      0|            MirType::U16 => format!("type {} = u16", type_name),

  174|      0|            MirType::U64 => format!("type {} = u64", type_name),
  175|      0|            MirType::F32 => format!("type {} = f32", type_name),

  190|      0|                is_variadic,

  245|       |
  246|      0|        Ok(())
  247|      0|    }

  262|       |

  264|      0|        write!(output, "    ")?;

  266|      0|        writeln!(output)?;
  267|       |
  268|      0|        Ok(())
  269|      0|    }

  271|       |    /// Dump a statement

  273|      0|        match stmt {
  274|      0|            MirStmt::Assign(place, rvalue) => {

  277|       |            }
  278|      0|            MirStmt::Store(operand, place) => {
  279|      0|                write!(output, "store ")?;

  283|      0|            MirStmt::Call { target, args, dest } => {

  295|       |            }
  296|      0|            MirStmt::Alloc(place, type_id) => {
  297|      0|                write!(

  303|       |            }
  304|      0|            MirStmt::Dealloc(operand) => {

  308|      0|            MirStmt::BuiltinVaStart(ap, last) => {
  309|      0|                write!(

  316|      0|            MirStmt::BuiltinVaEnd(ap) => {

  319|      0|            MirStmt::BuiltinVaCopy(dst, src) => {
  320|      0|                write!(
  321|      0|                    output,

  352|      0|                    self.block_to_string(*else_block)
  353|      0|                )?;
  354|       |            }
  355|      0|            Terminator::Return(operand) => match operand {
  356|      0|                Some(op) => {

  358|      0|                    self.dump_operand(output, op)?;

  364|       |            Terminator::Unreachable => {

  367|       |        }
  368|      0|        Ok(())
  369|      0|    }

  371|       |    /// Convert MIR type to string representation

  384|      0|                MirType::U8 => "u8".to_string(),

  386|      0|                MirType::U32 => "u32".to_string(),

  388|      0|                MirType::F32 => "f32".to_string(),
  389|      0|                MirType::F64 => "f64".to_string(),
  390|      0|                MirType::F80 => "f80".to_string(),

  420|      0|    }

  422|       |    /// Convert local ID to string representation

  433|      0|            None => format!("{}", local_id.get()),
  434|       |        };

  437|      0|    }

  470|       |    /// Try to format a constant as a string literal if applicable
  471|      0|    fn try_format_as_string_literal(&self, global_name: &str, const_id: ConstValueId) -> Option<String> {
  472|       |        // Only format as string if the global name starts with .L.str (our anonymous string literals)
  473|      0|        if !global_name.starts_with(".L.str") {
  474|      0|            return None;
  475|      0|        }
  476|       |
  477|      0|        if let Some(const_value) = self.mir.constants.get(&const_id)
  478|      0|            && let ConstValueKind::ArrayLiteral(elements) = &const_value.kind
  479|       |        {
  480|       |            // Try to convert the array elements to a string
  481|      0|            let mut string_content = String::new();
  482|       |
  483|      0|            for &element_id in elements {
  484|      0|                let element = self.mir.constants.get(&element_id).unwrap();
  485|      0|                if let ConstValueKind::Int(byte) = &element.kind {
  486|      0|                    let byte = *byte as u8;
  487|      0|                    if byte == 0 {
  488|       |                        // Null terminator - end of string
  489|      0|                        break;
  490|      0|                    }
  491|       |
  492|      0|                    match byte {

  557|      0|    }
