    1|       |//! MIR Validation Pass
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module implements a validation pass that ensures MIR is well-formed
    4|       |//! and ready for code generation. The validation pass checks:
    5|       |//! - All locals have types
    6|       |//! - All blocks end with a Terminator
    7|       |//! - No illegal operations remain
    8|       |//! - MIR is Cranelift-safe
    9|       |
   10|       |use crate::{
   11|       |    ast::NameId,
   12|       |    mir::{
   13|       |        BinaryFloatOp, BinaryIntOp, CallTarget, ConstValue, ConstValueId, ConstValueKind, GlobalId, LocalId,
   14|       |        MirBlockId, MirFunction, MirFunctionId, MirFunctionKind, MirProgram, MirStmt, MirStmtId, MirType, Operand,
   15|       |        Place, Rvalue, Terminator, TypeId, UnaryFloatOp, UnaryIntOp,
   16|       |    },
   17|       |};
   18|       |
   19|       |/// MIR Validation Error
   20|       |#[derive(Debug, PartialEq, Clone)]
   21|       |pub enum ValidationError {
   22|       |    /// Local variable is missing a type
   23|       |    LocalMissingType(LocalId),
   24|       |    /// Illegal operation found in MIR
   25|       |    IllegalOperation(String),
   26|       |    /// Type not found in type table
   27|       |    TypeNotFound(TypeId),
   28|       |    /// Local not found in local table
   29|       |    LocalNotFound(LocalId),
   30|       |    /// Global not found in global table
   31|       |    GlobalNotFound(GlobalId),
   32|       |    /// Function not found in function table
   33|       |    FunctionNotFound(MirFunctionId),
   34|       |    /// Block not found in block table
   35|       |    BlockNotFound(MirBlockId),
   36|       |    /// Statement not found in statement table
   37|       |    StatementNotFound(MirStmtId),
   38|       |    /// Invalid pointer arithmetic operation
   39|       |    InvalidPointerArithmetic,
   40|       |    /// Invalid cast operation
   41|       |    InvalidCast(TypeId, TypeId),
   42|       |    /// Function call argument type mismatch
   43|       |    FunctionCallArgTypeMismatch {
   44|       |        func_name: NameId,
   45|       |        arg_index: usize,
   46|       |        expected_type: TypeId,
   47|       |        actual_type: TypeId,
   48|       |    },
   49|       |    /// Constant value is out of range for its type

   53|       |        type_id: TypeId,
   54|       |    },

  104|       |/// MIR Validation Pass
  105|       |///
  106|       |/// This pass validates that MIR is well-formed and ready for code generation.
  107|       |/// It performs comprehensive checks but does not modify the MIR.
  108|       |pub struct MirValidator<'a> {
  109|       |    mir: &'a MirProgram,
  110|       |    errors: Vec<ValidationError>,
  111|       |}
  112|       |
  113|       |impl<'a> MirValidator<'a> {
  114|       |    /// Create a new MIR validator
  115|      0|    pub(crate) fn new(mir_program: &'a MirProgram) -> Self {
  116|      0|        Self {
  117|      0|            mir: mir_program,
  118|      0|            errors: Vec::new(),
  119|      0|        }
  120|      0|    }
  121|       |
  122|       |    /// Validate a MIR module
  123|       |    ///
  124|       |    /// Returns Ok(()) if validation passes, or Err(Vec<ValidationError>) if errors are found
  125|      0|    pub(crate) fn validate(mut self) -> Result<(), Vec<ValidationError>> {
  126|       |        // eprintln!("VALIDATE: Starting validation");
  127|      0|        self.errors.clear();
  128|       |
  129|       |        // Validate each function
  130|      0|        for func_id in &self.mir.module.functions {
  131|      0|            if let Some(func) = self.mir.functions.get(func_id) {
  132|      0|                self.validate_function(func);
  133|      0|            } else {
  134|      0|                self.errors.push(ValidationError::FunctionNotFound(*func_id));
  135|      0|            }
  136|       |        }
  137|       |
  138|       |        // Validate each global
  139|      0|        for global_id in &self.mir.module.globals {
  140|      0|            if self.mir.globals.get(global_id).is_none() {
  141|      0|                self.errors.push(ValidationError::GlobalNotFound(*global_id));
  142|      0|            }
  143|       |        }
  144|       |
  145|       |        // Validate each type - module.types is a Vec<MirType>, not HashMap<TypeId, MirType>
  146|       |        // So we validate that each type in the module is accessible via the types HashMap
  147|      0|        for (index, _) in self.mir.module.types.iter().enumerate() {
  148|      0|            let type_id = TypeId::new((index + 1) as u32).unwrap(); // Types are 1-indexed
  149|      0|            if !self.mir.types.contains_key(&type_id) {
  150|      0|                self.errors.push(ValidationError::TypeNotFound(type_id));
  151|      0|            }
  152|       |        }
  153|       |
  154|      0|        if self.errors.is_empty() {
  155|      0|            Ok(())
  156|       |        } else {
  157|      0|            Err(self.errors)
  158|       |        }
  159|      0|    }
  160|       |
  161|       |    /// Validate that a constant value can be cast to the target type
  162|      0|    fn validate_constant_cast(&mut self, const_id: ConstValueId, const_value: &ConstValue, target_type_id: TypeId) {
  163|      0|        let Some(target_ty) = self.mir.types.get(&target_type_id) else {
  164|      0|            return;
  165|       |        };
  166|      0|        let ConstValueKind::Int(value) = const_value.kind else {
  167|      0|            return;
  168|       |        };
  169|       |
  170|      0|        let (min, max) = match target_ty {
  171|      0|            MirType::I8 | MirType::U8 => (-128, 255),
  172|      0|            MirType::I16 | MirType::U16 => (-32_768, 65_535),
  173|      0|            MirType::I32 | MirType::U32 => (-2_147_483_648, 4_294_967_295),
  174|      0|            MirType::Bool => (0, 1),
  175|      0|            _ => return, // No validation for other types
  176|       |        };
  177|       |
  178|      0|        if value < min || value > max {
  179|      0|            self.errors.push(ValidationError::ConstantValueOutOfRange {
  180|      0|                const_id,
  181|      0|                value,
  182|      0|                type_id: target_type_id,
  183|      0|            });
  184|      0|        }
  185|      0|    }
  186|       |
  187|       |    /// Validate a function
  188|      0|    fn validate_function(&mut self, func: &MirFunction) {
  189|      0|        if func.name.as_str().is_empty() {
  190|      0|            self.errors.push(ValidationError::IllegalOperation(
  191|      0|                "Function name cannot be empty".to_string(),
  192|      0|            ));
  193|      0|        }
  194|       |
  195|      0|        if !self.mir.types.contains_key(&func.return_type) {
  196|      0|            self.errors.push(ValidationError::TypeNotFound(func.return_type));
  197|      0|        }
  198|       |
  199|       |        // Validate presence of locals (params + locals)
  200|      0|        for local_id in func.params.iter().chain(&func.locals) {
  201|      0|            if !self.mir.locals.contains_key(local_id) {
  202|      0|                self.errors.push(ValidationError::LocalNotFound(*local_id));
  203|      0|            }
  204|       |        }
  205|       |
  206|       |        // Validate presence of blocks (body + entry)
  207|      0|        for block_id in func.blocks.iter().chain(func.entry_block.as_ref()) {
  208|      0|            if !self.mir.blocks.contains_key(block_id) {
  209|      0|                self.errors.push(ValidationError::BlockNotFound(*block_id));
  210|      0|            }
  211|       |        }
  212|       |
  213|       |        // Validate items within blocks for defined functions
  214|      0|        if func.kind == MirFunctionKind::Defined {

  290|      0|            Rvalue::BinaryIntOp(bin, ..) => matches!(
  291|      0|                bin,
  292|       |                BinaryIntOp::Eq
  293|       |                    | BinaryIntOp::Ne
  294|       |                    | BinaryIntOp::Lt
  295|       |                    | BinaryIntOp::Le
  296|       |                    | BinaryIntOp::Gt
  297|       |                    | BinaryIntOp::Ge
  298|       |            ),

  300|      0|                bin,
  301|       |                BinaryFloatOp::Eq
  302|       |                    | BinaryFloatOp::Ne
  303|       |                    | BinaryFloatOp::Lt
  304|       |                    | BinaryFloatOp::Le
  305|       |                    | BinaryFloatOp::Gt
  306|       |                    | BinaryFloatOp::Ge
  307|       |            ),
  308|      0|            _ => false,
  309|       |        };
  310|       |
  311|      0|        is_flexible_op && self.mir.get_type(from).is_int() && self.mir.get_type(to).is_int()

  636|      0|                    self.errors.push(ValidationError::BlockNotFound(*else_bb));
  637|      0|                }
  638|       |            }
  639|      0|            Terminator::Return(op) => {
  640|      0|                if let Some(op) = op {
  641|      0|                    self.validate_operand(op);

  643|       |            }
  644|      0|            Terminator::Unreachable => {}
  645|       |        }
  646|      0|    }

  648|      0|    fn find_bool_type(&self) -> Option<TypeId> {
  649|      0|        for (id, ty) in &self.mir.types {
  650|      0|            if matches!(ty, MirType::Bool) {
  651|      0|                return Some(*id);
  652|      0|            }
  653|       |        }
  654|      0|        None
  655|      0|    }

  657|      0|    fn are_types_compatible(&self, t1: TypeId, t2: TypeId) -> bool {
  658|      0|        if t1 == t2 {
  659|      0|            return true;
  660|      0|        }
  661|       |
  662|      0|        let (Some(ty1), Some(ty2)) = (self.mir.types.get(&t1), self.mir.types.get(&t2)) else {
  663|      0|            return false;
  664|       |        };
  665|       |
  666|      0|        match (ty1, ty2) {
  667|      0|            (MirType::Pointer { pointee: p1 }, MirType::Pointer { pointee: p2 }) => self.are_types_compatible(*p1, *p2),
  668|       |            (
  669|       |                MirType::Array {
  670|      0|                    element: e1, size: s1, ..
  671|       |                },
  672|       |                MirType::Array {
  673|      0|                    element: e2, size: s2, ..
  674|       |                },
  675|      0|            ) => s1 == s2 && self.are_types_compatible(*e1, *e2),
  676|       |            (
  677|       |                MirType::Function {
  678|      0|                    return_type: r1,
  679|      0|                    params: p1,
  680|      0|                    is_variadic: v1,
  681|       |                },
  682|       |                MirType::Function {
  683|      0|                    return_type: r2,
  684|      0|                    params: p2,
  685|      0|                    is_variadic: v2,
  686|       |                },
  687|       |            ) => {
  688|      0|                v1 == v2
  689|      0|                    && p1.len() == p2.len()
  690|      0|                    && self.are_types_compatible(*r1, *r2)
  691|      0|                    && p1.iter().zip(p2).all(|(&a, &b)| self.are_types_compatible(a, b))
  692|       |            }
  693|      0|            _ => ty1 == ty2,
  694|       |        }
  695|      0|    }

/app/src/parser.rs:
    1|       |//! Parser module for C11 compiler
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the main parser coordination, public API, and state management.
    4|       |//! It orchestrates the parsing process by delegating to specialized sub-modules for
    5|       |//! different language constructs.
    6|       |
    7|       |use crate::ast::*;
    8|       |use crate::diagnostic::{DiagnosticEngine, ParseError};
    9|       |use crate::source_manager::{SourceLoc, SourceSpan};
   10|       |use log::debug;
   11|       |use std::collections::HashSet;
   12|       |
   13|       |pub mod declaration_core;

  252|      0|                    self.advance();

  254|      0|                    break;
  255|       |                }
  256|      0|                _ => {
  257|      0|                    self.advance();
  258|      0|                    any_advance = true;
  259|      0|                }
  260|       |            }
  261|       |        }
  262|       |

  264|      0|        if !any_advance {
  265|      0|            self.advance();
  266|      0|        }
  267|      0|    }

   23|       |/// Parse declaration specifiers
   24|      2|pub(crate) fn parse_declaration_specifiers(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<ThinVec<ParsedDeclSpecifier>, ParseError> {
   25|      2|    let mut specifiers = ThinVec::new();
   26|      2|    let mut has_type_specifier = false;
   27|      2|    let start_idx = parser.current_idx;
   28|       |
   29|      2|    debug!(
   30|      0|        "parse_declaration_specifiers: starting at position {}, token {:?}",
   31|       |        start_idx,
   32|      0|        parser.current_token_kind()
   33|       |    );
   34|       |
   35|      4|    while let Some(token) = parser.try_current_token() {
   36|      4|        debug!(
   37|      0|            "parse_declaration_specifiers: loop iteration at position {}, token {:?}",
   38|       |            parser.current_idx, token.kind
   39|       |        );
   40|      4|        match token.kind {
   41|       |            // Storage class specifiers
   42|       |            TokenKind::Typedef
   43|       |            | TokenKind::Extern
   44|       |            | TokenKind::Static
   45|       |            | TokenKind::Auto
   46|       |            | TokenKind::Register
   47|       |            | TokenKind::ThreadLocal => {
   48|      0|                let storage_class = match token.kind {
   49|       |                    TokenKind::Typedef => {
   50|      0|                        debug!("Found Typedef token, setting storage_class Typedef");
   51|      0|                        StorageClass::Typedef
   52|       |                    }
   53|      0|                    TokenKind::Extern => StorageClass::Extern,
   54|      0|                    TokenKind::Static => StorageClass::Static,
   55|      0|                    TokenKind::Auto => StorageClass::Auto,
   56|      0|                    TokenKind::Register => StorageClass::Register,
   57|      0|                    TokenKind::ThreadLocal => StorageClass::ThreadLocal,
   58|      0|                    _ => unreachable!(),

  338|       |/// Parse GCC __attribute__ syntax: __attribute__ (( attribute-list ))
  339|       |/// For now, we parse and skip the attribute construct
  340|      0|pub(crate) fn parse_attribute(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<(), ParseError> {
  341|      0|    debug!("parse_attribute: parsing __attribute__ construct");

  345|       |

  347|      0|    parser.expect(TokenKind::LeftParen)?;
  348|       |

  350|      0|    parser.expect(TokenKind::LeftParen)?;
  351|       |

  355|      0|        match token.kind {
  356|      0|            TokenKind::LeftParen => {
  357|      0|                paren_depth += 1;
  358|      0|            }
  359|       |            TokenKind::RightParen => {
  360|      0|                paren_depth -= 1;
  361|      0|                if paren_depth == 0 {
  362|      0|                    parser.advance();
  363|      0|                    break;
  364|      0|                }
  365|       |            }
  366|      0|            _ => {}
  367|       |        }
  368|      0|        parser.advance();
  369|       |    }
  370|       |
  371|      0|    debug!("parse_attribute: successfully parsed __attribute__ construct");

                                                        ^0

  347|       |                }
  348|       |            }
  349|       |        }
  350|       |    }
  351|       |
  352|      1|    let span = SourceSpan::new(start_loc, end_loc);
  353|      1|    let node = parser.replace_node(dummy, ParsedNodeKind::TranslationUnit(top_level_declarations), span);
  354|       |

   22|       |/// Look ahead past a GCC-style `__attribute__((...))` construct without consuming tokens.
   23|       |/// Returns the token immediately following the attribute if the structure is valid, or None.
   24|       |///
   25|       |/// Expects: Attribute (( ... ))
   26|      0|fn peek_past_attribute(parser: &Parser, mut start_offset: u32) -> Option<Token> {
   27|       |    // start_offset points to Attribute token
   28|       |    // Attribute should be followed by ((...))
   29|      0|    start_offset += 1;
   30|       |
   31|       |    // Expect ((
   32|      0|    let t1 = parser.peek_token(start_offset)?;
   33|      0|    if t1.kind != TokenKind::LeftParen {
   34|      0|        return None;
   35|      0|    }
   36|      0|    start_offset += 1;
   37|       |
   38|      0|    let t2 = parser.peek_token(start_offset)?;
   39|      0|    if t2.kind != TokenKind::LeftParen {
   40|      0|        return None;
   41|      0|    }
   42|      0|    start_offset += 1;
   43|       |
   44|       |    // Skip balanced parens
   45|      0|    let mut depth = 2; // We saw two LeftParens
   46|       |
   47|      0|    while depth > 0 {
   48|      0|        let t = parser.peek_token(start_offset)?;
   49|      0|        match t.kind {
   50|      0|            TokenKind::LeftParen => depth += 1,
   51|      0|            TokenKind::RightParen => depth -= 1,
   52|      0|            _ => {}
   53|       |        }
   54|      0|        start_offset += 1;
   55|       |    }
   56|       |
   57|       |    // Now we are past the attribute
   58|      0|    parser.peek_token(start_offset).cloned()
   59|      0|}

  470|       |/// Check if current token starts an abstract declarator

  476|      0|            TokenKind::LeftBracket => true, // array
  477|      1|            _ => false,
  478|       |        }

  480|      0|        false

  498|       |/// Parse abstract declarator (for type names without identifiers)
  499|      0|pub(crate) fn parse_abstract_declarator(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<ParsedDeclarator, ParseError> {
  500|      0|    debug!(
  501|      0|        "parse_abstract_declarator: starting at position {}, token {:?}",
  502|       |        parser.current_idx,
  503|      0|        parser.current_token_kind()
  504|       |    );
  505|       |
  506|       |    // Check for __attribute__ at the beginning (GCC extension)
  507|      0|    if parser.is_token(TokenKind::Attribute)
  508|      0|        && let Err(_e) = super::declaration_core::parse_attribute(parser)
  509|       |    {
  510|      0|        debug!("parse_abstract_declarator: failed to parse __attribute__: {:?}", _e);
  511|      0|    }
  512|       |
  513|       |    // Parse leading pointers and their qualifiers
  514|      0|    let declarator_chain = parse_leading_pointers(parser)?;
  515|       |
  516|       |    // Parse direct abstract declarator (parenthesized or array/function)
  517|      0|    let base_declarator = if let Some(token) = parser.try_current_token() {
  518|      0|        match token.kind {
  519|      0|            TokenKind::Identifier(symbol) => {
  520|      0|                if parser.is_type_name(symbol) {
  521|      0|                    parser.advance(); // consume type name
  522|       |                    // Check if next is identifier for named abstract declarator
  523|      0|                    if let Some(next_token) = parser.try_current_token() {
  524|      0|                        if let TokenKind::Identifier(name) = next_token.kind {
  525|      0|                            parser.advance(); // consume identifier
  526|      0|                            ParsedDeclarator::Identifier(name, TypeQualifiers::empty())
  527|       |                        } else {
  528|      0|                            ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  529|       |                        }
  530|       |                    } else {
  531|      0|                        ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  532|       |                    }
  533|       |                } else {
  534|      0|                    parser.advance(); // consume invalid identifier
  535|      0|                    ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  536|       |                }
  537|       |            }
  538|       |            TokenKind::Int => {
  539|      0|                parser.advance(); // consume int
  540|       |                // Check if next is identifier
  541|      0|                if let Some(next_token) = parser.try_current_token() {
  542|      0|                    if let TokenKind::Identifier(name) = next_token.kind {
  543|      0|                        parser.advance(); // consume identifier
  544|      0|                        ParsedDeclarator::Identifier(name, TypeQualifiers::empty())
  545|       |                    } else {
  546|      0|                        ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  547|       |                    }
  548|       |                } else {
  549|      0|                    ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  550|       |                }
  551|       |            }
  552|       |            TokenKind::LeftParen => {
  553|      0|                debug!("parse_abstract_declarator: found LeftParen");
  554|       |
  555|       |                // Check if this is likely a function parameter list start, e.g. `(int...)` or `(char...)`
  556|       |                // If so, we treat it as a function declarator applied to an empty abstract declarator,
  557|       |                // instead of consuming the paren as a parenthesized declarator.
  558|       |                // We also check for `()` which is an empty parameter list.
  559|      0|                let is_param_list_start = if let Some(next_token) = parser.peek_token(0) {
  560|      0|                    if next_token.kind == TokenKind::Attribute {
  561|       |                        // Disambiguate between `(ATTR *)` (parenthesized declarator) and `(ATTR int)` (param list).
  562|       |                        // If Attribute is followed by *, it's likely a parenthesized declarator.
  563|      0|                        if let Some(after_attr) = peek_past_attribute(parser, 0) {
  564|      0|                            after_attr.kind != TokenKind::Star
  565|       |                        } else {
  566|       |                            // Fallback if attribute syntax is weird
  567|      0|                            true
  568|       |                        }
  569|       |                    } else {
  570|      0|                        parser.is_type_name_start_token(next_token) || next_token.kind == TokenKind::RightParen
  571|       |                    }
  572|       |                } else {
  573|      0|                    false
  574|       |                };
  575|       |
  576|      0|                if is_param_list_start {
  577|       |                    // It's a suffix, e.g. `(int)` in `int (int)`.
  578|       |                    // We return Abstract so the trailing declarator parser picks it up as a function declarator.
  579|      0|                    ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  580|       |                } else {
  581|      0|                    parser.advance(); // Consume '('
  582|      0|                    if parser.accept(TokenKind::RightParen).is_some() {
  583|       |                        // This case is actually covered by is_param_list_start above,
  584|       |                        // but if we somehow got here (maybe peek failed?), handle it.
  585|       |                        // Although if peek failed, we probably hit EOF soon.
  586|      0|                        ParsedDeclarator::Function {
  587|      0|                            inner: Box::new(ParsedDeclarator::Abstract),
  588|      0|                            params: ThinVec::new(),
  589|      0|                            is_variadic: false,
  590|      0|                        }
  591|       |                    } else {
  592|      0|                        let start_idx = parser.current_idx;
  593|      0|                        let inner_declarator = parse_abstract_declarator(parser)?;
  594|      0|                        debug!(
  595|      0|                            "parse_abstract_declarator: inner declarator parsed, current token: {:?}",
  596|      0|                            parser.current_token_kind()
  597|       |                        );
  598|      0|                        if parser.accept(TokenKind::RightParen).is_some() {
  599|      0|                            inner_declarator
  600|       |                        } else {
  601|       |                            // Check if we're dealing with a function parameter syntax like "int (int)"
  602|       |                            // In this case, the closing paren might be part of the parameter list context
  603|      0|                            debug!(
  604|      0|                                "parse_abstract_declarator: expected RightParen but found {:?}, position: {}",
  605|      0|                                parser.current_token_kind(),
  606|       |                                parser.current_idx
  607|       |                            );
  608|       |                            // Try to parse as function declarator if we see another LeftParen
  609|      0|                            if parser.accept(TokenKind::LeftParen).is_some() {
  610|      0|                                debug!(
  611|      0|                                    "parse_abstract_declarator: found another LeftParen, treating as function declarator"
  612|       |                                );
  613|      0|                                let (parameters, is_variadic) = parse_function_parameters(parser)?;
  614|      0|                                parser.expect(TokenKind::RightParen)?; // Consume ')'
  615|      0|                                ParsedDeclarator::Function {
  616|      0|                                    inner: Box::new(inner_declarator),
  617|      0|                                    params: parameters,
  618|      0|                                    is_variadic,
  619|      0|                                }
  620|       |                            } else {
  621|       |                                // Roll back and try a different approach
  622|      0|                                parser.current_idx = start_idx;
  623|      0|                                ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  624|       |                            }
  625|       |                        }
  626|       |                    }
  627|       |                }
  628|       |            }
  629|       |            TokenKind::LeftBracket => {
  630|      0|                parser.advance(); // Consume '['
  631|      0|                let array_size = parse_array_size(parser)?;
  632|      0|                parser.expect(TokenKind::RightBracket)?; // Consume ']'
  633|      0|                ParsedDeclarator::Array(Box::new(ParsedDeclarator::Abstract), array_size)
  634|       |            }
  635|       |            TokenKind::Star => {
  636|      0|                parser.advance(); // Consume '*'
  637|      0|                let qualifiers = parse_type_qualifiers(parser)?;
  638|      0|                ParsedDeclarator::Pointer(qualifiers, Some(Box::new(ParsedDeclarator::Abstract)))
  639|       |            }
  640|       |            _ => {
  641|       |                // invalid token, don't consume
  642|      0|                ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  643|       |            }
  644|       |        }
  645|       |    } else {
  646|      0|        ParsedDeclarator::Abstract
  647|       |    };
  648|       |
  649|      0|    debug!(
  650|      0|        "parse_abstract_declarator: base_declarator parsed, current token {:?}",
  651|      0|        parser.current_token_kind()
  652|       |    );
  653|       |
  654|       |    // Parse trailing array and function declarators
  655|      0|    let current_base = parse_trailing_declarators_for_type_names(parser, base_declarator)?;
  656|       |
  657|       |    // Reconstruct the declarator chain in reverse order
  658|      0|    let final_declarator = reconstruct_declarator_chain(declarator_chain, current_base);
  659|       |
  660|      0|    Ok(final_declarator)

   25|       |/// Parse enumerator list
   26|      0|fn parse_enumerator_list(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<Vec<ParsedNodeRef>, ParseError> {
   27|      0|    let mut enumerators = Vec::new();

   31|      0|        enumerators.push(enumerator);
   32|       |

   34|      0|            break;
   35|      0|        }

   37|       |
   38|       |        // Allow trailing comma
   39|      0|        if parser.is_token(TokenKind::RightBrace) {
   40|      0|            break;

   42|       |    }
   43|       |

   54|       |    } else {
   55|      0|        None
   56|       |    };
   57|       |

    3|       |//! This module handles all expression parsing logic, including the Pratt parser

   14|       |/// Binding power for Pratt parser operator precedence
   15|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord)]
   16|       |pub(crate) struct BindingPower(u8);
   17|       |
   18|       |impl BindingPower {
   19|       |    pub(crate) const MIN: Self = Self(0);
   20|       |    pub const COMMA: Self = Self(2);
   21|       |    pub const ASSIGNMENT: Self = Self(4);
   22|       |    pub const CONDITIONAL: Self = Self(6);
   23|       |    pub const LOGICAL_OR: Self = Self(8);
   24|       |    pub const LOGICAL_AND: Self = Self(10);
   25|       |    pub const BITWISE_OR: Self = Self(12);
   26|       |    pub const BITWISE_XOR: Self = Self(14);
   27|       |    pub const BITWISE_AND: Self = Self(16);
   28|       |    pub const EQUALITY: Self = Self(18);
   29|       |    pub const RELATIONAL: Self = Self(20);
   30|       |    pub const SHIFT: Self = Self(22);

   48|       |impl PrattParser {
   49|      0|    fn get_binding_power(token_kind: TokenKind) -> Option<(BindingPower, Associativity)> {
   50|      0|        match token_kind {
   51|       |            // Assignment operators (right-associative)
   52|       |            TokenKind::Assign
   53|       |            | TokenKind::PlusAssign
   54|       |            | TokenKind::MinusAssign
   55|       |            | TokenKind::StarAssign
   56|       |            | TokenKind::DivAssign
   57|       |            | TokenKind::ModAssign
   58|       |            | TokenKind::AndAssign
   59|       |            | TokenKind::OrAssign
   60|       |            | TokenKind::XorAssign
   61|       |            | TokenKind::LeftShiftAssign
   62|      0|            | TokenKind::RightShiftAssign => Some((BindingPower::ASSIGNMENT, Associativity::Right)),
   63|       |
   64|       |            // Comma operator (left-associative, lowest precedence)
   65|      0|            TokenKind::Comma => Some((BindingPower::COMMA, Associativity::Left)),
   66|       |
   67|       |            // Conditional operator (right-associative)
   68|      0|            TokenKind::Question => Some((BindingPower::CONDITIONAL, Associativity::Right)),
   69|       |
   70|       |            // Logical operators (left-associative)
   71|      0|            TokenKind::LogicOr => Some((BindingPower::LOGICAL_OR, Associativity::Left)),
   72|      0|            TokenKind::LogicAnd => Some((BindingPower::LOGICAL_AND, Associativity::Left)),
   73|       |
   74|       |            // Bitwise operators (left-associative)
   75|      0|            TokenKind::Or => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_OR, Associativity::Left)),
   76|      0|            TokenKind::Xor => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_XOR, Associativity::Left)),
   77|      0|            TokenKind::And => Some((BindingPower::BITWISE_AND, Associativity::Left)),
   78|       |
   79|       |            // Comparison operators (left-associative)
   80|      0|            TokenKind::Equal | TokenKind::NotEqual => Some((BindingPower::EQUALITY, Associativity::Left)),
   81|       |            TokenKind::Less | TokenKind::Greater | TokenKind::LessEqual | TokenKind::GreaterEqual => {
   82|      0|                Some((BindingPower::RELATIONAL, Associativity::Left))
   83|       |            }
   84|       |
   85|       |            // Shift operators (left-associative)
   86|      0|            TokenKind::LeftShift | TokenKind::RightShift => Some((BindingPower::SHIFT, Associativity::Left)),
   87|       |
   88|       |            // Additive operators (left-associative)
   89|      0|            TokenKind::Plus | TokenKind::Minus => Some((BindingPower::ADDITIVE, Associativity::Left)),
   90|       |
   91|       |            // Multiplicative operators (left-associative)
   92|       |            TokenKind::Star | TokenKind::Slash | TokenKind::Percent => {
   93|      0|                Some((BindingPower::MULTIPLICATIVE, Associativity::Left))
   94|       |            }
   95|       |
   96|       |            // Postfix operators
   97|       |            TokenKind::Increment
   98|       |            | TokenKind::Decrement
   99|       |            | TokenKind::LeftParen
  100|       |            | TokenKind::LeftBracket
  101|       |            | TokenKind::Dot
  102|      0|            | TokenKind::Arrow => Some((BindingPower::POSTFIX, Associativity::Left)),
  103|       |
  104|      0|            _ => None,
  105|       |        }
  106|      0|    }

  109|       |/// Main expression parsing using Pratt algorithm
  110|      0|pub(crate) fn parse_expression(
  111|      0|    parser: &mut Parser,
  112|      0|    min_binding_power: BindingPower,
  113|      0|) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {
  114|      0|    trace!("parse_expression: min_binding_power={}", min_binding_power.0);
  115|      0|    let mut left = parse_prefix(parser)?;
  116|       |
  117|      0|    while let Some(current_token) = parser.try_current_token() {
  118|      0|        debug!(
  119|      0|            "parse_expression: loop iteration, current token {:?}, min_binding_power={}",
  120|       |            current_token.kind, min_binding_power.0
  121|       |        );
  122|       |
  123|      0|        let Some((binding_power, associativity)) = PrattParser::get_binding_power(current_token.kind) else {
  124|      0|            debug!(
  125|      0|                "parse_expression: no binding power for {:?}, breaking",
  126|       |                current_token.kind
  127|       |            );
  128|      0|            break;
  129|       |        };
  130|       |
  131|      0|        let should_break = match associativity {
  132|      0|            Associativity::Left => binding_power <= min_binding_power,
  133|      0|            Associativity::Right => binding_power < min_binding_power,
  134|       |        };
  135|       |
  136|      0|        if should_break {
  137|      0|            debug!(
  138|      0|                "parse_expression: binding power {:?} should break at min {:?} (assoc {:?}), breaking",
  139|       |                binding_power.0, min_binding_power.0, associativity
  140|       |            );
  141|      0|            break;
  142|      0|        }
  143|       |
  144|      0|        let op_token = current_token;
  145|      0|        parser.advance(); // Consume the operator token
  146|       |
  147|       |        // Dispatch to the correct parsing function based on the operator kind
  148|      0|        left = match op_token.kind {
  149|       |            // Postfix operators are handled here directly
  150|      0|            TokenKind::Increment => parse_postfix_increment(parser, left, op_token)?,
  151|      0|            TokenKind::Decrement => parse_postfix_decrement(parser, left, op_token)?,
  152|      0|            TokenKind::LeftParen => parse_function_call(parser, left)?,
  153|      0|            TokenKind::LeftBracket => parse_index_access(parser, left)?,
  154|      0|            TokenKind::Dot => parse_member_access(parser, left, false)?,
  155|      0|            TokenKind::Arrow => parse_member_access(parser, left, true)?,
  156|       |
  157|       |            // Ternary operator is a special case
  158|       |            TokenKind::Question => {
  159|       |                // The middle operand is an `expression`, which allows assignment.
  160|       |                // C11: logical-OR-expression ? expression : conditional-expression
  161|      0|                let true_expr = parser.parse_expr_assignment()?;
  162|      0|                parser.expect(TokenKind::Colon)?;
  163|       |                // The third operand is a `conditional-expression`, which has higher precedence.
  164|      0|                let false_expr = parser.parse_expr_bp(BindingPower::CONDITIONAL)?;
  165|       |
  166|      0|                let span = SourceSpan::new(
  167|      0|                    parser.ast.get_node(left).span.start(),
  168|      0|                    parser.ast.get_node(false_expr).span.end(),
  169|       |                );
  170|      0|                parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::TernaryOp(left, true_expr, false_expr), span)
  171|       |            }
  172|       |
  173|       |            // All other operators are binary/infix
  174|       |            _ => {
  175|      0|                let next_min_bp = if associativity == Associativity::Left {
  176|      0|                    BindingPower(binding_power.0 + 1)
  177|       |                } else {
  178|      0|                    binding_power
  179|       |                };
  180|      0|                parse_infix(parser, left, op_token, next_min_bp)?
  181|       |            }
  182|       |        };
  183|       |    }
  184|       |
  185|      0|    Ok(left)
  186|      0|}

  189|      0|fn parse_prefix(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {

  243|      0|                        kind: TokenKind::RightParen,
  244|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::new(left_paren_token.span.end(), left_paren_token.span.end()),
  245|      0|                    };

  254|      0|                parser.expect(TokenKind::RightParen)?;
  255|      0|                Ok(expr)
  256|       |            }

  258|       |        TokenKind::Plus

  260|       |        | TokenKind::Not
  261|       |        | TokenKind::Tilde
  262|       |        | TokenKind::Increment
  263|       |        | TokenKind::Decrement
  264|       |        | TokenKind::Star
  265|      0|        | TokenKind::And => parse_unary_operator(parser, token),
  266|      0|        TokenKind::Generic => parse_generic_selection(parser),
  267|      0|        TokenKind::Alignof => parse_alignof(parser),
  268|       |        TokenKind::Sizeof => {

  272|       |            );
  273|      0|            parse_sizeof(parser)
  274|       |        }

  278|      0|        TokenKind::BuiltinVaCopy => parse_builtin_va_copy(parser),
  279|      0|        TokenKind::BuiltinExpect => parse_builtin_expect(parser),

  289|       |        _ => {
  290|      0|            let expected = "identifier, integer, float, string, char, or '('";
  291|      0|            Err(ParseError::UnexpectedToken {

  296|       |        }

  300|       |/// Parse unary operator
  301|      0|fn parse_unary_operator(parser: &mut Parser, token: Token) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {
  302|      0|    let op = match token.kind {
  303|      0|        TokenKind::Plus => UnaryOp::Plus,
  304|      0|        TokenKind::Minus => UnaryOp::Minus,
  305|      0|        TokenKind::Not => UnaryOp::LogicNot,
  306|      0|        TokenKind::Tilde => UnaryOp::BitNot,
  307|      0|        TokenKind::Increment => UnaryOp::PreIncrement,
  308|      0|        TokenKind::Decrement => UnaryOp::PreDecrement,
  309|      0|        TokenKind::Star => UnaryOp::Deref,
  310|      0|        TokenKind::And => UnaryOp::AddrOf,
  311|       |        _ => {
  312|      0|            return Err(ParseError::InvalidUnaryOperator { span: token.span });
  313|       |        }
  314|       |    };
  315|       |
  316|      0|    parser.advance();
  317|      0|    let operand_node = parser.parse_expr_bp(BindingPower::UNARY)?;
  318|      0|    let span = SourceSpan::new(token.span.start(), parser.ast.get_node(operand_node).span.end());
  319|      0|    let node = parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::UnaryOp(op, operand_node), span);

  323|       |/// Parse infix operator
  324|      0|fn parse_infix(
  325|      0|    parser: &mut Parser,
  326|      0|    left: ParsedNodeRef,
  327|      0|    operator_token: Token,
  328|      0|    min_bp: BindingPower,
  329|      0|) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {

  332|       |        operator_token.kind, operator_token.span
  333|       |    );
  334|       |
  335|       |    // For all binary operators, parse the right operand
  336|      0|    let right_node = parser.parse_expression(min_bp)?;
  337|       |
  338|      0|    let op = match operator_token.kind {
  339|      0|        TokenKind::Plus => BinaryOp::Add,
  340|      0|        TokenKind::Minus => BinaryOp::Sub,
  341|      0|        TokenKind::Star => BinaryOp::Mul,
  342|      0|        TokenKind::Slash => BinaryOp::Div,
  343|      0|        TokenKind::Percent => BinaryOp::Mod,
  344|      0|        TokenKind::Equal => BinaryOp::Equal,
  345|      0|        TokenKind::NotEqual => BinaryOp::NotEqual,
  346|      0|        TokenKind::Less => BinaryOp::Less,
  347|      0|        TokenKind::Greater => BinaryOp::Greater,
  348|      0|        TokenKind::LessEqual => BinaryOp::LessEqual,
  349|      0|        TokenKind::GreaterEqual => BinaryOp::GreaterEqual,
  350|      0|        TokenKind::And => BinaryOp::BitAnd,
  351|      0|        TokenKind::Or => BinaryOp::BitOr,
  352|      0|        TokenKind::Xor => BinaryOp::BitXor,
  353|      0|        TokenKind::LeftShift => BinaryOp::LShift,
  354|      0|        TokenKind::RightShift => BinaryOp::RShift,
  355|      0|        TokenKind::LogicAnd => BinaryOp::LogicAnd,
  356|      0|        TokenKind::LogicOr => BinaryOp::LogicOr,
  357|      0|        TokenKind::Assign => BinaryOp::Assign,
  358|      0|        TokenKind::PlusAssign => BinaryOp::AssignAdd,
  359|      0|        TokenKind::MinusAssign => BinaryOp::AssignSub,
  360|      0|        TokenKind::StarAssign => BinaryOp::AssignMul,
  361|      0|        TokenKind::DivAssign => BinaryOp::AssignDiv,
  362|      0|        TokenKind::ModAssign => BinaryOp::AssignMod,
  363|      0|        TokenKind::AndAssign => BinaryOp::AssignBitAnd,
  364|      0|        TokenKind::OrAssign => BinaryOp::AssignBitOr,
  365|      0|        TokenKind::XorAssign => BinaryOp::AssignBitXor,
  366|      0|        TokenKind::LeftShiftAssign => BinaryOp::AssignLShift,
  367|      0|        TokenKind::RightShiftAssign => BinaryOp::AssignRShift,
  368|      0|        TokenKind::Comma => BinaryOp::Comma,
  369|       |        // Postfix operators are handled in `parse_expression` and should not reach here.
  370|       |        _ => {

  372|      0|                expected_tokens: "binary operator".to_string(),

  374|      0|                span: operator_token.span,
  375|      0|            });
  376|       |        }
  377|       |    };
  378|       |
  379|      0|    let span = SourceSpan::new(
  380|      0|        parser.ast.get_node(left).span.start(),
  381|      0|        parser.ast.get_node(right_node).span.end(),
  382|       |    );
  383|       |
  384|      0|    let node = if op.is_assignment() {
  385|      0|        parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::Assignment(op, left, right_node), span)
  386|       |    } else {
  387|      0|        parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::BinaryOp(op, left, right_node), span)
  388|       |    };

  392|       |/// Parse GNU statement expression: ({ compound-statement })
  393|      0|fn parse_gnu_statement_expression(parser: &mut Parser, start_loc: SourceLoc) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {
  394|      0|    debug!("parse_gnu_statement_expression: parsing GNU statement expression");
  395|       |
  396|       |    // Parse the compound statement (parse_compound_statement expects LeftBrace)
  397|      0|    let (compound_stmt, _) = super::statements::parse_compound_statement(parser)?;
  398|       |
  399|       |    // Expect the closing parenthesis
  400|      0|    let right_paren_token = parser.expect(TokenKind::RightParen)?;
  401|       |
  402|       |    // For GNU statement expressions, the result is the last expression in the compound statement
  403|       |    // We need to extract it from the compound statement
  404|      0|    let result_expr = extract_last_expression_from_compound_statement(parser, compound_stmt);
  405|       |

  407|      0|    let span = SourceSpan::new(start_loc, end_loc);
  408|       |
  409|      0|    let node = parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::GnuStatementExpression(compound_stmt, result_expr), span);
  410|      0|    debug!("parse_gnu_statement_expression: successfully parsed GNU statement expression");

  414|       |/// Extract the last expression from a compound statement for GNU statement expressions
  415|      0|fn extract_last_expression_from_compound_statement(
  416|      0|    parser: &mut Parser,
  417|      0|    compound_stmt_node_ref: ParsedNodeRef,
  418|      0|) -> ParsedNodeRef {
  419|       |    // Get the compound statement node
  420|      0|    let compound_stmt_node = parser.ast.get_node(compound_stmt_node_ref);
  421|       |
  422|      0|    if let ParsedNodeKind::CompoundStatement(statements) = &compound_stmt_node.kind {
  423|       |        // Find the last expression statement in the compound statement
  424|      0|        for &stmt_ref in statements.iter().rev() {
  425|      0|            let stmt_node = parser.ast.get_node(stmt_ref);
  426|      0|            if let ParsedNodeKind::ExpressionStatement(Some(expr)) = &stmt_node.kind {
  427|      0|                return *expr;
  428|      0|            }
  429|       |        }
  430|       |
  431|       |        // If no expression statement found, create a dummy expression
  432|       |        // This shouldn't happen in valid GNU statement expressions
  433|      0|        let dummy_expr = parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::Dummy, compound_stmt_node.span);
  434|      0|        return dummy_expr;
  435|      0|    }
  436|       |
  437|       |    // Fallback: create a dummy expression
  438|      0|    parser.push_node(ParsedNodeKind::Dummy, compound_stmt_node.span)
  439|      0|}

  512|       |/// Parse _Generic selection (C11)
  513|      0|fn parse_generic_selection(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError> {
  514|      0|    let token = parser.expect(TokenKind::Generic)?;
  515|      0|    let start_loc = token.span.start();
  516|       |
  517|      0|    parser.expect(TokenKind::LeftParen)?;
  518|       |
  519|       |    // The controlling expression is an assignment-expression, so we parse with ASSIGNMENT binding power.
  520|      0|    let controlling_expr = parser.parse_expr_bp(BindingPower::ASSIGNMENT)?;
  521|       |
  522|      0|    parser.expect(TokenKind::Comma)?;
  523|       |
  524|       |    // Reserve slot for the generic selection node so that any nested parsing
  525|       |    // that might push nodes won't accidentally observe an unstable index.
  526|      0|    let dummy = parser.push_dummy();
  527|       |
  528|      0|    let mut associations: Vec<ParsedGenericAssociation> = Vec::new();
  529|       |
  530|       |    loop {
  531|      0|        let type_name = if parser.accept(TokenKind::Default).is_some() {
  532|      0|            None
  533|       |        } else {
  534|      0|            let parsed_type = super::parsed_type_builder::parse_parsed_type_name(parser)?;
  535|      0|            Some(parsed_type)
  536|       |        };
  537|       |
  538|      0|        parser.expect(TokenKind::Colon)?;
  539|       |
  540|      0|        let result_expr = parser.parse_expression(BindingPower::COMMA)?;
  541|       |
  542|      0|        associations.push(ParsedGenericAssociation { type_name, result_expr });
  543|       |
  544|      0|        if !parser.is_token(TokenKind::Comma) {
  545|      0|            break;
  546|      0|        }
  547|      0|        parser.advance(); // consume comma
  548|       |    }
  549|       |
  550|      0|    let right_paren_token = parser.expect(TokenKind::RightParen)?;
  551|      0|    let end_loc = right_paren_token.span.end();
  552|      0|    let span = SourceSpan::new(start_loc, end_loc);
  553|       |
  554|      0|    let node = parser.replace_node(
  555|      0|        dummy,
  556|      0|        ParsedNodeKind::GenericSelection(controlling_expr, associations),
  557|      0|        span,
  558|       |    );
  559|      0|    Ok(node)

  427|       |    /// Classify a preprocessor token into a lexical token
  428|      8|    fn classify_token(&self, pptoken: &PPToken) -> TokenKind {
  429|      8|        match pptoken.kind {
  430|      4|            PPTokenKind::Identifier(symbol) => {
  431|       |                // Check if it's a keyword
  432|      4|                is_keyword(symbol).unwrap_or(TokenKind::Identifier(symbol))
  433|       |            }
  434|      0|            PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(symbol) => TokenKind::StringLiteral(symbol),
  435|      0|            PPTokenKind::CharLiteral(codepoint, _) => TokenKind::CharacterConstant(codepoint),
  436|      0|            PPTokenKind::Number(value) => {
  437|       |                // Try to parse as integer first, then float, then unknown
  438|      0|                if let Some((int_val, suffix)) = literal_parsing::parse_c11_integer_literal(value.as_str()) {
  439|      0|                    TokenKind::IntegerConstant(int_val as i64, suffix)
  440|      0|                } else if let Some((float_val, suffix)) = literal_parsing::parse_c11_float_literal(value.as_str()) {
  441|      0|                    TokenKind::FloatConstant(float_val, suffix)
  442|       |                } else {
  443|      0|                    TokenKind::Unknown // Could not parse as integer or float
  444|       |                }
  445|       |            }
  446|      1|            PPTokenKind::Eof => TokenKind::EndOfFile,
  447|      0|            PPTokenKind::Eod => TokenKind::Unknown,
  448|       |            // Handle punctuation tokens using the optimized match-based function
  449|      3|            pptoken_kind => classify_punctuation(pptoken_kind),
  450|       |        }
  451|      8|    }
  452|       |
  453|       |    /// Get all tokens from the stream
  454|      1|    pub fn tokenize_all(&mut self) -> Vec<Token> {
  455|       |        // Bolt : Pre-allocate the tokens vector with the capacity of the preprocessor tokens.
  456|       |        // This is a reasonable estimate that reduces the number of reallocations,
  457|       |        // as the number of lexical tokens is usually similar to the number of preprocessor tokens.
  458|      1|        let mut tokens = Vec::with_capacity(self.tokens.len());
  459|      1|        let mut current_token_iter = self.tokens.iter().peekable();
  460|       |
  461|      8|        while let Some(pptoken) = current_token_iter.next() {
  462|      8|            if let PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(symbol) = pptoken.kind {
                                                            ^0
  463|       |                //  Bolt: Optimized string literal handling.
  464|       |                // This introduces a fast path for single string literals, which are the
  465|       |                // most common case. By peeking ahead, we avoid the overhead of the
  466|       |                // two-pass concatenation logic unless it's actually needed. This
  467|       |                // reduces overhead and improves lexer performance.
  468|       |
  469|       |                // --- Fast path for single string literals ---
  470|      0|                if !matches!(
  471|      0|                    current_token_iter.peek(),
  472|       |                    Some(PPToken {
  473|       |                        kind: PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(_),
  474|       |                        ..
  475|       |                    })
  476|       |                ) {
  477|      0|                    tokens.push(Token {
  478|      0|                        kind: self.classify_token(pptoken),
  479|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::new_with_length(
  480|      0|                            pptoken.location.source_id(),
  481|      0|                            pptoken.location.offset(),
  482|      0|                            pptoken.length as u32,
  483|      0|                        ),
  484|      0|                    });
  485|      0|                    continue;
  486|      0|                }
  487|       |
  488|       |                // --- Slow path: Concatenate adjacent string literals ---
  489|      0|                let start_span = SourceSpan::new_with_length(
  490|      0|                    pptoken.location.source_id(),
  491|      0|                    pptoken.location.offset(),
  492|      0|                    pptoken.length as u32,
  493|       |                );
  494|      0|                let mut final_span = start_span;
  495|       |
  496|       |                // --- Phase 1: Determine final prefix and total size ---
  497|      0|                let (mut prefix, first_content) = Self::extract_literal_parts(symbol.as_str()).unwrap_or(("", ""));
  498|       |
  499|       |                // Concatenate raw content (inside quotes)
  500|      0|                let mut concatenated_content = String::with_capacity(first_content.len() * 2);
  501|      0|                concatenated_content.push_str(first_content);
  502|       |
  503|      0|                let mut adjacent_literals = 0;
  504|      0|                let next_token_idx = self.tokens.len() - current_token_iter.len();
  505|       |
  506|      0|                while let Some(next_pptoken) = self.tokens.get(next_token_idx + adjacent_literals) {
  507|      0|                    if let PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(next_symbol) = next_pptoken.kind {
  508|      0|                        let (next_prefix, next_content) =
  509|      0|                            Self::extract_literal_parts(next_symbol.as_str()).unwrap_or(("", ""));
  510|       |
  511|      0|                        if prefix.is_empty() && !next_prefix.is_empty() {
  512|      0|                            prefix = next_prefix;
  513|      0|                        }
  514|       |
  515|      0|                        concatenated_content.push_str(next_content);
  516|       |
  517|      0|                        final_span = SourceSpan::new_with_length(
  518|      0|                            next_pptoken.location.source_id(),
  519|      0|                            next_pptoken.location.offset(),
  520|      0|                            next_pptoken.length as u32,
  521|      0|                        );
  522|      0|                        adjacent_literals += 1;
  523|       |                    } else {
  524|      0|                        break;
  525|       |                    }
  526|       |                }
  527|       |
  528|       |                // --- Phase 2: Consume tokens ---
  529|      0|                for _ in 0..adjacent_literals {
  530|      0|                    current_token_iter.next();
  531|      0|                }
  532|       |
  533|       |                // Construct final literal: prefix + " + content + "
  534|      0|                let mut final_literal = String::with_capacity(concatenated_content.len() + prefix.len() + 2);
  535|      0|                final_literal.push_str(prefix);
  536|      0|                final_literal.push('"');
  537|      0|                final_literal.push_str(&concatenated_content);
  538|      0|                final_literal.push('"');
  539|       |
  540|      0|                tokens.push(Token {
  541|      0|                    kind: TokenKind::StringLiteral(StringId::new(final_literal)),
  542|      0|                    span: start_span.merge(final_span),
  543|      0|                });
  544|      0|                continue;
  545|      8|            }
  546|       |
  547|       |            // For all other tokens, process normally
  548|      8|            let token = Token {
  549|      8|                kind: self.classify_token(pptoken),
  550|      8|                span: SourceSpan::new_with_length(
  551|      8|                    pptoken.location.source_id(),
  552|      8|                    pptoken.location.offset(),
  553|      8|                    pptoken.length as u32,
  554|      8|                ),
  555|      8|            };
  556|       |
  557|      8|            let is_eof = matches!(token.kind, TokenKind::EndOfFile);
                                       ^7
  558|      8|            tokens.push(token);
  559|      8|            if is_eof {
  560|      1|                break;
  561|      7|            }
  562|       |        }
  563|       |
  564|      1|        tokens
  565|      1|    }

  567|       |    /// Extract parts from a string literal symbol: (prefix, content_without_quotes)

  572|      0|            }
  573|      0|        } else if let Some(rest) = s.strip_prefix("u\"") {
  574|      0|            if let Some(inner) = rest.strip_suffix('"') {
  575|      0|                return Some(("u", inner));
  576|      0|            }
  577|      0|        } else if let Some(rest) = s.strip_prefix("U\"") {
  578|      0|            if let Some(inner) = rest.strip_suffix('"') {
  579|      0|                return Some(("U", inner));
  580|      0|            }
  581|      0|        } else if let Some(rest) = s.strip_prefix("u8\"") {
  582|      0|            if let Some(inner) = rest.strip_suffix('"') {
  583|      0|                return Some(("u8", inner));
  584|      0|            }
  585|      0|        } else if let Some(rest) = s.strip_prefix("\"")
  586|      0|            && let Some(inner) = rest.strip_suffix('"')
  587|       |        {
  588|      0|            return Some(("", inner));
  589|      0|        }
  590|      0|        None
  591|      0|    }

  117|       |/// Parse base type and qualifiers from declaration specifiers

  130|       |                    // Collect mergeable basic types
  131|       |                    ParsedTypeSpecifier::Void

  133|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Short
  134|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Int

  136|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::LongLong
  137|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Float
  138|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Double
  139|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::LongDouble

  141|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Unsigned
  142|       |                    | ParsedTypeSpecifier::Bool

  144|       |                        // TODO: Check if we have an existing non-mergeable type (e.g. struct) -> Error
  145|      1|                        if let Some(current) = base_type_specifier {
                                                  ^0
  146|       |                            // Merge
  147|       |                            // We don't have span for specifiers in ThinVec directly?
  148|       |                            // We can use parser.current_span() but that's wrong.
  149|       |                            // ParsedDeclSpecifier doesn't store span.
  150|       |                            // We will assume dummy span for now or fix this later.

  152|      0|                                current,

  154|      0|                                crate::ast::SourceSpan::default(),
  155|      0|                            )?);
  156|      1|                        } else {
  157|      1|                            base_type_specifier = Some(ts.clone());
  158|      1|                        }
  159|       |                    }
  160|       |                    _ => {
  161|       |                        // Non-mergeable types (struct, enum, typedef, atomic)
  162|       |                        // Should error if we already have a type
  163|      0|                        if base_type_specifier.is_some() || other_base_type_node.is_some() {
  164|       |                            // Error: multiple types

  166|       |                            // Let's error.
  167|      0|                            return Err(ParseError::UnexpectedToken {
  168|      0|                                expected_tokens: "single type specifier".to_string(),
  169|      0|                                found: crate::parser::TokenKind::Unknown,
  170|      0|                                span: crate::ast::SourceSpan::default(),
  171|      0|                            });
  172|      0|                        }
  173|      0|                        let parsed_base = parse_type_specifier_to_parsed_base(parser, ts)?;
  174|      0|                        other_base_type_node = Some(parsed_base);
  175|       |                    }
  176|       |                }
  177|       |            }
  178|      0|            ParsedDeclSpecifier::TypeQualifier(q) => {
  179|      0|                let qualifier = match q {
  180|      0|                    crate::ast::nodes::TypeQualifier::Const => TypeQualifiers::CONST,
  181|      0|                    crate::ast::nodes::TypeQualifier::Volatile => TypeQualifiers::VOLATILE,
  182|      0|                    crate::ast::nodes::TypeQualifier::Restrict => TypeQualifiers::RESTRICT,
  183|      0|                    crate::ast::nodes::TypeQualifier::Atomic => TypeQualifiers::ATOMIC,
  184|       |                };
  185|      0|                qualifiers |= qualifier;
  186|       |            }
  187|      0|            _ => {
  188|      0|                // Other specifiers (storage class, function specifiers, etc.)
  189|      0|                // are handled elsewhere and don't affect the base type
  190|      0|            }
  191|       |        }
  192|       |    }
  193|       |
  194|      1|    let base_type_ref = if let Some(ts) = base_type_specifier {
  195|      1|        parse_type_specifier_to_parsed_base(parser, &ts)?
                                                                      ^0
  196|      0|    } else if let Some(node) = other_base_type_node {
  197|      0|        node
  198|       |    } else {
  199|       |        // Default to int if no type specifier found
  200|      0|        parser

  202|      0|            .parsed_types

  204|       |    };
  205|       |
  206|      1|    Ok((base_type_ref, qualifiers))

   59|       |/// Parse compound statement (block)
   60|      0|pub(crate) fn parse_compound_statement(parser: &mut Parser) -> Result<(ParsedNodeRef, SourceLoc), ParseError> {
   61|      0|    let token = parser.expect(TokenKind::LeftBrace)?;
   62|      0|    let start_loc = token.span.start();
   63|      0|    let dummy = parser.push_dummy();
   64|       |
   65|      0|    let mut block_items = Vec::new();
   66|       |
   67|      0|    while !parser.is_token(TokenKind::RightBrace) {
   68|      0|        let initial_idx = parser.current_idx;
   69|       |
   70|      0|        debug!(
   71|      0|            "parse_compound_statement: parsing block item, current token {:?}, position {}",
   72|      0|            parser.current_token_kind(),
   73|       |            initial_idx
   74|       |        );
   75|       |
   76|       |        // Try parsing as declaration first, but only if it looks like a declaration start
   77|      0|        let should_try_declaration = parser.starts_declaration();
   78|      0|        let mut declaration_attempt: Option<Result<ParsedNodeRef, ParseError>> = None;
   79|       |
   80|      0|        if should_try_declaration {
   81|      0|            let trx = parser.start_transaction();
   82|      0|            debug!(
   83|      0|                "parse_compound_statement: trying declaration parsing at position {}",
   84|       |                trx.parser.current_idx
   85|       |            );

   87|      0|                Ok(declaration) => {
   88|      0|                    debug!("parse_compound_statement: successfully parsed declaration");
   89|      0|                    block_items.push(declaration);
   90|      0|                    trx.commit();
   91|       |                }
   92|      0|                Err(decl_error) => {
   93|      0|                    debug!("parse_compound_statement: declaration parsing failed: {:?}", decl_error);
   94|      0|                    declaration_attempt = Some(Err(decl_error));
   95|       |                }
   96|       |            }
   97|      0|        }
   98|       |
   99|       |        // If declaration failed or wasn't attempted, try as statement
  100|      0|        if declaration_attempt.is_some() || !should_try_declaration {
  101|      0|            if declaration_attempt.is_some() {
  102|      0|                debug!(
  103|      0|                    "parse_compound_statement: reset to position {}, trying statement",
  104|       |                    initial_idx
  105|       |                );
  106|       |            } else {
  107|      0|                debug!("parse_compound_statement: not a declaration start, trying statement");
  108|       |            }
  109|       |
  110|      0|            match parse_statement(parser) {
  111|      0|                Ok(statement) => {
  112|      0|                    debug!("parse_compound_statement: successfully parsed statement");
  113|      0|                    block_items.push(statement);
  114|       |                }
  115|      0|                Err(stmt_error) => {
  116|      0|                    debug!(
  117|      0|                        "parse_compound_statement: statement parsing also failed: {:?}",
  118|       |                        stmt_error
  119|       |                    );
  120|       |                    // Both declaration and statement parsing failed
  121|       |                    // Report the declaration error and try to synchronize
  122|      0|                    if let Some(Err(decl_error)) = declaration_attempt {
  123|      0|                        parser.diag.report(decl_error);
  124|      0|                    } else {
  125|      0|                        parser.diag.report(stmt_error);
  126|      0|                    }
  127|      0|                    parser.synchronize();
  128|       |                }
  129|       |            }
  130|      0|        }
  131|       |    }
  132|       |
  133|      0|    let right_brace_token = parser.expect(TokenKind::RightBrace)?;
  134|      0|    let end_loc = right_brace_token.span.end();
  135|       |
  136|      0|    let span = SourceSpan::new(start_loc, end_loc);
  137|       |
  138|      0|    let node = parser.replace_node(dummy, ParsedNodeKind::CompoundStatement(block_items), span);
  139|      0|    Ok((node, end_loc))

   29|      0|        if self.tokens.is_empty() {
   30|      0|            return Ok(());
   31|      0|        }
   32|       |
   33|       |        // Get the source buffer for the first token
   34|      0|        let first_token = &self.tokens[0];
   35|       |
   36|       |        // Initial heuristic: try to find the first non-macro-expanded token
   37|       |        // to establish the "current file" context. This prevents line markers
   38|       |        // generally being emitted for the file itself if it starts with a macro.
   39|      0|        let mut current_file_id = first_token.location.source_id();

   41|      0|            if !token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::MACRO_EXPANDED) {
   42|      0|                current_file_id = token.location.source_id();
   43|      0|                break;
   44|      0|            }
   45|       |        }
   46|      0|        let mut current_buffer = self.source_manager.get_buffer(current_file_id);
   47|      0|        let mut last_pos = 0u32;
   48|      0|        let mut last_was_macro_expanded = false;

   50|      0|        for token in self.tokens {
   51|      0|            if token.kind == PPTokenKind::Eof {
   52|      0|                break;
   53|      0|            }
   54|       |
   55|       |            // Handle macro-expanded tokens (Level A: use canonical spelling)
   56|      0|            if token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::MACRO_EXPANDED) {
   57|       |                // Heuristic: if we are entering a macro expansion (previous was not macro),
   58|       |                // and there was whitespace at the current position in the source, print a space.
   59|       |                // This preserves separation like "return FOO" -> "return 123".
   60|      0|                if !last_was_macro_expanded {
   61|       |                    // Check if char at last_pos is whitespace
   62|      0|                    if let Some(&byte) = current_buffer.get(last_pos as usize)
   63|      0|                        && (byte as char).is_whitespace()

   65|      0|                        write!(writer, " ")?;
   66|      0|                    }
   67|       |                } else {
   68|       |                    // Add space between consecutive macro-expanded tokens (linearization)
   69|      0|                    write!(writer, " ")?;
   70|       |                }
   71|       |
   72|       |                // For macro-expanded tokens, just print the canonical spelling
   73|       |                // No whitespace reconstruction for Level A - these tokens don't have
   74|       |                // meaningful source locations for whitespace calculation
   75|      0|                write!(writer, "{}", token.get_text())?;
   76|      0|                last_was_macro_expanded = true;
   77|       |                // Don't update last_pos for macro-expanded tokens
   78|      0|                continue;
   79|      0|            }
   80|       |
   81|       |            // Check for file transitions and emit line markers
   82|      0|            if token.location.source_id() != current_file_id {
   83|       |                // Emit line marker for file transition (unless suppressed)
   84|      0|                if !self.suppress_line_markers
   85|      0|                    && let Some(file_info) = self.source_manager.get_file_info(token.location.source_id())
   86|       |                {

   88|      0|                        .source_manager
   89|      0|                        .get_line_column(token.location)
   90|      0|                        .map(|(l, _)| l)

   93|      0|                        .path
   94|      0|                        .file_name()
   95|      0|                        .and_then(|n| n.to_str())
   96|      0|                        .unwrap_or("<unknown>");
   97|       |
   98|       |                    // Ensure we start on a new line
   99|      0|                    writeln!(writer)?;
  100|      0|                    writeln!(writer, "# {} \"{}\" 1", line, filename)?;
  101|      0|                }
  102|       |
  103|      0|                current_file_id = token.location.source_id();
  104|      0|                current_buffer = self.source_manager.get_buffer(current_file_id);
  105|      0|                last_pos = token.location.offset();
  106|      0|            }
  107|       |
  108|      0|            let token_start = token.location.offset();
  109|      0|            let token_end = token_start + token.length as u32;
  110|       |
  111|       |            // Print all bytes between last_pos and token_start (whitespace, comments)
  112|      0|            if token_start > last_pos {
  113|      0|                let slice = &current_buffer[last_pos as usize..token_start as usize];
  114|       |                // Convert to string, assuming UTF-8 (preprocessor should ensure this)
  115|      0|                if let Ok(text) = std::str::from_utf8(slice) {
  116|       |                    // Only print slices that are all whitespace to avoid printing directive text
  117|      0|                    if text.chars().all(|c| c.is_whitespace()) {
  118|      0|                        write!(writer, "{}", text)?;
  119|      0|                    }
  120|      0|                }
  121|      0|            }
  122|       |
  123|       |            // Print the token's raw bytes from source
  124|      0|            let token_slice = token.get_raw_slice(current_buffer);
  125|      0|            if let Ok(text) = std::str::from_utf8(token_slice) {
  126|      0|                write!(writer, "{}", text)?;
  127|      0|            }
  128|       |
  129|      0|            last_pos = token_end;
  130|      0|            last_was_macro_expanded = false;
  131|       |        }
  132|       |
  133|      0|        writeln!(writer)?;
  134|      0|        Ok(())
  135|      0|    }

  132|       |                                }

  145|       |                                }

  237|       |pub(crate) struct Interpreter<'a> {

  246|      0|            tokens,

  252|      0|    pub(crate) fn evaluate(&mut self) -> Result<ExprValue, PPError> {
  253|      0|        let expr = self.parse_conditional()?;
  254|      0|        expr.evaluate(self.preprocessor)
  255|      0|    }
  256|       |
  257|      0|    fn parse_conditional(&mut self) -> Result<PPExpr, PPError> {
  258|      0|        let cond = self.parse_or()?;
  259|      0|        if self.pos < self.tokens.len() && matches!(self.tokens[self.pos].kind, PPTokenKind::Question) {
  260|      0|            self.pos += 1; // consume ?

  262|      0|            if self.pos < self.tokens.len() && matches!(self.tokens[self.pos].kind, PPTokenKind::Colon) {
  263|      0|                self.pos += 1; // consume :
  264|      0|                let false_e = self.parse_conditional()?;
  265|      0|                Ok(PPExpr::Conditional(Box::new(cond), Box::new(true_e), Box::new(false_e)))
  266|       |            } else {
  267|      0|                Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression)
  268|       |            }
  269|       |        } else {
  270|      0|            Ok(cond)
  271|       |        }
  272|      0|    }
  273|       |
  274|      0|    fn parse_or(&mut self) -> Result<PPExpr, PPError> {
  275|      0|        let mut left = self.parse_and()?;

  430|      0|    fn parse_unary(&mut self) -> Result<PPExpr, PPError> {
  431|      0|        if self.pos >= self.tokens.len() {
  432|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression);
  433|      0|        }
  434|      0|        let token = &self.tokens[self.pos];
  435|      0|        if matches!(token.kind, PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) if sym == self.preprocessor.defined_symbol()) {

  445|      0|                    return Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression);
  446|       |                }

  449|       |            };

  499|      0|            }

  501|       |
  502|      0|            Ok(PPExpr::HasInclude(path, is_angled))
  503|      0|        } else if matches!(
  504|      0|            token.kind,
  505|       |            PPTokenKind::Plus | PPTokenKind::Minus | PPTokenKind::Tilde | PPTokenKind::Not
  506|       |        ) {

  514|      0|                _ => unreachable!(),

  517|       |        } else {
  518|      0|            self.parse_primary()
  519|       |        }
  520|      0|    }
  521|       |
  522|      0|    fn parse_primary(&mut self) -> Result<PPExpr, PPError> {
  523|      0|        if self.pos >= self.tokens.len() {
  524|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression);
  525|      0|        }
  526|      0|        let token = &self.tokens[self.pos];
  527|      0|        self.pos += 1;
  528|      0|        match &token.kind {
  529|      0|            PPTokenKind::Number(sym) => {
  530|      0|                let text = sym.as_str();
  531|      0|                if let Some((val, suffix)) = literal_parsing::parse_c11_integer_literal(text) {
  532|      0|                    let mut is_unsigned =
  533|      0|                        matches!(suffix, Some(IntegerSuffix::U | IntegerSuffix::UL | IntegerSuffix::ULL));
  534|       |
  535|       |                    // C11 6.3.1.1: If it fits in signed i64, it's signed (unless U suffix).
  536|       |                    // If it doesn't fit in i64, it depends on base.
  537|       |                    // Hex/Octal: can be unsigned if doesn't fit in signed.
  538|       |                    // Decimal: technically should be signed long long, but if it overflows, it's UB or implementation defined.
  539|       |                    // We treat large decimals as unsigned too to support `u64` range fully.
  540|      0|                    let fits_i64 = val <= i64::MAX as u64;
  541|       |
  542|      0|                    if !is_unsigned && !fits_i64 {
  543|      0|                        // Promoted to unsigned if hex/octal or too big
  544|      0|                        // For decimal, ideally we warn, but here we just accept as unsigned to match typical behavior for u64 support
  545|      0|                        is_unsigned = true;
  546|      0|                    }
  547|       |
  548|      0|                    Ok(PPExpr::Number(ExprValue::new(val, is_unsigned)))
  549|       |                } else {
  550|      0|                    Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression)
  551|       |                }
  552|       |            }
  553|      0|            PPTokenKind::CharLiteral(codepoint, _) => Ok(PPExpr::Number(ExprValue::new(*codepoint, false))),
  554|      0|            PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) => {
  555|       |                // Identifiers are 0 if not defined, but since we expanded macros, should be numbers
  556|      0|                Ok(PPExpr::Identifier(sym.as_str().to_string()))
  557|       |            }
  558|       |            PPTokenKind::LeftParen => {
  559|      0|                let result = self.parse_conditional()?;
  560|      0|                if self.pos < self.tokens.len() && matches!(self.tokens[self.pos].kind, PPTokenKind::RightParen) {
  561|      0|                    self.pos += 1;
  562|      0|                    Ok(result)
  563|       |                } else {
  564|      0|                    Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression)
  565|       |                }
  566|       |            }
  567|      0|            _ => Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression),
  568|       |        }
  569|      0|    }

  208|       |    /// Line splicing: backslash followed by newline removes both characters
  209|     22|    pub(crate) fn next_char(&mut self) -> Option<u8> {
  210|       |        loop {
  211|     22|            let pos = self.position as usize;
  212|     22|            if pos >= self.buffer.len() {
  213|      2|                return None;
  214|     20|            }
  215|       |
  216|     20|            let mut ch = self.buffer[pos];
  217|       |
