  219|       |            // If the character is not the start of a trigraph ('?') or a line splice ('\'),
  220|       |            // we can consume it immediately and skip the complex logic below.
  221|       |            // This significantly improves performance as most characters fall into this case.

  223|     20|                self.position += 1;
  224|     20|                if ch == b'\n' {
  225|      0|                    self.line_starts.push(self.position);
  226|     20|                }

  235|      0|                    b'=' => Some(b'#'),
  236|      0|                    b'(' => Some(b'['),
  237|      0|                    b'/' => Some(b'\\'),
  238|      0|                    b')' => Some(b']'),
  239|      0|                    b'\'' => Some(b'^'),
  240|      0|                    b'<' => Some(b'{'),
  241|      0|                    b'!' => Some(b'|'),
  242|      0|                    b'>' => Some(b'}'),
  243|      0|                    b'-' => Some(b'~'),
  244|      0|                    _ => None,
  245|       |                };

  248|      0|                    ch = r;
  249|      0|                    consumed_len = 3;

  263|      0|                        check_pos += 1;

  266|      0|                        new_pos = check_pos + 1;
  267|      0|                        found_splice = true;
  268|      0|                        break;

  273|      0|                            new_pos = after_cr + 1;

  275|      0|                            new_pos = check_pos + 1;
  276|      0|                        }
  277|      0|                        found_splice = true;
  278|      0|                        break;
  279|       |                    } else {
  280|       |                        // Not a splice
  281|      0|                        break;
  282|       |                    }
  283|       |                }
  284|       |

  298|      0|                self.line_starts.push(self.position);
  299|      0|            }

  305|       |    /// Peek at the next character without consuming it, handling line splicing
  306|      8|    pub(crate) fn peek_char(&mut self) -> Option<u8> {
  307|      8|        let pos = self.position as usize;
  308|       |
  309|       |        //  Bolt: Fast path for peeking common characters.
  310|       |        // If the next character is not the start of a trigraph or line splice,
  311|       |        // we can return it directly without the overhead of saving/restoring state.
  312|      8|        if pos < self.buffer.len() {
  313|      7|            let ch = self.buffer[pos];
  314|      7|            if ch != b'?' && ch != b'\\' {
  315|      7|                return Some(ch);
  316|      0|            }
  317|      1|        }
  318|       |
  319|      1|        let saved_position = self.position;
  320|       |        //  Bolt: Avoid cloning `line_starts` by saving its length.
  321|       |        // `next_char` only ever appends to this vector, so we can restore its
  322|       |        // state by truncating it to its original length. This is a significant
  323|       |        // performance win as `peek_char` is called frequently.

  325|       |
  326|      1|        let result = self.next_char();
  327|       |
  328|       |        // Restore state
  329|      1|        self.position = saved_position;
  330|      1|        self.line_starts.truncate(saved_line_starts_len);
  331|       |
  332|      1|        result
  333|      8|    }

  335|       |    ///  Bolt: Consolidated operator lexing.
  336|       |    /// This helper function centralizes the logic for lexing single and multi-character operators,
  337|       |    /// significantly reducing code duplication and branching in the main `next_token` function.
  338|       |    /// This improves performance by making the tokenization logic more direct and predictable
  339|       |    /// for the compiler to optimize. It also fixes a bug in the original `...` lexing logic.
  340|      3|    fn lex_operator(&mut self, start_pos: u32, ch: u8, flags: PPTokenFlags) -> PPToken {
  341|      3|        let loc = SourceLoc::new(self.source_id, start_pos);
  342|       |        //  Bolt: Check if we're at the beginning of a line (ignoring whitespace).
  343|       |        // This is crucial for identifying the '#' or '%:' that starts a preprocessor directive.
  344|      3|        let is_at_start_of_line = self.at_start_of_line;
  345|       |
  346|       |        // Helper macro to reduce boilerplate when creating a token.
  347|       |        macro_rules! token {
  348|       |            ($kind:expr, $len:expr) => {
  349|       |                PPToken::new($kind, flags, loc, $len)
  350|       |            };

  352|       |                PPToken::new($kind, $custom_flags, loc, $len)
  353|       |            };
  354|       |        }
  355|       |
  356|       |        // Helper macro to check the next character and consume it if it matches.
  357|       |        macro_rules! consume_if {
  358|       |            ($c:expr) => {{
  359|       |                if self.peek_char() == Some($c) {
  360|       |                    self.next_char();
  361|       |                    true
  362|       |                } else {
  363|       |                    false
  364|       |                }
  365|       |            }};
  366|       |        }
  367|       |
  368|      3|        match ch {
  369|       |            b'#' => {
  370|      0|                if consume_if!(b'#') {
  371|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::HashHash, 2)

  373|      0|                    let mut token_flags = flags;
  374|      0|                    if is_at_start_of_line {
  375|      0|                        token_flags |= PPTokenFlags::STARTS_PP_LINE;
  376|      0|                        self.in_directive_line = true;
  377|      0|                    }
  378|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Hash, 1, token_flags)
  379|       |                }
  380|       |            }
  381|       |            b'+' => {
  382|      0|                if consume_if!(b'+') {
  383|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Increment, 2)
  384|      0|                } else if consume_if!(b'=') {
  385|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::PlusAssign, 2)
  386|       |                } else {
  387|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Plus, 1)
  388|       |                }
  389|       |            }
  390|       |            b'-' => {
  391|      0|                if consume_if!(b'-') {
  392|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Decrement, 2)
  393|      0|                } else if consume_if!(b'=') {
  394|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::MinusAssign, 2)
  395|      0|                } else if consume_if!(b'>') {
  396|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Arrow, 2)
  397|       |                } else {
  398|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Minus, 1)
  399|       |                }

  402|      0|                if consume_if!(b'=') {
  403|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::StarAssign, 2)

  405|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Star, 1)
  406|       |                }

  409|      0|                if consume_if!(b'=') {
  410|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::DivAssign, 2)
  411|       |                } else {
  412|      0|                    token!(PPTokenKind::Slash, 1)
  413|       |                }

  435|      0|                                self.in_directive_line = true;

  557|      8|    pub(crate) fn next_token(&mut self) -> Option<PPToken> {
  558|      8|        if let Some(token) = self.put_back_token.take() {

  559|      0|            return Some(token);

  561|       |
  562|      8|        let saved_position = self.position;
  563|      8|        self.skip_whitespace_and_comments();

  571|      0|                    PPTokenFlags::empty(),

  573|      0|                    0,

  581|      2|            PPTokenFlags::LEADING_SPACE

  598|      0|                1,

  603|      3|            b'a'..=b'z' | b'A'..=b'Z' | b'_' => {

  605|      0|                    let next_ch = self.peek_char();

  771|       |    /// Consumes characters based on a predicate, building a string.
  772|       |    ///
  773|       |    /// The predicate receives the current state and the character.
  774|       |    /// It should return `true` to consume the character, or `false` to stop.
  775|       |    /// The closure can modify state (e.g., tracking scientific notation 'e').
  776|      0|    fn consume_while<F, S>(&mut self, mut state: S, first_ch: u8, mut pred: F) -> String
  777|      0|    where
  778|      0|        F: FnMut(&mut S, u8) -> bool,
  779|       |    {
  780|       |        //  Bolt: Pre-allocate the vector with a reasonable capacity to avoid
  781|       |        // multiple reallocations during identifier/number lexing.

  783|      0|        chars.push(first_ch);
  784|       |        loop {
  785|       |            //  Bolt: Fast path for direct buffer access when no line splicing or trigraphs are present.
  786|      0|            let pos = self.position as usize;
  787|      0|            if pos < self.buffer.len() {
  788|      0|                let ch = self.buffer[pos];
  789|      0|                if ch != b'?' && ch != b'\\' {
  790|      0|                    if pred(&mut state, ch) {
  791|      0|                        self.position += 1;
  792|      0|                        chars.push(ch);
  793|      0|                        continue;
  794|       |                    } else {
  795|      0|                        break;
  796|       |                    }
  797|      0|                }
  798|      0|            }
  799|       |
  800|      0|            if let Some(ch) = self.peek_char()
  801|      0|                && pred(&mut state, ch)
  802|       |            {
  803|      0|                chars.push(self.next_char().unwrap());
  804|      0|                continue;
  805|      0|            }
  806|      0|            break;
  807|       |        }
  808|       |        // Safety: We assume the caller only consumes valid UTF-8 characters (identifiers/numbers).
  809|      0|        String::from_utf8(chars).unwrap()
  810|      0|    }

  812|       |    /// Generic helper for lexing textual tokens (identifiers, numbers)

  815|      0|        start_pos: u32,
  816|      0|        first_ch: u8,

  818|      0|        state: S,
  819|      0|        pred: F,
  820|      0|        kind_ctor: K,

  823|      0|        F: FnMut(&mut S, u8) -> bool,

  836|       |    /// Try to parse a UCN.
  837|       |    /// Assumes the leading backslash has already been consumed.
  838|       |    /// Returns:
  839|       |    /// - None: Not a UCN (didn't consume anything).
  840|       |    /// - Some(Ok((char, raw_string))): Valid UCN.
  841|       |    /// - Some(Err(raw_string)): Invalid UCN (consumed raw_string).
  842|      0|    fn lex_ucn(&mut self, allow_basic_charset: bool) -> Option<Result<(char, String), String>> {
  843|      0|        let is_u = match self.peek_char() {
  844|      0|            Some(b'u') => true,
  845|      0|            Some(b'U') => false,
  846|      0|            _ => return None,
  847|       |        };
  848|       |
  849|      0|        self.next_char(); // Consume u/U
  850|       |
  851|      0|        let digits_needed = if is_u { 4 } else { 8 };
  852|      0|        let mut hex_str = String::new();
  853|       |
  854|      0|        for _ in 0..digits_needed {
  855|      0|            if let Some(ch) = self.peek_char() {
  856|      0|                if ch.is_ascii_hexdigit() {
  857|      0|                    self.next_char();
  858|      0|                    hex_str.push(ch as char);
  859|      0|                } else {
  860|      0|                    break;
  861|       |                }
  862|       |            } else {
  863|      0|                break;
  864|       |            }
  865|       |        }
  866|       |
  867|      0|        let prefix = if is_u { "\\u" } else { "\\U" };
  868|      0|        let raw_string = format!("{}{}", prefix, hex_str);
  869|       |
  870|      0|        if hex_str.len() != digits_needed {
  871|      0|            return Some(Err(raw_string));
  872|      0|        }
  873|       |
  874|      0|        let code_point = u32::from_str_radix(&hex_str, 16).unwrap();
  875|       |
  876|       |        // Validation
  877|       |        // 1. Range
  878|      0|        if code_point > 0x10FFFF {
  879|      0|            return Some(Err(raw_string));
  880|      0|        }
  881|       |
  882|       |        // 2. Surrogates
  883|      0|        if (0xD800..=0xDFFF).contains(&code_point) {
  884|      0|            return Some(Err(raw_string));
  885|      0|        }
  886|       |
  887|       |        // 3. Basic Source Character Set
  888|       |        // 0000-009F excluding $, @, `
  889|      0|        if !allow_basic_charset && code_point < 0xA0 && code_point != 0x24 && code_point != 0x40 && code_point != 0x60 {
  890|      0|            return Some(Err(raw_string));
  891|      0|        }
  892|       |
  893|      0|        if let Some(c) = char::from_u32(code_point) {
  894|      0|            Some(Ok((c, raw_string)))
  895|       |        } else {
  896|      0|            Some(Err(raw_string))
  897|       |        }
  898|      0|    }

  900|      4|    fn lex_identifier(&mut self, start_pos: u32, first_ch: u8, flags: PPTokenFlags) -> PPToken {

 1075|      0|    fn lex_common_literal_body(&mut self, delimiter: u8, chars: &mut Vec<u8>, has_invalid_ucn: &mut bool) {

 1089|      0|                        chars.extend_from_slice(&raw.as_bytes()[1..]);
 1090|      0|                        continue;

 1093|       |                        // Invalid UCN.
 1094|      0|                        *has_invalid_ucn = true;
 1095|      0|                        chars.extend_from_slice(&raw.as_bytes()[1..]);
 1096|      0|                        continue;
 1097|       |                    }

 1099|      0|                        // Not a UCN (e.g. \n or \t or whatever)
 1100|      0|                        // Fall through to existing logic
 1101|      0|                    }

 1103|       |
 1104|      0|                if let Some(next_ch) = self.next_char() {
 1105|      0|                    chars.push(next_ch);

 1108|       |                // Handle UTF-8 multi-byte characters

 1112|      0|                        if (0x80..0xC0).contains(&continuation_ch) {
 1113|      0|                            chars.push(self.next_char().unwrap());
 1114|      0|                        } else {
 1115|      0|                            break;
 1116|       |                        }
 1117|       |                    }
 1118|      0|                }
 1119|      0|            }
 1120|       |        }
 1121|      0|    }

 1123|       |    /// Shared logic for lexing quoted literals (strings and chars)
 1124|      0|    fn lex_quoted_literal(&mut self, prefix: &[u8], delimiter: u8) -> (String, StringId, bool) {

  598|       |    /// Process source file and return preprocessed tokens
  599|      1|    pub fn process(&mut self, source_id: SourceId, _config: &PPConfig) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {
  600|       |        // Initialize lexer for main file
  601|      1|        let buffer_len = self.sm.get_buffer(source_id).len() as u32;
  602|      1|        let buffer = self.sm.get_buffer_arc(source_id);
  603|       |
  604|      1|        self.lexer_stack.push(PPLexer::new(source_id, buffer));
  605|      1|        self.sm.calculate_line_starts(source_id);
  606|       |
  607|      1|        let mut result_tokens = Vec::new();
  608|       |
  609|      8|        while let Some(token) = self.lex_token() {
                                     ^7
  610|      7|            match token.kind {
  611|       |                // Handle directive
  612|      0|                PPTokenKind::Hash if !token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::MACRO_EXPANDED) => {
  613|      0|                    self.handle_directive()?;
  614|       |                }
  615|       |                // Skip tokens when in conditional compilation skip mode
  616|      7|                _ if self.is_currently_skipping() => continue,
                                                              ^0   ^0
  617|       |                // Skip Eod tokens
  618|      0|                PPTokenKind::Eod => continue,
  619|       |                // Handle identifiers (macros, magic macros, _Pragma)
  620|      4|                PPTokenKind::Identifier(symbol) => {
  621|      4|                    let sym_str = symbol.as_str();
  622|      4|                    if let Some(magic) = self.try_expand_magic_macro(&token) {
                                              ^0
  623|      0|                        result_tokens.push(magic);
  624|      4|                    } else if sym_str == "_Pragma" {
  625|      0|                        self.handle_pragma_operator()?;
  626|      4|                    } else if let Some(expanded) = self.expand_macro(&token)? {
                                                     ^0                                   ^0
  627|      0|                        for t in expanded.into_iter().rev() {
  628|      0|                            self.pending_tokens.push_front(t);
  629|      0|                        }
  630|      4|                    } else {
  631|      4|                        result_tokens.push(token);
  632|      4|                    }
  633|       |                }
  634|       |                // All other tokens
  635|      3|                _ => result_tokens.push(token),
  636|       |            }
  637|       |        }
  638|       |
  639|       |        // Add EOF token
  640|      1|        result_tokens.push(PPToken::new(
  641|      1|            PPTokenKind::Eof,
  642|      1|            PPTokenFlags::empty(),
  643|      1|            SourceLoc::new(source_id, buffer_len),
  644|       |            0,
  645|       |        ));
  646|       |
  647|      1|        if !self.conditional_stack.is_empty() {
  648|      0|            let loc = self.get_current_location();
  649|      0|            self.report_diagnostic_simple(
  650|      0|                DiagnosticLevel::Error,
  651|       |                "Unclosed preprocessor conditional directive",
  652|      0|                SourceSpan::new(loc, loc),
  653|      0|                Some("unclosed_conditional".to_string()),
  654|      0|                vec!["Expected #endif before end of file".to_string()],
  655|       |            );
  656|      0|            return Err(PPError::UnexpectedEndOfFile);
  657|      1|        }
  658|       |
  659|      1|        Ok(result_tokens)
  660|      1|    }
  661|       |
  662|       |    /// Get the current location from the lexer stack
  663|      0|    fn get_current_location(&self) -> SourceLoc {
  664|      0|        if let Some(lexer) = self.lexer_stack.last() {
  665|      0|            SourceLoc::new(lexer.source_id, lexer.position)
  666|       |        } else {
  667|      0|            SourceLoc::builtin()
  668|       |        }
  669|      0|    }
  670|       |
  671|       |    /// Check if we are currently skipping tokens
  672|      7|    fn is_currently_skipping(&self) -> bool {
  673|       |        // Check if any conditional in the stack is currently skipping
  674|      7|        self.conditional_stack.iter().any(|info| info.was_skipping)
  675|      7|    }
  676|       |
  677|       |    /// Set the skipping state for the current conditional level
  678|      0|    fn set_skipping(&mut self, skipping: bool) {
  679|      0|        if let Some(info) = self.conditional_stack.last_mut() {
  680|      0|            info.was_skipping = skipping;
  681|      0|        } else {
  682|      0|            // No conditionals, don't skip
  683|      0|        }
  684|      0|    }

  686|       |    /// Parse a conditional expression for #if and #elif
  687|      0|    fn parse_conditional_expression(&mut self) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {
  688|      0|        let mut tokens = Vec::new();
  689|      0|        while let Some(token) = self.lex_token() {
  690|      0|            if token.kind == PPTokenKind::Eod {
  691|      0|                break;
  692|      0|            }
  693|      0|            tokens.push(token);
  694|       |        }
  695|       |
  696|      0|        if tokens.is_empty() {
  697|      0|            let span = SourceSpan::new(self.get_current_location(), self.get_current_location());
  698|      0|            let diag = Diagnostic {
  699|      0|                level: DiagnosticLevel::Error,
  700|      0|                message: "Invalid conditional expression".to_string(),
  701|      0|                span,
  702|      0|                code: Some("invalid_conditional_expression".to_string()),
  703|      0|                hints: vec!["Conditional directives require an expression".to_string()],
  704|      0|                related: Vec::new(),
  705|      0|            };
  706|      0|            self.diag.report_diagnostic(diag);
  707|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression);
  708|      0|        }
  709|       |
  710|      0|        Ok(tokens)
  711|      0|    }
  712|       |
  713|       |    /// Evaluate a conditional expression (simplified - handle defined and basic arithmetic)
  714|      0|    fn evaluate_conditional_expression(&mut self, tokens: Vec<PPToken>) -> Result<bool, PPError> {
  715|       |        // Bolt : Removed redundant filtering of Eod tokens and a buggy optimization.
  716|       |        // parse_conditional_expression already ensures no Eod tokens are present.
  717|       |        // This avoids two allocations and two full clones of the token list.
  718|       |        // The buggy 'defined' optimization was also removed as it incorrectly
  719|       |        // returned early for complex expressions like '#if defined(FOO) && 0'.
  720|       |        // Bolt : Optimized to take tokens by value, avoiding a redundant `to_vec()` clone.
  721|      0|        if tokens.is_empty() {
  722|       |            // For empty expressions, treat as false
  723|      0|            return Ok(false);
  724|      0|        }
  725|       |
  726|       |        // First, expand macros in the expression
  727|      0|        let mut expanded_tokens = tokens;
  728|      0|        match self.expand_tokens(&mut expanded_tokens, true) {
  729|      0|            Ok(_) => {}
  730|      0|            Err(_e) => {
  731|       |                // If macro expansion fails, emit diagnostic and treat as false
  732|      0|                let span = if !expanded_tokens.is_empty() {
  733|      0|                    SourceSpan::new(expanded_tokens[0].location, expanded_tokens.last().unwrap().location)
  734|       |                } else {
  735|      0|                    let loc = self.get_current_location();
  736|      0|                    SourceSpan::new(loc, loc)
  737|       |                };
  738|      0|                self.report_diagnostic_simple(
  739|      0|                    DiagnosticLevel::Warning,
  740|      0|                    "Failed to expand macros in conditional expression".to_string(),
  741|      0|                    span,
  742|      0|                    Some("macro_expansion_failed".to_string()),
  743|      0|                    vec!["Expression will be treated as false".to_string()],
  744|       |                );
  745|      0|                return Ok(false);
  746|       |            }
  747|       |        }
  748|       |
  749|       |        // Evaluate arithmetic expression with better error handling
  750|      0|        self.evaluate_arithmetic_expression(&expanded_tokens)
  751|      0|    }
  752|       |
  753|       |    /// Evaluate a simple arithmetic expression for #if/#elif
  754|      0|    fn evaluate_arithmetic_expression(&mut self, tokens: &[PPToken]) -> Result<bool, PPError> {
  755|      0|        if tokens.is_empty() {
  756|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidConditionalExpression);
  757|      0|        }
  758|       |
  759|      0|        let mut interpreter = Interpreter::new(tokens, self);
  760|      0|        let result = interpreter.evaluate();
  761|       |
  762|      0|        match result {
  763|      0|            Ok(val) => Ok(val.is_truthy()),
  764|       |            Err(_) => {
  765|       |                // For complex expressions that can't be parsed, emit a warning and treat as false
  766|      0|                let span = if !tokens.is_empty() {
  767|      0|                    SourceSpan::new(tokens[0].location, tokens.last().unwrap().location)
  768|       |                } else {
  769|      0|                    let loc = self.get_current_location();
  770|      0|                    SourceSpan::new(loc, loc)
  771|       |                };
  772|      0|                self.report_diagnostic_simple(
  773|      0|                    DiagnosticLevel::Warning,
  774|      0|                    "Invalid conditional expression in preprocessor directive".to_string(),
  775|      0|                    span,
  776|      0|                    Some("invalid_conditional_expression".to_string()),
  777|      0|                    vec!["Expression will be treated as false".to_string()],
  778|       |                );
  779|       |                // Return false for unparseable expressions to allow compilation to continue
  780|      0|                Ok(false)
  781|       |            }
  782|       |        }
  783|      0|    }
  784|       |
  785|       |    /// Lex the next token
  786|      1|    fn pop_finished_lexer(&mut self) -> bool {
  787|       |        // EOF reached, pop the lexer
  788|      1|        let popped_lexer = self.lexer_stack.pop().unwrap();
  789|       |
  790|       |        // If this was an included file, pop from include stack and decrement depth.
  791|      1|        if let Some(include_info) = self.include_stack.last()
                                  ^0
  792|      0|            && include_info.file_id == popped_lexer.source_id
  793|      0|        {
  794|      0|            self.include_stack.pop();
  795|      0|            self.include_depth -= 1;
  796|      1|        }
  797|       |
  798|       |        //  Bolt: Use `take_line_starts` to move the line_starts vector
  799|       |        // instead of cloning it. This is a performance optimization that
  800|       |        // avoids a potentially large allocation when a file is finished lexing.
  801|      1|        self.sm
  802|      1|            .set_line_starts(popped_lexer.source_id, popped_lexer.take_line_starts());
  803|       |
  804|      1|        !self.lexer_stack.is_empty()
  805|      1|    }
  806|       |
  807|       |    /// Lex the next token
  808|      8|    fn lex_token(&mut self) -> Option<PPToken> {
  809|      8|        if let Some(token) = self.pending_tokens.pop_front() {
                                  ^0
  810|      0|            return Some(token);
  811|      8|        }
  812|       |
  813|       |        loop {
  814|      8|            if let Some(lexer) = self.lexer_stack.last_mut() {
  815|      8|                if let Some(token) = lexer.next_token() {
                                          ^7
  816|      7|                    if token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::HAS_INVALID_UCN) {
  817|      0|                        self.report_diagnostic_simple(
  818|      0|                            DiagnosticLevel::Error,
  819|      0|                            "Invalid universal character name in literal".to_string(),
  820|      0|                            SourceSpan::new(token.location, token.location),
  821|      0|                            Some("invalid_ucn".to_string()),
  822|      0|                            Vec::new(),
  823|      0|                        );
  824|      7|                    }
  825|      7|                    return Some(token);
  826|       |                } else {
  827|       |                    // Current lexer finished
  828|      1|                    if !self.pop_finished_lexer() {
  829|      1|                        return None;
  830|      0|                    }
  831|       |                    // Continue to try the next lexer in the stack
  832|       |                }
  833|       |            } else {
  834|      0|                return None;
  835|       |            }
  836|       |        }
  837|      8|    }
  838|       |
  839|       |    /// Handle preprocessor directives
  840|      0|    fn handle_directive(&mut self) -> Result<(), PPError> {
  841|      0|        let token = self.lex_token().ok_or(PPError::UnexpectedEndOfFile)?;
  842|       |
  843|      0|        match token.kind {
  844|      0|            PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) => {
  845|       |                // Use O(1) interned keyword comparison
  846|      0|                match self.directive_keywords.is_directive(sym) {
  847|      0|                    Some(DirectiveKind::Define) => self.check_skipping_and_execute(|this| this.handle_define()),
  848|      0|                    Some(DirectiveKind::Undef) => self.check_skipping_and_execute(|this| this.handle_undef()),
  849|      0|                    Some(DirectiveKind::Include) => self.check_skipping_and_execute(|this| this.handle_include()),
  850|       |                    Some(DirectiveKind::If) => {
  851|       |                        // Always process #if to track nesting
  852|      0|                        if self.is_currently_skipping() {
  853|      0|                            self.push_skipped_conditional();
  854|      0|                            self.skip_directive()?;
  855|       |                        } else {
  856|      0|                            let expr_tokens = self.parse_conditional_expression().unwrap_or_default();
  857|      0|                            let condition = self.evaluate_conditional_expression(expr_tokens).unwrap_or(false);
  858|      0|                            self.handle_if_directive(condition)?;
  859|       |                        }
  860|      0|                        Ok(())
  861|       |                    }
  862|       |                    Some(DirectiveKind::Ifdef) => {
  863|      0|                        if self.is_currently_skipping() {
  864|      0|                            self.push_skipped_conditional();
  865|      0|                            self.skip_directive()?;
  866|       |                        } else {
  867|      0|                            self.handle_ifdef()?;
  868|       |                        }
  869|      0|                        Ok(())
  870|       |                    }
  871|       |                    Some(DirectiveKind::Ifndef) => {
  872|      0|                        if self.is_currently_skipping() {
  873|      0|                            self.push_skipped_conditional();
  874|      0|                            self.skip_directive()?;
  875|       |                        } else {
  876|      0|                            self.handle_ifndef()?;
  877|       |                        }
  878|      0|                        Ok(())
  879|       |                    }
  880|       |                    Some(DirectiveKind::Elif) => {
  881|      0|                        if self.should_evaluate_conditional() {
  882|      0|                            let expr_tokens = self.parse_conditional_expression().unwrap_or_default();
  883|      0|                            let condition = self.evaluate_conditional_expression(expr_tokens).unwrap_or(false);

  924|       |    /// Check if skipping is active, and if so, skip the directive. Otherwise, execute the action.

  926|      0|    where
  927|      0|        F: FnOnce(&mut Self) -> Result<(), PPError>,
  928|       |    {
  929|      0|        if self.is_currently_skipping() {
  930|      0|            self.skip_directive()
  931|       |        } else {
  932|      0|            action(self)
  933|       |        }
  934|      0|    }

  936|       |    /// Handle _Pragma("...") operator
  937|      0|    fn handle_pragma_operator(&mut self) -> Result<(), PPError> {
  938|       |        // We have already consumed the `_Pragma` identifier.
  939|       |        // Expect '('.
  940|      0|        if self.lex_token().is_none_or(|t| t.kind != PPTokenKind::LeftParen) {
  941|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidDirective);
  942|      0|        }
  943|       |
  944|       |        // Expect string literal.
  945|      0|        let string_token = self.lex_token().ok_or(PPError::UnexpectedEndOfFile)?;
  946|      0|        let pragma_content = if let PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(symbol) = string_token.kind {
  947|      0|            self.destringize(symbol.as_str())
  948|       |        } else {
  949|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidDirective);
  950|       |        };
  951|       |
  952|       |        // Expect ')'.
  953|      0|        if self.lex_token().is_none_or(|t| t.kind != PPTokenKind::RightParen) {
  954|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidDirective);
  955|      0|        }
  956|       |
  957|      0|        self.perform_pragma(&pragma_content);
  958|       |
  959|      0|        Ok(())
  960|      0|    }

  967|       |    /// Tokenize the content of a pragma directive
  968|      0|    fn tokenize_pragma_content(&mut self, pragma_content: &str) -> Vec<PPToken> {
  969|       |        // Create a buffer for the pragma content
  970|      0|        let source_id = self
  971|      0|            .sm
  972|      0|            .add_buffer(pragma_content.as_bytes().to_vec(), "<_Pragma>", None);
  973|      0|        let buffer = self.sm.get_buffer_arc(source_id);
  974|      0|        let mut temp_lexer = PPLexer::new(source_id, buffer);
  975|       |
  976|       |        // Collect all tokens from the pragma content
  977|      0|        let mut tokens = Vec::new();
  978|      0|        while let Some(token) = temp_lexer.next_token() {
  979|      0|            if matches!(token.kind, PPTokenKind::Eod | PPTokenKind::Eof) {
  980|      0|                continue;
  981|      0|            }
  982|      0|            tokens.push(token);
  983|       |        }
  984|       |
  985|       |        // Determine location for the synthetic EOD
  986|      0|        let eod_loc = if let Some(last) = tokens.last() {
  987|      0|            last.location
  988|       |        } else {
  989|      0|            SourceLoc::new(source_id, 0)
  990|       |        };
  991|       |
  992|       |        // Append EOD token to mark end of pragma
  993|      0|        tokens.push(PPToken::new(PPTokenKind::Eod, PPTokenFlags::empty(), eod_loc, 0));
  994|       |
  995|      0|        tokens
  996|      0|    }
  997|       |
  998|       |    /// Perform the action of a pragma directive
  999|      0|    fn perform_pragma(&mut self, pragma_content: &str) {
 1000|      0|        let tokens = self.tokenize_pragma_content(pragma_content);
 1001|       |
 1002|       |        // Push to pending_tokens in reverse order so they come out in correct order
 1003|      0|        for token in tokens.into_iter().rev() {
 1004|      0|            self.pending_tokens.push_front(token);
 1005|      0|        }
 1006|       |
 1007|       |        // Execute pragma handler
 1008|       |        // handle_pragma will consume tokens from pending_tokens
 1009|      0|        if self.handle_pragma().is_err() {
 1010|       |            // If handle_pragma failed (e.g. unknown pragma), it might not have consumed all tokens.
 1011|       |            // We must consume the remaining tokens of this pragma until EOD to ensure they don't leak.
 1012|      0|            while let Some(token) = self.lex_token() {
 1013|      0|                if token.kind == PPTokenKind::Eod {
 1014|      0|                    break;
 1015|      0|                }
 1016|       |            }
 1017|      0|        }
 1018|      0|    }

 1031|       |                PPTokenKind::RightParen | PPTokenKind::Identifier(_) | PPTokenKind::Ellipsis
 1032|       |            ) {

 1038|      0|            self.pending_tokens.push_front(token);
 1039|      0|            return Ok((MacroFlags::empty(), Vec::new(), None));
 1040|      0|        }

 1142|      0|    fn handle_include(&mut self) -> Result<(), PPError> {

 1190|      0|                        }

 1195|      0|                            .ok_or(PPError::InvalidIncludePath)?;

 1213|       |                            );
 1214|      0|                            return Err(PPError::ExpectedEod);

 1217|       |                    }
 1218|      0|                    _ => return Err(PPError::InvalidIncludePath),
 1219|       |                }

 1221|       |        };

 1248|      0|    fn resolve_include_path(&mut self, path: &str, is_angled: bool, loc: SourceLoc) -> Result<SourceId, PPError> {

 1326|      0|    fn handle_elif_directive(&mut self, condition: bool, location: SourceLoc) -> Result<(), PPError> {
 1327|      0|        if self.conditional_stack.is_empty() {
 1328|      0|            self.report_unmatched_directive("#elif", location);
 1329|      0|            return Err(PPError::ElifWithoutIf);
 1330|      0|        }
 1331|      0|        let current = self.conditional_stack.last_mut().unwrap();
 1332|       |
 1333|      0|        if current.found_else {
 1334|      0|            self.report_invalid_conditional_order("#elif", location);
 1335|      0|            return Err(PPError::UnmatchedElif);
 1336|      0|        }
 1337|       |
 1338|      0|        let should_process = !current.found_non_skipping && condition;
 1339|      0|        if should_process {
 1340|      0|            current.found_non_skipping = true;
 1341|      0|        }
 1342|      0|        current.was_skipping = !should_process;
 1343|       |
 1344|      0|        Ok(())
 1345|      0|    }

 1347|      0|    fn handle_else(&mut self, location: SourceLoc) -> Result<(), PPError> {

 1598|      0|    fn parse_pragma_message_content(&mut self) -> Result<String, PPError> {
 1599|      0|        if self.lex_token().is_none_or(|t| t.kind != PPTokenKind::LeftParen) {

 1609|       |                PPTokenKind::RightParen

 1611|      0|                        depth -= 1;
 1612|      0|                        depth == 0

 1704|       |
 1705|      0|    fn read_directive_message(&mut self) -> String {
 1706|       |        // Optimization: Avoid multiple small allocations by calculating final string size first.
 1707|       |        // This follows the two-pass approach:
 1708|       |        // 1. Collect tokens for the line.
 1709|       |        // 2. Calculate the total length required for the string.
 1710|       |        // 3. Allocate a single string with the required capacity.
 1711|       |        // 4. Populate the string in a second pass over the tokens.
 1712|      0|        let mut tokens = Vec::new();
 1713|      0|        while let Some(token) = self.lex_token() {
 1714|      0|            if token.kind == PPTokenKind::Eod {
 1715|      0|                break;
 1716|      0|            }
 1717|      0|            tokens.push(token);
 1718|       |        }
 1719|       |
 1720|      0|        if tokens.is_empty() {
 1721|      0|            return String::new();
 1722|      0|        }
 1723|       |
 1724|       |        // Calculate total length
 1725|      0|        let mut total_len = 0;
 1726|      0|        for (i, token) in tokens.iter().enumerate() {
 1727|      0|            total_len += token.length as usize;
 1728|      0|            if i > 0 {
 1729|      0|                total_len += 1; // For the space separator
 1730|      0|            }
 1731|       |        }
 1732|       |
 1733|       |        // Allocate and build the string
 1734|      0|        let mut result = String::with_capacity(total_len);
 1735|      0|        for (i, token) in tokens.iter().enumerate() {
 1736|      0|            if i > 0 {
 1737|      0|                result.push(' ');
 1738|      0|            }
 1739|      0|            let buffer = self.sm.get_buffer(token.location.source_id());
 1740|      0|            let start = token.location.offset() as usize;
 1741|      0|            let end = start + token.length as usize;
 1742|      0|            if end <= buffer.len() {
 1743|      0|                // This is safe because the lexer guarantees tokens are valid UTF-8.
 1744|      0|                let text = unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&buffer[start..end]) };
 1745|      0|                result.push_str(text);
 1746|      0|            }
 1747|       |        }
 1748|       |
 1749|      0|        result
 1750|      0|    }
 1751|       |
 1752|       |    /// Expand a macro if it exists
 1753|      4|    pub(crate) fn expand_macro(&mut self, token: &PPToken) -> Result<Option<Vec<PPToken>>, PPError> {
 1754|      4|        let PPTokenKind::Identifier(symbol) = token.kind else {
 1755|      0|            return Ok(None);
 1756|       |        };
 1757|       |
 1758|      4|        let macro_info = self
 1759|      4|            .macros
 1760|      4|            .get(&symbol)
 1761|      4|            .filter(|m| !m.flags.contains(MacroFlags::DISABLED))
                                       ^0      ^0
 1762|      4|            .cloned();
 1763|       |
 1764|      4|        let Some(macro_info) = macro_info else {
                               ^0
 1765|      4|            return Ok(None);
 1766|       |        };
 1767|       |
 1768|       |        // Bolt : Check for recursive expansion here to avoid walking include stack for non-macros.
 1769|      0|        if self.is_recursive_expansion(token.location, symbol.as_str()) {
 1770|      0|            return Ok(None);
 1771|      0|        }
 1772|       |
 1773|      0|        if macro_info.flags.contains(MacroFlags::FUNCTION_LIKE) {
 1774|      0|            let next = self.lex_token();
 1775|      0|            let is_call = matches!(next, Some(ref t) if t.kind == PPTokenKind::LeftParen);
 1776|      0|            if let Some(t) = next {
 1777|      0|                self.pending_tokens.push_front(t);
 1778|      0|            }
 1779|      0|            if !is_call {
 1780|      0|                return Ok(None);
 1781|      0|            }
 1782|      0|        }
 1783|       |
 1784|      0|        if let Some(m) = self.macros.get_mut(&symbol) {
 1785|      0|            m.flags |= MacroFlags::USED | MacroFlags::DISABLED;
 1786|      0|        }
 1787|       |
 1788|      0|        let result = if macro_info.flags.contains(MacroFlags::FUNCTION_LIKE) {
 1789|      0|            self.expand_function_macro(&macro_info, &symbol, token)
 1790|       |        } else {
 1791|      0|            self.expand_object_macro(&macro_info, &symbol, token)
 1792|       |        };
 1793|       |
 1794|      0|        if let Some(m) = self.macros.get_mut(&symbol) {
 1795|      0|            m.flags.remove(MacroFlags::DISABLED);
 1796|      0|        }
 1797|       |
 1798|      0|        result.map(Some)
 1799|      4|    }
 1800|       |
 1801|       |    /// Helper to convert tokens to their string representation
 1802|      0|    fn tokens_to_string(&self, tokens: &[PPToken]) -> String {
 1803|       |        // Bolt : Optimized two-pass string building.
 1804|       |        // We use the token's length field for the first pass as it's a fast u16 access.
 1805|       |        // This avoids calling get_text() in the first pass. The raw length is a safe
 1806|       |        // upper bound for the cleaned text length.
 1807|      0|        let total_len: usize = tokens.iter().map(|t| t.length as usize).sum();
 1808|       |
 1809|       |        // 2. Allocate the string with the exact capacity.
 1810|      0|        let mut result = String::with_capacity(total_len);
 1811|       |
 1812|       |        // 3. Populate the string.
 1813|       |        // Bolt : Use direct buffer access to avoid interner lookups and kind matching.
 1814|      0|        let mut last_sid = None;
 1815|      0|        let mut last_buffer = None;
 1816|      0|        for token in tokens {
 1817|      0|            let sid = token.location.source_id();
 1818|      0|            let buffer = if last_sid == Some(sid) {
 1819|      0|                last_buffer.unwrap()
 1820|       |            } else {
 1821|       |                // Bolt : Check if the token has associated file info before trying to access its buffer.
 1822|       |                // This correctly handles built-in tokens (like those from SourceId 1) which don't have buffers.
 1823|      0|                if self.sm.get_file_info(sid).is_none() {
 1824|      0|                    result.push_str(token.get_text());
 1825|      0|                    continue;
 1826|      0|                }
 1827|      0|                let b = self.sm.get_buffer(sid);
 1828|      0|                last_sid = Some(sid);
 1829|      0|                last_buffer = Some(b);
 1830|      0|                b
 1831|       |            };
 1832|      0|            let start = token.location.offset() as usize;
 1833|      0|            let end = start + token.length as usize;
 1834|      0|            if end <= buffer.len() {
 1835|      0|                // Safety: Tokens are guaranteed to be valid UTF-8 by the lexer.
 1836|      0|                result.push_str(unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&buffer[start..end]) });
 1837|      0|            } else {
 1838|       |                // Bolt : Fallback for unexpected cases (e.g., internal inconsistencies).
 1839|      0|                debug_assert!(false, "Token bounds exceed buffer length");
 1840|      0|                result.push_str(token.get_text());
 1841|       |            }
 1842|       |        }

 1892|       |    /// Parse macro arguments from the current lexer
 1893|      0|    fn parse_macro_args_from_lexer(&mut self, macro_info: &MacroInfo) -> Result<Vec<Vec<PPToken>>, PPError> {
 1894|      0|        let token = self.lex_token().ok_or(PPError::UnexpectedEndOfFile)?;
 1895|      0|        if token.kind != PPTokenKind::LeftParen {
 1896|      0|            let span = SourceSpan::new(token.location, token.location);
 1897|      0|            self.pending_tokens.push_front(token);
 1898|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidMacroParameter { span });
 1899|      0|        }
 1900|       |
 1901|      0|        let mut args = Vec::new();
 1902|      0|        let mut current_arg = Vec::new();
 1903|      0|        let mut depth = 0;
 1904|       |
 1905|      0|        while let Some(t) = self.lex_token() {
 1906|      0|            match t.kind {
 1907|      0|                PPTokenKind::Eof => break,
 1908|      0|                PPTokenKind::LeftParen => {
 1909|      0|                    depth += 1;
 1910|      0|                    current_arg.push(t);
 1911|      0|                }
 1912|      0|                PPTokenKind::RightParen if depth > 0 => {
 1913|      0|                    depth -= 1;
 1914|      0|                    current_arg.push(t);
 1915|      0|                }
 1916|       |                PPTokenKind::RightParen => {
 1917|      0|                    if !current_arg.is_empty() || !args.is_empty() {
 1918|      0|                        args.push(current_arg);
 1919|      0|                    }
 1920|       |
 1921|      0|                    let expected = macro_info.parameter_list.len();
 1922|      0|                    let valid = if macro_info.variadic_arg.is_some() {
 1923|      0|                        args.len() >= expected
 1924|       |                    } else {
 1925|      0|                        args.len() == expected
 1926|       |                    };
 1927|       |
 1928|      0|                    if valid {
 1929|      0|                        return Ok(args);
 1930|      0|                    }
 1931|       |
 1932|      0|                    return Err(PPError::InvalidMacroParameter {
 1933|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::new(macro_info.location, macro_info.location),
 1934|      0|                    });
 1935|       |                }
 1936|      0|                PPTokenKind::Comma if depth == 0 => {
 1937|      0|                    args.push(std::mem::take(&mut current_arg));
 1938|      0|                }
 1939|      0|                _ => current_arg.push(t),
 1940|       |            }
 1941|       |        }
 1942|       |
 1943|      0|        Err(PPError::UnexpectedEndOfFile)
 1944|      0|    }

 1946|       |    /// Helper to collect variadic arguments with commas inserted

 1951|      0|        trigger_loc: SourceLoc,

 1984|      0|    fn get_macro_param_tokens<'a>(
 1985|      0|        &mut self,
 1986|      0|        macro_info: &MacroInfo,
 1987|      0|        symbol: StringId,
 1988|      0|        args: &'a [Vec<PPToken>],

 2003|       |    /// Substitute parameters in macro body
 2004|      0|    fn substitute_macro(
 2005|      0|        &mut self,
 2006|      0|        macro_info: &MacroInfo,
 2007|      0|        args: &[Vec<PPToken>],
 2008|      0|        expanded_args: &[Vec<PPToken>],
 2009|      0|    ) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {
 2010|       |        // Bolt : Pre-allocate result vector to minimize reallocations during substitution.
 2011|       |        // The macro body size is a good baseline capacity.
 2012|      0|        let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(macro_info.tokens.len());
 2013|      0|        let mut i = 0;
 2014|      0|        let mut last_token_produced_output = false;
 2015|       |
 2016|      0|        while i < macro_info.tokens.len() {
 2017|      0|            let token = &macro_info.tokens[i];
 2018|       |
 2019|      0|            match token.kind {
 2020|      0|                PPTokenKind::Hash if i + 1 < macro_info.tokens.len() => {
 2021|      0|                    let next = &macro_info.tokens[i + 1];
 2022|      0|                    if let PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) = next.kind
 2023|      0|                        && let Some(arg) = self.get_macro_param_tokens(macro_info, sym, args, token.location)
 2024|       |                    {
 2025|      0|                        result.push(self.stringify_tokens(&arg, token.location)?);
 2026|      0|                        last_token_produced_output = true;
 2027|      0|                        i += 2;
 2028|      0|                        continue;
 2029|      0|                    }
 2030|       |                }
 2031|      0|                PPTokenKind::HashHash if i + 1 < macro_info.tokens.len() => {
 2032|      0|                    let right_token = &macro_info.tokens[i + 1];
 2033|       |
 2034|       |                    // Determine the left operand
 2035|      0|                    let left = if last_token_produced_output {
 2036|       |                        // If the previous token produced output, the left operand is the last token in the result
 2037|      0|                        result.pop()
 2038|       |                    } else {
 2039|       |                        // If the previous token produced no output (empty placemarker), the left operand is empty
 2040|      0|                        None
 2041|       |                    };
 2042|       |
 2043|      0|                    let right_tokens = if let PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) = right_token.kind {
 2044|      0|                        self.get_macro_param_tokens(macro_info, sym, args, right_token.location)
 2045|      0|                            .unwrap_or(Cow::Borrowed(std::slice::from_ref(right_token)))
 2046|       |                    } else {
 2047|      0|                        Cow::Borrowed(std::slice::from_ref(right_token))
 2048|       |                    };
 2049|       |
 2050|      0|                    if right_tokens.is_empty() {
 2051|       |                        // Right operand is empty (placemarker)
 2052|       |
 2053|       |                        // Check for GNU comma swallowing extension
 2054|       |                        // #define M(args...) , ## args
 2055|       |                        // M() -> empty (swallow comma)
 2056|       |                        // Left must be comma.
 2057|      0|                        let is_comma = left.as_ref().is_some_and(|t| t.kind == PPTokenKind::Comma);
 2058|      0|                        let is_variadic = matches!(right_token.kind, PPTokenKind::Identifier(s) if macro_info.variadic_arg == Some(s));
 2059|       |
 2060|      0|                        if is_comma && is_variadic {
 2061|      0|                            // Swallow comma: do not push left back
 2062|      0|                            last_token_produced_output = false;
 2063|      0|                        } else {
 2064|       |                            // Standard behavior: paste left with empty -> left
 2065|      0|                            if let Some(l) = left {
 2066|      0|                                result.push(l);
 2067|      0|                                last_token_produced_output = true;
 2068|      0|                            } else {
 2069|      0|                                // empty ## empty -> empty
 2070|      0|                                last_token_produced_output = false;
 2071|      0|                            }
 2072|       |                        }
 2073|       |                    } else {
 2074|       |                        // Right operand is not empty
 2075|      0|                        if let Some(l) = left {
 2076|       |                            // Paste left ## right[0]
 2077|      0|                            let pasted = self.paste_tokens(&l, &right_tokens[0])?;
 2078|      0|                            let pasted_count = pasted.len();
 2079|      0|                            result.extend(pasted);
 2080|      0|                            result.extend(right_tokens.iter().skip(1).copied());
 2081|       |                            // If pasting resulted in tokens, or right had more tokens, we have output
 2082|      0|                            last_token_produced_output = pasted_count > 0 || right_tokens.len() > 1;
 2083|      0|                        } else {
 2084|      0|                            // empty ## right -> right
 2085|      0|                            // (Placemarker at start)
 2086|      0|                            result.extend(right_tokens.iter().copied());
 2087|      0|                            last_token_produced_output = true;
 2088|      0|                        }
 2089|       |                    }
 2090|      0|                    i += 2;
 2091|      0|                    continue;
 2092|       |                }
 2093|      0|                PPTokenKind::Identifier(sym) if self.is_macro_param(macro_info, sym) => {
 2094|      0|                    let next_is_hh =
 2095|      0|                        i + 1 < macro_info.tokens.len() && macro_info.tokens[i + 1].kind == PPTokenKind::HashHash;
 2096|      0|                    let src = if next_is_hh { args } else { expanded_args };
 2097|       |                    // Bolt : Avoid redundant Vec allocation by using get_macro_param_tokens with Cow.
 2098|      0|                    if let Some(param_tokens) = self.get_macro_param_tokens(macro_info, sym, src, token.location) {
 2099|      0|                        if param_tokens.is_empty() {
 2100|      0|                            last_token_produced_output = false;
 2101|      0|                        } else {
 2102|      0|                            result.extend(param_tokens.iter().copied());
 2103|      0|                            last_token_produced_output = true;
 2104|      0|                        }
 2105|      0|                    } else {
 2106|      0|                        // Should not happen if is_macro_param is correct, but safe fallback
 2107|      0|                        last_token_produced_output = false;
 2108|      0|                    }
 2109|       |                }
 2110|      0|                _ => {
 2111|      0|                    result.push(*token);
 2112|      0|                    last_token_produced_output = true;
 2113|      0|                }
 2114|       |            }
 2115|      0|            i += 1;
 2116|       |        }
 2117|       |
 2118|      0|        Ok(result)
 2119|      0|    }

 2121|       |    /// Stringify tokens for # operator
 2122|      0|    pub(crate) fn stringify_tokens(&self, tokens: &[PPToken], location: SourceLoc) -> Result<PPToken, PPError> {
 2123|       |        // Bolt : Use a two-pass approach to build the stringified token efficiently.
 2124|       |        // This avoids multiple reallocations from push/push_str in a loop.
 2125|       |        // 1. Calculate the final length of the string, accounting for escaped characters.
 2126|      0|        let mut total_len = 2; // For the opening and closing quotes
 2127|      0|        let mut last_sid = None;
 2128|      0|        let mut last_buffer = None;
 2129|       |
 2130|      0|        for (i, token) in tokens.iter().enumerate() {
 2131|      0|            if i > 0 && token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::LEADING_SPACE) {
 2132|      0|                total_len += 1; // For the space
 2133|      0|            }
 2134|      0|            let sid = token.location.source_id();
 2135|      0|            let buffer = if last_sid == Some(sid) {
 2136|      0|                last_buffer.unwrap()
 2137|       |            } else {
 2138|      0|                let b = self.sm.get_buffer(sid);
 2139|      0|                last_sid = Some(sid);
 2140|      0|                last_buffer = Some(b);
 2141|      0|                b
 2142|       |            };
 2143|      0|            let start = token.location.offset() as usize;
 2144|      0|            let end = start + token.length as usize;
 2145|      0|            if end > buffer.len() {
 2146|      0|                return Err(PPError::InvalidStringification);
 2147|      0|            }
 2148|       |
 2149|       |            //  Bolt: Use byte-based iteration for correctness and speed.
 2150|       |            // Iterating over bytes is faster than UTF-8 chars and correctly calculates
 2151|       |            // the required byte capacity for multi-byte characters.
 2152|      0|            let bytes = &buffer[start..end];
 2153|      0|            for &b in bytes {
 2154|      0|                match b {
 2155|      0|                    b'"' | b'\\' => total_len += 2, // These will be escaped
 2156|      0|                    _ => total_len += 1,
 2157|       |                }
 2158|       |            }
 2159|       |        }
 2160|       |
 2161|       |        // 2. Allocate the string with the exact capacity.
 2162|      0|        let mut result = String::with_capacity(total_len);
 2163|      0|        result.push('"');
 2164|       |
 2165|       |        // 3. Populate the string efficiently.
 2166|      0|        last_sid = None;
 2167|      0|        last_buffer = None;
 2168|      0|        for (i, token) in tokens.iter().enumerate() {
 2169|      0|            if i > 0 && token.flags.contains(PPTokenFlags::LEADING_SPACE) {
 2170|      0|                result.push(' ');
 2171|      0|            }
 2172|       |
 2173|      0|            let sid = token.location.source_id();
 2174|      0|            let buffer = if last_sid == Some(sid) {
 2175|      0|                last_buffer.unwrap()
 2176|       |            } else {
 2177|      0|                let b = self.sm.get_buffer(sid);
 2178|      0|                last_sid = Some(sid);
 2179|      0|                last_buffer = Some(b);
 2180|      0|                b
 2181|       |            };
 2182|      0|            let start = token.location.offset() as usize;
 2183|      0|            let end = start + token.length as usize;
 2184|       |            // This check is already done above, but for safety we keep it.
 2185|      0|            if end <= buffer.len() {
 2186|       |                //  Bolt: Chunked string building using slices.
 2187|       |                // This avoids the overhead of character-by-character iteration and pushing.
 2188|      0|                let bytes = &buffer[start..end];
 2189|      0|                let mut last_start = 0;
 2190|      0|                for (j, &b) in bytes.iter().enumerate() {
 2191|      0|                    if b == b'"' || b == b'\\' {
 2192|      0|                        if j > last_start {
 2193|      0|                            result.push_str(unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&bytes[last_start..j]) });
 2194|      0|                        }
 2195|      0|                        if b == b'"' {
 2196|      0|                            result.push_str("\\\"");
 2197|      0|                        } else {
 2198|      0|                            result.push_str("\\\\");
 2199|      0|                        }
 2200|      0|                        last_start = j + 1;
 2201|      0|                    }
 2202|       |                }
 2203|      0|                if last_start < bytes.len() {
 2204|      0|                    result.push_str(unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&bytes[last_start..]) });
 2205|      0|                }
 2206|      0|            }
 2207|       |        }
 2208|       |
 2209|      0|        result.push('"');
 2210|       |
 2211|      0|        Ok(PPToken::new(
 2212|      0|            PPTokenKind::StringLiteral(StringId::new(&result)),
 2213|      0|            PPTokenFlags::empty(),
 2214|      0|            location,
 2215|      0|            result.len() as u16,
 2216|      0|        ))
 2217|      0|    }

 2219|       |    /// Paste tokens for ## operator
 2220|      0|    fn paste_tokens(&mut self, left: &PPToken, right: &PPToken) -> Result<Vec<PPToken>, PPError> {
 2221|       |        // Get text of both tokens
 2222|      0|        let left_buffer = self.sm.get_buffer(left.location.source_id());
 2223|      0|        let left_start = left.location.offset() as usize;
 2224|      0|        let left_end = left_start + left.length as usize;
 2225|      0|        let left_text = if left_end <= left_buffer.len() {
 2226|      0|            unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&left_buffer[left_start..left_end]) }
 2227|       |        } else {
 2228|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidTokenPasting);
 2229|       |        };
 2230|       |
 2231|      0|        let right_buffer = self.sm.get_buffer(right.location.source_id());
 2232|      0|        let right_start = right.location.offset() as usize;
 2233|      0|        let right_end = right_start + right.length as usize;
 2234|      0|        let right_text = if right_end <= right_buffer.len() {
 2235|      0|            unsafe { std::str::from_utf8_unchecked(&right_buffer[right_start..right_end]) }
 2236|       |        } else {
 2237|      0|            return Err(PPError::InvalidTokenPasting);
 2238|       |        };
 2239|       |
 2240|      0|        let pasted_text = format!("{}{}", left_text, right_text);
 2241|       |

 2243|      0|        let virtual_buffer = pasted_text.clone().into_bytes();

 2248|      0|        let mut lexer = PPLexer::new(virtual_id, buffer);
 2249|       |

 2252|      0|            if matches!(token.kind, PPTokenKind::Eod | PPTokenKind::Eof) {
 2253|      0|                continue;
 2254|      0|            }
 2255|      0|            tokens.push(token);
 2256|       |        }
 2257|       |
 2258|       |        // If the result is not a valid preprocessing token, the behavior is undefined.
 2259|       |        // We will return whatever tokens we got.
 2260|      0|        Ok(tokens)
 2261|      0|    }

 2321|      0|        while j < args.len() && expansions < 1000 {
 2322|      0|            if j == 0
 2323|      0|                && !args.is_empty()

 2560|      0|    fn is_recursive_expansion(&self, location: SourceLoc, macro_name: &str) -> bool {
 2561|       |        // Bolt : Optimization: avoid format! and Path allocation in a hot loop.
 2562|       |        // We check the path directly by string prefix/suffix which is much faster.
 2563|      0|        std::iter::successors(self.sm.get_file_info(location.source_id()), |info| {
 2564|      0|            info.include_loc.and_then(|loc| self.sm.get_file_info(loc.source_id()))
 2565|      0|        })
 2566|      0|        .take(100)
 2567|      0|        .any(|info| {
 2568|      0|            let path_str = info.path.to_str().unwrap_or("");
 2569|       |            // Bolt : Prefix "<macro_" is 7 chars, suffix ">" is 1 char. Total 8.
 2570|      0|            path_str.len() == macro_name.len() + 8
 2571|      0|                && path_str.starts_with("<macro_")
 2572|      0|                && path_str.ends_with('>')
 2573|      0|                && &path_str[7..path_str.len() - 1] == macro_name
 2574|      0|        })
 2575|      0|    }

  145|       |    /// Recursively visit type to find any expressions (e.g. VLA sizes) and resolve them.
  146|      0|    fn visit_type_expressions(&mut self, qt: QualType) {
  147|      0|        let ty = qt.ty();
  148|       |        //  Bolt: Optimized duplicate check.
  149|       |        // `HashSet::insert` returns `false` if the value was already present.
  150|       |        // This is faster than calling `contains` and then `insert`, as it
  151|       |        // performs a single lookup instead of two.
  152|      0|        if !self.checked_types.insert(ty) {
  153|      0|            return;
  154|      0|        }
  155|       |
  156|       |        // To avoid infinite recursion on recursive types (e.g. struct A { struct A *next; }),
  157|       |        // we rely on checked_types.
  158|       |        // Note: We need to clone the kind to avoid borrowing self.registry while calling self methods
  159|      0|        let kind = self.registry.get(ty).kind.clone();
  160|       |
  161|      0|        match kind {
  162|      0|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, size } => {
  163|      0|                if let ArraySizeType::Variable(expr) = size {
  164|      0|                    self.visit_node(expr);
  165|      0|                }
  166|      0|                self.visit_type_expressions(QualType::unqualified(element_type));
  167|       |            }
  168|      0|            TypeKind::Pointer { pointee } => {
  169|      0|                self.visit_type_expressions(pointee);
  170|      0|            }
  171|       |            TypeKind::Function {
  172|      0|                return_type,
  173|      0|                parameters,
  174|       |                ..
  175|       |            } => {
  176|      0|                self.visit_type_expressions(QualType::unqualified(return_type));
  177|      0|                for param in parameters {
  178|      0|                    self.visit_type_expressions(param.param_type);
  179|      0|                }
  180|       |            }
  181|      0|            TypeKind::Complex { base_type } => {
  182|      0|                self.visit_type_expressions(QualType::unqualified(base_type));
  183|      0|            }
  184|       |            // For Records and Enums, we don't need to traverse members because
  185|       |            // they cannot contain VLAs (C11 6.7.2.1).
  186|       |            // Even if they did, the members would be visited during their declaration processing.
  187|      0|            _ => {}
  188|       |        }
  189|      0|    }

  191|      0|    fn can_fall_through(&self, node_ref: NodeRef) -> bool {
  192|      0|        match self.ast.get_kind(node_ref) {
  193|      0|            NodeKind::Return(_) | NodeKind::Break | NodeKind::Continue | NodeKind::Goto(_, _) => false,
  194|      0|            NodeKind::If(if_stmt) => {
  195|      0|                let then_ft = self.can_fall_through(if_stmt.then_branch);
  196|      0|                let else_ft = if_stmt.else_branch.is_none_or(|e| self.can_fall_through(e));
  197|      0|                then_ft || else_ft
  198|       |            }
  199|      0|            NodeKind::ExpressionStatement(Some(expr_ref)) => {
  200|      0|                if let NodeKind::FunctionCall(call) = self.ast.get_kind(*expr_ref)
  201|      0|                    && let Some(callee_type) = self.semantic_info.types[call.callee.index()]
  202|      0|                    && let TypeKind::Function { is_noreturn, .. } = &self.registry.get(callee_type.ty()).kind
  203|       |                {
  204|      0|                    return !*is_noreturn;
  205|      0|                }
  206|      0|                true
  207|       |            }
  208|       |            NodeKind::While(_) => {
  209|       |                // While loop can only be exited via break, so it can fall through.
  210|      0|                true
  211|       |            }
  212|      0|            NodeKind::For(for_stmt) => {
  213|       |                // A for loop without a condition is infinite unless there's a break.
  214|      0|                for_stmt.condition.is_some()
  215|       |            }
  216|      0|            NodeKind::CompoundStatement(cs) => {
  217|      0|                if cs.stmt_len > 0 {
  218|      0|                    let last_item_idx = cs.stmt_start.get() + (cs.stmt_len - 1) as u32;
  219|      0|                    let last_item_ref = NodeRef::new(last_item_idx).unwrap();
  220|      0|                    self.can_fall_through(last_item_ref)
  221|       |                } else {
  222|      0|                    true
  223|       |                }
  224|       |            }
  225|      0|            _ => true,
  226|       |        }
  227|      0|    }
  228|       |
  229|      0|    fn is_lvalue(&self, node_ref: NodeRef) -> bool {
  230|      0|        let node_kind = self.ast.get_kind(node_ref);
  231|      0|        match node_kind {
  232|      0|            NodeKind::Ident(_, symbol_ref) => {
  233|      0|                let symbol = self.symbol_table.get_symbol(*symbol_ref);
  234|      0|                matches!(symbol.kind, SymbolKind::Variable { .. } | SymbolKind::Function { .. })
  235|       |            }
  236|      0|            NodeKind::UnaryOp(op, _) => matches!(*op, UnaryOp::Deref),
  237|      0|            NodeKind::IndexAccess(..) => true,
  238|      0|            NodeKind::MemberAccess(obj_ref, _, is_arrow) => *is_arrow || self.is_lvalue(*obj_ref),
  239|      0|            NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::String(_)) => true,
  240|      0|            NodeKind::CompoundLiteral(..) => true,
  241|       |            NodeKind::GenericSelection(_) => {
  242|      0|                if let Some(&selected) = self.semantic_info.generic_selections.get(&node_ref.index()) {
  243|      0|                    self.is_lvalue(selected)
  244|       |                } else {
  245|      0|                    false
  246|       |                }
  247|       |            }
  248|      0|            _ => false,
  249|       |        }
  250|      0|    }
  251|       |
  252|      0|    fn is_null_pointer_constant(&self, node_ref: NodeRef) -> bool {

  257|      0|                self.is_null_pointer_constant(*inner)

  259|      0|            _ => false,
  260|       |        }
  261|      0|    }

  376|      0|    fn visit_unary_op(&mut self, op: UnaryOp, operand_ref: NodeRef, span: SourceSpan) -> Option<QualType> {
  377|      0|        let operand_ty = self.visit_node(operand_ref)?;
  378|       |
  379|      0|        match op {
  380|       |            UnaryOp::AddrOf => {
  381|      0|                if !self.is_lvalue(operand_ref) {
  382|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::NotAnLvalue { span });
  383|      0|                    return None;
  384|      0|                }
  385|      0|                if operand_ty.is_array() || operand_ty.is_function() {
  386|      0|                    let decayed = self.registry.decay(operand_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty());
  387|      0|                    self.push_conversion(operand_ref, Conversion::PointerDecay { to: decayed.ty() });
  388|      0|                    return Some(decayed);
  389|      0|                }
  390|      0|                Some(QualType::unqualified(self.registry.pointer_to(operand_ty)))
  391|       |            }
  392|       |            UnaryOp::Deref => {
  393|      0|                let actual_ty = if operand_ty.is_array() || operand_ty.is_function() {
  394|      0|                    let decayed = self.registry.decay(operand_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty());
  395|      0|                    self.push_conversion(operand_ref, Conversion::PointerDecay { to: decayed.ty() });
  396|      0|                    decayed
  397|       |                } else {
  398|      0|                    operand_ty
  399|       |                };
  400|       |
  401|      0|                if actual_ty.is_pointer() {
  402|      0|                    self.registry.get_pointee(actual_ty.ty())
  403|       |                } else {
  404|      0|                    None
  405|       |                }
  406|       |            }
  407|       |            UnaryOp::PreIncrement | UnaryOp::PreDecrement => {
  408|      0|                self.check_lvalue_and_modifiable(operand_ref, operand_ty, span);
  409|      0|                if operand_ty.is_scalar() { Some(operand_ty) } else { None }
  410|       |            }

  412|      0|                if operand_ty.is_arithmetic() {

  414|       |                    // and the result has the promoted type.
  415|      0|                    let promoted = self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(operand_ref, operand_ty);
  416|       |
  417|       |                    // Strip all qualifiers for unary plus/minus operations
  418|      0|                    let stripped = self.registry.strip_all(promoted);
  419|      0|                    if stripped.qualifiers() != promoted.qualifiers() {
  420|      0|                        self.push_conversion(
  421|      0|                            operand_ref,
  422|      0|                            Conversion::QualifierAdjust {
  423|      0|                                from: promoted.qualifiers(),
  424|      0|                                to: stripped.qualifiers(),
  425|      0|                            },
  426|      0|                        );
  427|      0|                    }
  428|      0|                    Some(stripped)
  429|       |                } else {
  430|      0|                    let type_kind = &self.registry.get(operand_ty.ty()).kind;
  431|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidUnaryOperand {
  432|      0|                        ty: type_kind.to_string(),
  433|      0|                        span,
  434|      0|                    });
  435|      0|                    None
  436|       |                }
  437|       |            }
  438|       |            UnaryOp::LogicNot => {
  439|       |                // Logical NOT always returns int type (C11 6.5.3.3)
  440|      0|                Some(QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int))
  441|       |            }

  443|      0|                if operand_ty.is_integer() {
  444|      0|                    Some(self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(operand_ref, operand_ty))
  445|      0|                } else if operand_ty.is_complex() {
  446|      0|                    Some(operand_ty)
  447|       |                } else {
  448|      0|                    let type_kind = &self.registry.get(operand_ty.ty()).kind;
  449|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidUnaryOperand {
  450|      0|                        ty: type_kind.to_string(),
  451|      0|                        span,
  452|      0|                    });
  453|      0|                    None
  454|       |                }
  455|       |            }
  456|       |        }
  457|      0|    }

  459|      0|    fn apply_and_record_integer_promotion(&mut self, node_ref: NodeRef, ty: QualType) -> QualType {
  460|      0|        let promoted = integer_promotion(self.registry, ty);
  461|      0|        if promoted.ty() != ty.ty() {
  462|      0|            self.push_conversion(
  463|      0|                node_ref,
  464|      0|                Conversion::IntegerPromotion {
  465|      0|                    from: ty.ty(),
  466|      0|                    to: promoted.ty(),
  467|      0|                },
  468|      0|            );
  469|      0|        }
  470|      0|        promoted
  471|      0|    }
