  473|      0|    fn analyze_binary_operation_types(
  474|      0|        &mut self,
  475|      0|        op: BinaryOp,
  476|      0|        lhs_promoted: QualType,
  477|      0|        rhs_promoted: QualType,
  478|      0|        span: SourceSpan,
  479|      0|    ) -> Option<(QualType, QualType)> {
  480|      0|        match op {
  481|       |            // Pointer + integer = pointer
  482|      0|            BinaryOp::Add if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() && rhs_promoted.is_integer() => {
  483|      0|                Some((lhs_promoted, lhs_promoted))
  484|       |            }
  485|      0|            BinaryOp::Add if lhs_promoted.is_integer() && rhs_promoted.is_pointer() => {
  486|      0|                Some((rhs_promoted, rhs_promoted))
  487|       |            }
  488|       |
  489|       |            // Pointer - integer = pointer
  490|      0|            BinaryOp::Sub if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() && rhs_promoted.is_integer() => {
  491|      0|                Some((lhs_promoted, lhs_promoted))
  492|       |            }
  493|       |
  494|       |            // Pointer - pointer = integer (ptrdiff_t)
  495|      0|            BinaryOp::Sub if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() && rhs_promoted.is_pointer() => {
  496|      0|                Some((QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int), lhs_promoted))
  497|       |            }
  498|       |
  499|       |            // Pointer/Integer comparisons
  500|       |            BinaryOp::Equal | BinaryOp::NotEqual => {
  501|      0|                let common = if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() && rhs_promoted.is_pointer() {
  502|      0|                    let lhs_base = self.registry.get_pointee(lhs_promoted.ty()).unwrap();
  503|      0|                    let rhs_base = self.registry.get_pointee(rhs_promoted.ty()).unwrap();
  504|       |
  505|      0|                    if lhs_base.ty() == self.registry.type_void || rhs_base.ty() == self.registry.type_void {
  506|      0|                        QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_void_ptr)
  507|      0|                    } else if lhs_base == rhs_base {
  508|      0|                        lhs_promoted
  509|       |                    } else {
  510|      0|                        let lhs_str = self.registry.display_type(lhs_promoted.ty());
  511|      0|                        let rhs_str = self.registry.display_type(rhs_promoted.ty());
  512|      0|                        self.report_error(SemanticError::IncompatiblePointerComparison {
  513|      0|                            lhs: lhs_str,
  514|      0|                            rhs: rhs_str,
  515|      0|                            span,
  516|      0|                        });
  517|      0|                        lhs_promoted
  518|       |                    }
  519|      0|                } else if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() {
  520|      0|                    lhs_promoted
  521|      0|                } else if rhs_promoted.is_pointer() {
  522|      0|                    rhs_promoted
  523|       |                } else {
  524|      0|                    usual_arithmetic_conversions(self.registry, lhs_promoted, rhs_promoted)?
  525|       |                };
  526|      0|                Some((QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int), common))
  527|       |            }
  528|       |
  529|       |            BinaryOp::Less | BinaryOp::LessEqual | BinaryOp::Greater | BinaryOp::GreaterEqual => {
  530|      0|                let common = if lhs_promoted.is_pointer() && rhs_promoted.is_pointer() {
  531|      0|                    let lhs_base = self.registry.get_pointee(lhs_promoted.ty()).unwrap();
  532|      0|                    let rhs_base = self.registry.get_pointee(rhs_promoted.ty()).unwrap();
  533|      0|                    if lhs_base != rhs_base {
  534|      0|                        let lhs_str = self.registry.display_type(lhs_promoted.ty());
  535|      0|                        let rhs_str = self.registry.display_type(rhs_promoted.ty());
  536|      0|                        self.report_error(SemanticError::IncompatiblePointerComparison {
  537|      0|                            lhs: lhs_str,
  538|      0|                            rhs: rhs_str,
  539|      0|                            span,
  540|      0|                        });
  541|      0|                    }
  542|      0|                    lhs_promoted
  543|      0|                } else if lhs_promoted.is_real() && rhs_promoted.is_real() {
  544|      0|                    usual_arithmetic_conversions(self.registry, lhs_promoted, rhs_promoted)?
  545|       |                } else {
  546|      0|                    let lhs_str = self.registry.display_qual_type(lhs_promoted);
  547|      0|                    let rhs_str = self.registry.display_qual_type(rhs_promoted);
  548|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidBinaryOperands {
  549|      0|                        left_ty: lhs_str,
  550|      0|                        right_ty: rhs_str,
  551|      0|                        span,
  552|      0|                    });
  553|      0|                    return None;
  554|       |                };
  555|      0|                Some((QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int), common))
  556|       |            }
  557|       |
  558|       |            // Logical operations
  559|       |            BinaryOp::LogicAnd | BinaryOp::LogicOr => {
  560|       |                // Result has type int (C11 6.5.13/6.5.14)
  561|      0|                Some((QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int), lhs_promoted))
  562|       |            }
  563|       |
  564|       |            // Shift operations
  565|       |            BinaryOp::LShift | BinaryOp::RShift => {
  566|       |                // C11 6.5.7: result is type of promoted left operand
  567|      0|                Some((lhs_promoted, lhs_promoted))
  568|       |            }
  569|       |
  570|       |            // For other operations, use usual arithmetic conversions
  571|       |            _ => {
  572|      0|                let ty = usual_arithmetic_conversions(self.registry, lhs_promoted, rhs_promoted)?;
  573|      0|                Some((ty, ty))
  574|       |            }
  575|       |        }
  576|      0|    }
  577|       |
  578|      0|    fn visit_binary_op(
  579|      0|        &mut self,
  580|      0|        op: BinaryOp,
  581|      0|        lhs_ref: NodeRef,
  582|      0|        rhs_ref: NodeRef,
  583|      0|        span: SourceSpan,
  584|      0|    ) -> Option<QualType> {
  585|      0|        debug_assert!(
  586|      0|            !op.is_assignment(),
  587|      0|            "visit_binary_op called with assignment operator: {:?}",
  588|       |            op
  589|       |        );
  590|      0|        let lhs_ty = self.visit_node(lhs_ref)?;
  591|      0|        let rhs_ty = self.visit_node(rhs_ref)?;
  592|       |
  593|       |        // Perform array/function decay first
  594|      0|        let mut lhs_decayed = lhs_ty;
  595|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_array() || lhs_ty.is_function() {
  596|      0|            lhs_decayed = self.registry.decay(lhs_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty());
  597|      0|            self.push_conversion(lhs_ref, Conversion::PointerDecay { to: lhs_decayed.ty() });
  598|      0|        }
  599|       |
  600|      0|        let mut rhs_decayed = rhs_ty;
  601|      0|        if rhs_ty.is_array() || rhs_ty.is_function() {
  602|      0|            rhs_decayed = self.registry.decay(rhs_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty());
  603|      0|            self.push_conversion(rhs_ref, Conversion::PointerDecay { to: rhs_decayed.ty() });
  604|      0|        }
  605|       |
  606|      0|        if op == BinaryOp::Comma {
  607|      0|            return Some(rhs_decayed);
  608|      0|        }
  609|       |
  610|       |        // Perform integer promotions and record them
  611|      0|        let lhs_promoted = self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(lhs_ref, lhs_decayed);
  612|      0|        let rhs_promoted = self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(rhs_ref, rhs_decayed);
  613|       |
  614|      0|        if op == BinaryOp::Mod && (!lhs_promoted.is_integer() || !rhs_promoted.is_integer()) {
  615|      0|            let lhs_kind = &self.registry.get(lhs_promoted.ty()).kind;
  616|      0|            let rhs_kind = &self.registry.get(rhs_promoted.ty()).kind;
  617|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidBinaryOperands {
  618|      0|                left_ty: lhs_kind.to_string(),
  619|      0|                right_ty: rhs_kind.to_string(),
  620|      0|                span,
  621|      0|            });
  622|      0|            return None;
  623|      0|        }
  624|       |
  625|      0|        let (result_ty, common_ty) = self.analyze_binary_operation_types(op, lhs_promoted, rhs_promoted, span)?;
  626|       |
  627|       |        // For arithmetic/comparison operations, operands should be converted to a common type.
  628|      0|        let lhs_kind = self.ast.get_kind(lhs_ref);
  629|      0|        let rhs_kind = self.ast.get_kind(rhs_ref);
  630|       |
  631|      0|        let is_literal = |kind: &NodeKind| {
  632|      0|            matches!(
  633|      0|                kind,
  634|       |                NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Int { .. })
  635|       |                    | NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Char(_))
  636|       |                    | NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Float { .. })
  637|       |            )
  638|      0|        };
  639|       |
  640|      0|        if lhs_promoted.ty() != common_ty.ty() || is_literal(lhs_kind) {
  641|      0|            self.push_conversion(
  642|      0|                lhs_ref,
  643|      0|                Conversion::IntegerCast {
  644|      0|                    from: lhs_promoted.ty(),
  645|      0|                    to: common_ty.ty(),
  646|      0|                },
  647|      0|            );
  648|      0|        }
  649|      0|        if rhs_promoted.ty() != common_ty.ty() || is_literal(rhs_kind) {
  650|      0|            self.push_conversion(
  651|      0|                rhs_ref,
  652|      0|                Conversion::IntegerCast {
  653|      0|                    from: rhs_promoted.ty(),
  654|      0|                    to: common_ty.ty(),
  655|      0|                },
  656|      0|            );
  657|      0|        }
  658|       |
  659|      0|        Some(result_ty)
  660|      0|    }
  661|       |
  662|      0|    fn visit_assignment(
  663|      0|        &mut self,
  664|      0|        node_ref: NodeRef,
  665|      0|        op: BinaryOp,
  666|      0|        lhs_ref: NodeRef,
  667|      0|        rhs_ref: NodeRef,
  668|      0|        span: SourceSpan,
  669|      0|    ) -> Option<QualType> {
  670|      0|        debug_assert!(
  671|      0|            op.is_assignment(),
  672|      0|            "visit_assignment called with non-assignment operator: {:?}",
  673|       |            op
  674|       |        );
  675|       |
  676|      0|        let lhs_ty = self.visit_node(lhs_ref)?;
  677|      0|        let rhs_ty = self.visit_node(rhs_ref)?;
  678|       |
  679|      0|        if !self.check_lvalue_and_modifiable(lhs_ref, lhs_ty, span) {
  680|      0|            return None;
  681|      0|        }
  682|       |
  683|       |        // For compound assignments like +=, we need to check if the underlying arithmetic is valid.
  684|      0|        let (effective_rhs_ty, final_assignment_cast_target) = if let Some(arithmetic_op) = op.without_assignment() {
  685|       |            // Reuse visit_binary_op logic conceptually, but for compound assignment operands.
  686|       |            // For p += 1, LHS is pointer, RHS is integer.
  687|      0|            let lhs_promoted = self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(lhs_ref, lhs_ty);
  688|      0|            let rhs_promoted = self.apply_and_record_integer_promotion(rhs_ref, rhs_ty);
  689|       |
  690|      0|            if let Some((_, common_ty)) =
  691|      0|                self.analyze_binary_operation_types(arithmetic_op, lhs_promoted, rhs_promoted, span)
  692|       |            {
  693|       |                // Record conversions from promoted operands to the common type.
  694|       |                // This is what the binary operation will actually work with.
  695|      0|                if lhs_promoted.ty() != common_ty.ty() {
  696|      0|                    self.push_conversion(
  697|      0|                        lhs_ref,
  698|      0|                        Conversion::IntegerCast {
  699|      0|                            from: lhs_promoted.ty(),
  700|      0|                            to: common_ty.ty(),
  701|      0|                        },
  702|      0|                    );
  703|      0|                }
  704|      0|                if rhs_promoted.ty() != common_ty.ty() {
  705|      0|                    self.push_conversion(
  706|      0|                        rhs_ref,
  707|      0|                        Conversion::IntegerCast {
  708|      0|                            from: rhs_promoted.ty(),
  709|      0|                            to: common_ty.ty(),
  710|      0|                        },
  711|      0|                    );
  712|      0|                }
  713|       |
  714|       |                // For compound assignment, the result of (lhs op rhs) is converted back to lhs type.
  715|       |                // We record this conversion on the assignment node itself.
  716|      0|                (common_ty, Some(lhs_ty))
  717|       |            } else {
  718|      0|                let lhs_kind = &self.registry.get(lhs_promoted.ty()).kind;
  719|      0|                let rhs_kind = &self.registry.get(rhs_promoted.ty()).kind;
  720|      0|                self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidBinaryOperands {
  721|      0|                    left_ty: lhs_kind.to_string(),
  722|      0|                    right_ty: rhs_kind.to_string(),
  723|      0|                    span,
  724|      0|                });
  725|      0|                return None;
  726|       |            }
  727|       |        } else {
  728|      0|            (rhs_ty, None)
  729|       |        };
  730|       |
  731|       |        // For compound assignment, we record the final cast on the assignment node.
  732|      0|        if let Some(target_ty) = final_assignment_cast_target {
  733|       |            // Check assignment constraints (C11 6.5.16.1)
  734|      0|            if !self.check_assignment_constraints(lhs_ty, effective_rhs_ty, rhs_ref) {
  735|      0|                let lhs_kind = &self.registry.get(lhs_ty.ty()).kind;
  736|      0|                let rhs_kind = &self.registry.get(effective_rhs_ty.ty()).kind;
  737|       |
  738|      0|                self.report_error(SemanticError::TypeMismatch {
  739|      0|                    expected: lhs_kind.to_string(),
  740|      0|                    found: rhs_kind.to_string(),
  741|      0|                    span,
  742|      0|                });
  743|      0|                return None;
  744|      0|            }
  745|       |
  746|      0|            if target_ty.ty() != effective_rhs_ty.ty() {
  747|      0|                self.push_conversion(
  748|      0|                    node_ref,
  749|      0|                    Conversion::IntegerCast {
  750|      0|                        from: effective_rhs_ty.ty(),
  751|      0|                        to: target_ty.ty(),
  752|      0|                    },
  753|      0|                );
  754|      0|            }
  755|       |        } else {
  756|       |            // Simple assignment
  757|      0|            if !self.validate_and_record_assignment(lhs_ty, effective_rhs_ty, rhs_ref, span) {
  758|      0|                return None;
  759|      0|            }
  760|       |        }
  761|       |
  762|      0|        Some(lhs_ty)
  763|      0|    }
  764|       |
  765|      0|    fn check_assignment_constraints(&self, lhs_ty: QualType, rhs_ty: QualType, rhs_ref: NodeRef) -> bool {
  766|       |        // 1. Arithmetic types
  767|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_arithmetic() && rhs_ty.is_arithmetic() {
  768|      0|            return true;
  769|      0|        }
  770|       |
  771|       |        // 2. Structure or Union types
  772|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_record() || rhs_ty.is_record() {
  773|      0|            return lhs_ty.is_record() && rhs_ty.is_record() && lhs_ty.ty() == rhs_ty.ty();
  774|      0|        }
  775|       |
  776|       |        // 3. Pointers
  777|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_pointer() {
  778|      0|            if self.is_null_pointer_constant(rhs_ref) {
  779|      0|                return true;
  780|      0|            }
  781|       |
  782|       |            // Resolve implicit decay for RHS to check compatibility
  783|      0|            let rhs_pointer_base = if rhs_ty.is_array() {
  784|      0|                self.registry.get_array_element(rhs_ty.ty())
  785|      0|            } else if rhs_ty.is_function() {
  786|      0|                Some(rhs_ty.ty()) // Function decays to pointer
  787|      0|            } else if rhs_ty.is_pointer() {
  788|      0|                self.registry.get_pointee(rhs_ty.ty()).map(|qt| qt.ty())
  789|       |            } else {
  790|      0|                None
  791|       |            };
  792|       |
  793|      0|            if let Some(rhs_base) = rhs_pointer_base {
  794|       |                // Check compatibility
  795|      0|                let lhs_base = self.registry.get_pointee(lhs_ty.ty()).unwrap();
  796|       |
  797|       |                // void* wildcard
  798|      0|                if lhs_base.ty() == self.registry.type_void || rhs_base == self.registry.type_void {
  799|      0|                    return true;
  800|      0|                }
  801|       |
  802|      0|                return lhs_base.ty() == rhs_base;
  803|      0|            }
  804|       |
  805|      0|            return false;
  806|      0|        }
  807|       |
  808|       |        // 4. _Bool = Pointer
  809|      0|        if lhs_ty.ty() == self.registry.type_bool && (rhs_ty.is_pointer() || rhs_ty.is_array() || rhs_ty.is_function())
  810|       |        {
  811|      0|            return true;
  812|      0|        }
  813|       |
  814|      0|        false
  815|      0|    }
  816|       |
  817|      0|    fn record_implicit_conversions(&mut self, lhs_ty: QualType, rhs_ty: QualType, rhs_ref: NodeRef) {
  818|      0|        let mut current_rhs_ty = rhs_ty;
  819|       |
  820|       |        // 1. Null pointer constant conversion (0 or (void*)0 -> T*)
  821|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_pointer() && self.is_null_pointer_constant(rhs_ref) {
  822|      0|            self.push_conversion(rhs_ref, Conversion::NullPointerConstant);
  823|      0|            if lhs_ty.ty() != self.registry.type_void_ptr {
  824|      0|                self.push_conversion(
  825|      0|                    rhs_ref,
  826|      0|                    Conversion::PointerCast {
  827|      0|                        from: self.registry.type_void_ptr,
  828|      0|                        to: lhs_ty.ty(),
  829|      0|                    },
  830|      0|                );
  831|      0|            }
  832|      0|            return;
  833|      0|        }
  834|       |
  835|       |        // 2. Array/Function-to-pointer decay
  836|      0|        if lhs_ty.is_pointer() && (current_rhs_ty.is_array() || current_rhs_ty.is_function()) {
  837|      0|            current_rhs_ty = self.registry.decay(current_rhs_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty());
  838|      0|            self.push_conversion(
  839|      0|                rhs_ref,
  840|      0|                Conversion::PointerDecay {
  841|      0|                    to: current_rhs_ty.ty(),
  842|      0|                },
  843|      0|            );
  844|      0|        }
  845|       |
  846|       |        // 3. Qualifier adjustment
  847|      0|        if lhs_ty.ty() == current_rhs_ty.ty() && lhs_ty.qualifiers() != current_rhs_ty.qualifiers() {
  848|      0|            self.push_conversion(
  849|      0|                rhs_ref,
  850|      0|                Conversion::QualifierAdjust {
  851|      0|                    from: current_rhs_ty.qualifiers(),
  852|      0|                    to: lhs_ty.qualifiers(),
  853|      0|                },
  854|      0|            );
  855|      0|        }
  856|       |
  857|       |        // 4. Casts (Integer or Pointer)
  858|      0|        let is_literal = matches!(
  859|      0|            self.ast.get_kind(rhs_ref),
  860|       |            NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Int { .. })
  861|       |                | NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Char(_))
  862|       |                | NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Float { .. })
  863|       |        );
  864|       |
  865|      0|        let is_arithmetic_cast = lhs_ty.is_arithmetic() && current_rhs_ty.is_arithmetic();
  866|      0|        let is_pointer_cast = lhs_ty.is_pointer() && current_rhs_ty.is_pointer();
  867|       |
  868|      0|        if (is_arithmetic_cast || is_pointer_cast) && (lhs_ty.ty() != current_rhs_ty.ty() || is_literal) {
  869|      0|            let conv = if is_pointer_cast {
  870|      0|                Conversion::PointerCast {
  871|      0|                    from: current_rhs_ty.ty(),
  872|      0|                    to: lhs_ty.ty(),
  873|      0|                }
  874|       |            } else {
  875|      0|                Conversion::IntegerCast {
  876|      0|                    from: current_rhs_ty.ty(),
  877|      0|                    to: lhs_ty.ty(),
  878|      0|                }
  879|       |            };
  880|      0|            self.push_conversion(rhs_ref, conv);
  881|      0|        }
  882|      0|    }
  883|       |
  884|      0|    fn check_assignment_and_record(&mut self, target_ty: QualType, init_ty: QualType, init_ref: NodeRef) {
  885|      0|        if !self.check_assignment_constraints(target_ty, init_ty, init_ref) {
  886|      0|            let lhs_kind = &self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).kind;
  887|      0|            let rhs_kind = &self.registry.get(init_ty.ty()).kind;
  888|      0|            let span = self.ast.get_span(init_ref);
  889|      0|
  890|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::TypeMismatch {
  891|      0|                expected: lhs_kind.to_string(),
  892|      0|                found: rhs_kind.to_string(),
  893|      0|                span,
  894|      0|            });
  895|      0|        } else {
  896|      0|            self.record_implicit_conversions(target_ty, init_ty, init_ref);
  897|      0|        }
  898|      0|    }
  899|       |
  900|      0|    fn check_initializer(&mut self, init_ref: NodeRef, target_ty: QualType) {
  901|      0|        match self.ast.get_kind(init_ref) {
  902|      0|            NodeKind::InitializerList(list) => {
  903|      0|                self.semantic_info.types[init_ref.index()] = Some(target_ty);
  904|      0|                let list = *list;
  905|      0|                self.check_initializer_list(&list, target_ty);
  906|      0|            }

  908|      0|                let Some(init_ty) = self.visit_node(init_ref) else {
  909|      0|                    return;
  910|       |                };
  911|       |
  912|      0|                let lhs_elem = self.registry.get_array_element(target_ty.ty()).unwrap();
  913|      0|                let rhs_elem = self.registry.get_array_element(init_ty.ty()).unwrap();
  914|       |
  915|      0|                let is_rhs_char = rhs_elem == self.registry.type_char;
  916|      0|                let is_lhs_char_type = [
  917|      0|                    self.registry.type_char,
  918|      0|                    self.registry.type_schar,
  919|      0|                    self.registry.type_char_unsigned,
  920|      0|                ]
  921|      0|                .contains(&lhs_elem);
  922|       |

  924|      0|                    is_lhs_char_type
  925|       |                } else {
  926|      0|                    self.registry
  927|      0|                        .is_compatible(QualType::unqualified(lhs_elem), QualType::unqualified(rhs_elem))
  928|       |                };
  929|       |
  930|      0|                if compatible {
  931|      0|                    self.record_implicit_conversions(target_ty, init_ty, init_ref);
  932|      0|                } else {
  933|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::TypeMismatch {
  934|      0|                        expected: self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).kind.to_string(),
  935|      0|                        found: self.registry.get(init_ty.ty()).kind.to_string(),
  936|      0|                        span: self.ast.get_span(init_ref),
  937|      0|                    });
  938|      0|                }
  939|       |            }
  940|       |            _ => {
  941|      0|                if let Some(init_ty) = self.visit_node(init_ref) {
  942|      0|                    self.check_assignment_and_record(target_ty, init_ty, init_ref);
  943|      0|                }
  944|       |            }
  945|       |        }
  946|      0|    }
  947|       |
  948|      0|    fn check_initializer_list(&mut self, list: &InitializerListData, target_ty: QualType) {
  949|      0|        if target_ty.is_scalar() {
  950|      0|            let mut items = list.init_start.range(list.init_len);
  951|       |
  952|      0|            if let Some(first_ref) = items.next() {
  953|      0|                let (expr, _, _) = self.unwrap_initializer_item(first_ref);
  954|      0|                if let Some(init_ty) = self.visit_node(expr) {
  955|      0|                    self.check_assignment_and_record(target_ty, init_ty, expr);
  956|      0|                }
  957|      0|            }
  958|       |
  959|      0|            for (i, item_ref) in items.enumerate() {
  960|      0|                if i == 0 {
  961|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::ExcessElements {
  962|      0|                        kind: "scalar".to_string(),
  963|      0|                        span: self.ast.get_span(item_ref),
  964|      0|                    });
  965|      0|                }
  966|      0|                let (expr, _, _) = self.unwrap_initializer_item(item_ref);
  967|      0|                self.visit_node(expr);
  968|       |            }
  969|      0|            return;
  970|      0|        }
  971|       |
  972|      0|        let target_type = self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).clone();
  973|      0|        match target_type.kind {
  974|       |            TypeKind::Record { .. } => {
  975|      0|                let mut flat_members = Vec::new();
  976|      0|                target_type.flatten_members(self.registry, &mut flat_members);
  977|       |
  978|      0|                for item_ref in list.init_start.range(list.init_len) {
  979|      0|                    self.check_initializer_item_record(item_ref, &flat_members, target_ty);
  980|      0|                }
  981|       |            }
  982|       |            _ => {
  983|      0|                for item_ref in list.init_start.range(list.init_len) {
  984|      0|                    let (expr, d_start, d_len) = self.unwrap_initializer_item(item_ref);
  985|      0|                    for designator_ref in d_start.range(d_len) {
  986|      0|                        let NodeKind::Designator(d) = self.ast.get_kind(designator_ref) else {
  987|      0|                            continue;
  988|       |                        };
  989|      0|                        match d {
  990|      0|                            Designator::ArrayIndex(e) => {
  991|      0|                                self.visit_node(*e);
  992|      0|                            }
  993|      0|                            Designator::GnuArrayRange(s, e) => {
  994|      0|                                self.visit_node(*s);
  995|      0|                                self.visit_node(*e);
  996|      0|                            }
  997|      0|                            Designator::FieldName(_) => {}
  998|       |                        }
  999|       |                    }
 1000|      0|                    self.visit_node(expr);
 1001|       |                }
 1002|       |            }
 1003|       |        }
 1004|      0|    }
 1005|       |
 1006|      0|    fn check_initializer_item_record(&mut self, item_ref: NodeRef, members: &[StructMember], record_ty: QualType) {
 1007|      0|        let node_kind = self.ast.get_kind(item_ref);
 1008|      0|        if let NodeKind::InitializerItem(init) = node_kind {
 1009|       |            // 1. Validate designators

 1049|      0|    fn visit_function_call(&mut self, call_expr: &crate::ast::nodes::CallExpr) -> Option<QualType> {
 1050|      0|        let func_ty = self.visit_node(call_expr.callee)?;
 1051|       |

 1053|       |        // Resolve function type (might be pointer to function)

 1076|      0|                    continue;
 1077|       |                };

 1090|       |

 1093|      0|                    }
 1094|      0|                }

 1098|      0|            let ty_str = self.registry.display_type(actual_func_ty_ref);

 1104|      0|                self.visit_node(arg_node_ref);
 1105|      0|            }
 1106|      0|            return None; // Return None as the call is invalid
 1107|       |        }

 1110|      0|            TypeKind::Function { return_type, .. } => Some(QualType::unqualified(return_type)),

 1113|      0|    }

 1115|      0|    fn visit_member_access(

 1117|      0|        obj_ref: NodeRef,

 1135|      0|            if !record_ty.is_record() {
 1136|      0|                return None;
 1137|      0|            }

 1140|       |                // 1. Check direct members

 1155|       |                }
 1156|      0|            }
 1157|      0|            None
 1158|      0|        }

 1457|      0|    fn visit_expression_node(&mut self, node_ref: NodeRef, kind: &NodeKind) -> Option<QualType> {
 1458|      0|        match kind {
 1459|      0|            NodeKind::Literal(literal) => self.visit_literal(literal),
 1460|      0|            NodeKind::Ident(_, symbol_ref) => {
 1461|      0|                let symbol = self.symbol_table.get_symbol(*symbol_ref);
 1462|      0|                match &symbol.kind {
 1463|      0|                    SymbolKind::EnumConstant { .. } => Some(QualType::unqualified(self.registry.type_int)),
 1464|      0|                    _ => Some(symbol.type_info),

 1467|      0|            NodeKind::UnaryOp(op, operand) => {
 1468|      0|                let span = self.ast.get_span(node_ref);
 1469|      0|                self.visit_unary_op(*op, *operand, span)

 1471|      0|            NodeKind::BinaryOp(op, lhs, rhs) => {
 1472|      0|                let span = self.ast.get_span(node_ref);
 1473|      0|                self.visit_binary_op(*op, *lhs, *rhs, span)
 1474|       |            }

 1476|      0|                self.visit_node(*cond);

 1479|       |
 1480|      0|                if let (Some(t), Some(e)) = (then_ty, else_ty) {

 1641|      0|    fn visit_atomic_op(

 1643|      0|        op: AtomicOp,
 1644|      0|        args_start: NodeRef,
 1645|      0|        args_len: u16,

 1647|      0|    ) -> Option<QualType> {

 1652|      0|            return None;
 1653|      0|        }

 1657|      0|            AtomicOp::LoadN => 2,
 1658|      0|            AtomicOp::CompareExchangeN => 6,
 1659|      0|            _ => 3,
 1660|       |        };

 1663|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidNumberOfArguments {
 1664|      0|                expected: expected_args,
 1665|      0|                found: args.len(),
 1666|      0|                span,
 1667|      0|            });

 1669|      0|        }

 1673|      0|            AtomicOp::LoadN => smallvec![1],

 1690|      0|            pointee
 1691|       |        } else {
 1692|      0|            let ty_str = self.registry.display_qual_type(arg_tys[0]);
 1693|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::InvalidAtomicArgument {
 1694|      0|                ty: ty_str,
 1695|      0|                span: self.ast.get_span(args[0]),
 1696|      0|            });

 1698|       |        };

 1706|      0|                        ty: ty_str,
 1707|      0|                        span: self.ast.get_span(args[1]),
 1708|      0|                    });

 1710|      0|                    self.record_implicit_conversions(pointee, arg_tys[1], args[1]);

 1715|      0|                self.record_implicit_conversions(pointee, arg_tys[1], args[1]);

 1717|       |            }

 1721|       |

 1760|      0|    fn visit_literal(&mut self, literal: &literal::Literal) -> Option<QualType> {
 1761|      0|        match literal {
 1762|      0|            literal::Literal::Int { val, suffix } => {
 1763|      0|                let ty = match suffix {
 1764|      0|                    Some(literal::IntegerSuffix::L) => self.registry.type_long,
 1765|      0|                    Some(literal::IntegerSuffix::LL) => self.registry.type_long_long,
 1766|      0|                    Some(literal::IntegerSuffix::U) => self.registry.type_int_unsigned,
 1767|      0|                    Some(literal::IntegerSuffix::UL) => self.registry.type_long_unsigned,
 1768|      0|                    Some(literal::IntegerSuffix::ULL) => self.registry.type_long_long_unsigned,
 1769|       |                    None => {
 1770|      0|                        let _ = self.registry.ensure_layout(self.registry.type_int);
 1771|      0|                        let _ = self.registry.ensure_layout(self.registry.type_long);
 1772|       |
 1773|      0|                        let int_layout = self.registry.get_layout(self.registry.type_int);
 1774|      0|                        let int_max = if int_layout.size >= 8 {
 1775|      0|                            i64::MAX
 1776|       |                        } else {
 1777|      0|                            (1i64 << (int_layout.size * 8 - 1)) - 1
 1778|       |                        };

 1781|      0|                        let long_max = if long_layout.size >= 8 {
 1782|      0|                            i64::MAX
 1783|       |                        } else {
 1784|      0|                            (1i64 << (long_layout.size * 8 - 1)) - 1
 1785|       |                        };
 1786|       |
 1787|      0|                        if *val >= 0 && *val <= int_max {
 1788|      0|                            self.registry.type_int
 1789|      0|                        } else if *val >= 0 && *val <= long_max {
 1790|      0|                            self.registry.type_long
 1791|       |                        } else {
 1792|      0|                            self.registry.type_long_long
 1793|       |                        }

 1825|      0|    fn visit_node(&mut self, node_ref: NodeRef) -> Option<QualType> {
 1826|      0|        let node_kind = self.ast.get_kind(node_ref);

 1833|       |            | NodeKind::FieldDecl(_)

 1869|       |            } else {

 1873|      0|        }

 1911|      0|    fn visit_generic_selection(&mut self, gs: &GenericSelectionData, node_ref: NodeRef) -> Option<QualType> {
 1912|       |        // First, visit the controlling expression to determine its type.
 1913|      0|        let ctrl_ty = self.visit_node(gs.control)?;
 1914|       |
 1915|       |        // C11 6.5.1.1p3: The controlling expression of a generic selection is not evaluated.
 1916|       |        // C11 6.5.1.1p2: The type of the controlling expression is compared with the type name of each generic
 1917|       |        // association. Before comparison, array and function types decay to pointers.
 1918|      0|        let decayed_ctrl_ty = if ctrl_ty.is_array() || ctrl_ty.is_function() {
 1919|       |            // Qualifiers on the array/function type itself are discarded during decay.
 1920|      0|            self.registry.decay(ctrl_ty, TypeQualifiers::empty())
 1921|       |        } else {
 1922|      0|            ctrl_ty
 1923|       |        };
 1924|       |
 1925|       |        // After decay, top-level qualifiers are removed for the compatibility check.
 1926|      0|        let unqualified_ctrl_ty = self.registry.strip_all(decayed_ctrl_ty);
 1927|       |
 1928|       |        // C11 6.5.1.1p2: The controlling expression... shall have a type that is a complete object type,
 1929|       |        // or a pointer to a function type, or a pointer to a complete object type...
 1930|      0|        if !self.registry.is_complete(decayed_ctrl_ty.ty()) {
 1931|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::GenericIncompleteControl {
 1932|      0|                ty: self.registry.display_qual_type(ctrl_ty),
 1933|      0|                span: self.ast.get_span(gs.control),
 1934|      0|            });
 1935|      0|        }
 1936|       |
 1937|       |        // It's crucial to visit *all* result expressions to ensure they are
 1938|       |        // fully type-checked, even if they are not the selected branch.
 1939|       |        // This resolves all identifier types within them.
 1940|      0|        let mut selected_expr_ref = None;
 1941|      0|        let mut default_expr_ref = None;
 1942|      0|        let mut default_first_span = None;
 1943|      0|        let mut seen_types: Vec<(QualType, SourceSpan)> = Vec::new();
 1944|       |
 1945|      0|        for assoc_node_ref in gs.assoc_start.range(gs.assoc_len) {
 1946|      0|            let NodeKind::GenericAssociation(ga) = *self.ast.get_kind(assoc_node_ref) else {
 1947|      0|                continue;
 1948|       |            };
 1949|       |
 1950|      0|            let assoc_span = self.ast.get_span(assoc_node_ref);
 1951|      0|            self.visit_node(assoc_node_ref);
 1952|       |
 1953|      0|            let Some(assoc_ty) = ga.ty else {
 1954|       |                // This is the 'default' association.
 1955|       |                // Constraint 2: If a generic selection has a default association, there shall be only one such association.
 1956|      0|                if let Some(first_span) = default_first_span {
 1957|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::GenericMultipleDefault {
 1958|      0|                        span: assoc_span,
 1959|      0|                        first_def: first_span,
 1960|      0|                    });
 1961|      0|                } else {
 1962|      0|                    default_first_span = Some(assoc_span);
 1963|      0|                    default_expr_ref = Some(ga.result_expr);
 1964|      0|                }
 1965|      0|                continue;
 1966|       |            };
 1967|       |
 1968|       |            // C11 6.5.1.1p2: The type name in a generic association shall specify a complete object type...
 1969|      0|            if !self.registry.is_complete(assoc_ty.ty()) {
 1970|      0|                self.report_error(SemanticError::GenericIncompleteAssociation {
 1971|      0|                    ty: self.registry.display_qual_type(assoc_ty),
 1972|      0|                    span: assoc_span,
 1973|      0|                });
 1974|      0|            }
 1975|       |
 1976|       |            // C11 6.5.1.1p2: The controlling expression... shall have type compatible with at most one...
 1977|       |            // "No two generic associations in the same generic selection shall specify compatible types."
 1978|       |
 1979|       |            // Constraint 2: No two generic associations in the same generic selection shall specify compatible types.
 1980|      0|            let mut duplicate = false;
 1981|      0|            for (prev_ty, prev_span) in &seen_types {
 1982|      0|                if self.registry.is_compatible(assoc_ty, *prev_ty) {
 1983|      0|                    self.report_error(SemanticError::GenericDuplicateMatch {
 1984|      0|                        ty: self.registry.display_qual_type(assoc_ty),
 1985|      0|                        prev_ty: self.registry.display_qual_type(*prev_ty),
 1986|      0|                        span: assoc_span,
 1987|      0|                        first_def: *prev_span,
 1988|      0|                    });
 1989|      0|                    duplicate = true;
 1990|      0|                    break;
 1991|      0|                }
 1992|       |            }
 1993|       |
 1994|      0|            if !duplicate {
 1995|      0|                seen_types.push((assoc_ty, assoc_span));
 1996|      0|            }
 1997|       |
 1998|       |            // Constraint 1: The controlling expression... shall have type compatible with at most one...
 1999|       |            // unqualified_ctrl_ty is the controlling expression type after lvalue conversion (which strips qualifiers).
 2000|       |            // It is compared against the association type (which keeps qualifiers).
 2001|      0|            if self.registry.is_compatible(unqualified_ctrl_ty, assoc_ty) && selected_expr_ref.is_none() {
 2002|      0|                selected_expr_ref = Some(ga.result_expr);
 2003|      0|                self.semantic_info

 2005|      0|                    .insert(node_ref.index(), ga.result_expr);
 2006|      0|            }
 2007|       |        }
 2008|       |
 2009|       |        // If no specific type matches, use the default association if it exists.
 2010|      0|        if selected_expr_ref.is_none() {
 2011|      0|            selected_expr_ref = default_expr_ref;
 2012|      0|            if let Some(expr) = default_expr_ref {
 2013|      0|                self.semantic_info.generic_selections.insert(node_ref.index(), expr);
 2014|      0|            }
 2015|      0|        }
 2016|       |
 2017|       |        // The type of the _Generic expression is the type of the selected result expression.
 2018|      0|        if let Some(expr_ref) = selected_expr_ref {
 2019|       |            // The type should already be resolved from the earlier pass.
 2020|      0|            let idx = expr_ref.index();
 2021|      0|            self.semantic_info.types.get(idx).and_then(|t| *t)
 2022|       |        } else {

 2024|      0|            self.report_error(SemanticError::GenericNoMatch {
 2025|      0|                ty: self.registry.display_qual_type(ctrl_ty),
 2026|      0|                span: self.ast.get_span(node_ref),
 2027|      0|            });
 2028|      0|            None
 2029|       |        }
 2030|      0|    }

  293|      0|    fn lower_function(&mut self, function_data: &FunctionData) {

  298|      0|        let func_id = self
  299|      0|            .mir_builder
  300|      0|            .get_functions()

  303|      0|            .map(|(id, _)| *id)
  304|      0|            .expect("Function not found in MIR builder, pre-pass failed?");
  305|       |

  307|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_function(func_id);
  308|       |

  310|      0|        let entry_block_id = self.mir_builder.create_block();

  312|      0|        self.current_block = Some(entry_block_id);

  314|       |
  315|       |        // Pre-scan for all labels in the function body to create their MIR blocks upfront.
  316|      0|        self.label_map.clear();

  323|       |

  326|      0|                let local_id = mir_params[i];

  328|      0|            }
  329|       |        }
  330|       |
  331|      0|        self.lower_node_ref(function_data.body);
  332|       |
  333|       |        // Handle implicit return if control falls off the end
  334|      0|        if !self.mir_builder.current_block_has_terminator() {

  499|      0|    fn lower_loop_generic<I, C, B, Inc>(
  500|      0|        &mut self,
  501|      0|        init_fn: Option<I>,
  502|      0|        cond_fn: Option<C>,
  503|      0|        body_fn: B,
  504|      0|        inc_fn: Option<Inc>,
  505|      0|        is_do_while: bool,
  506|      0|    ) where
  507|      0|        I: FnOnce(&mut Self),
  508|      0|        C: FnOnce(&mut Self) -> Operand,
  509|      0|        B: FnOnce(&mut Self),
  510|      0|        Inc: FnOnce(&mut Self),
  511|       |    {
  512|      0|        let cond_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  513|      0|        let body_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  514|      0|        let increment_block = if inc_fn.is_some() {
  515|      0|            self.mir_builder.create_block()
  516|       |        } else {
  517|       |            // If there's no increment block (e.g. while/do-while), "continue" goes to condition
  518|      0|            cond_block
  519|       |        };
  520|      0|        let exit_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  521|       |
  522|       |        // Continue target depends on whether we have an increment step
  523|      0|        let continue_target = increment_block;
  524|       |

  526|      0|            if let Some(init) = init_fn {
  527|      0|                init(this);
  528|      0|            }
  529|       |
  530|      0|            if is_do_while {
  531|      0|                // do-while: jump straight to body
  532|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(body_block));
  533|      0|            } else {
  534|      0|                // for/while: jump to condition
  535|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(cond_block));
  536|      0|            }
  537|       |
  538|       |            // Condition block
  539|      0|            this.mir_builder.set_current_block(cond_block);
  540|      0|            if let Some(cond) = cond_fn {
  541|      0|                let cond_val = cond(this);
  542|      0|                this.mir_builder
  543|      0|                    .set_terminator(Terminator::If(cond_val, body_block, exit_block));
  544|      0|            } else {
  545|      0|                // No condition (e.g. for(;;)) -> infinite loop
  546|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(body_block));
  547|      0|            }
  548|       |
  549|       |            // Body block
  550|      0|            this.mir_builder.set_current_block(body_block);
  551|      0|            body_fn(this);
  552|       |
  553|       |            // After body, jump to increment (or condition if no increment)
  554|      0|            if !this.mir_builder.current_block_has_terminator() {
  555|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(increment_block));
  556|      0|            }
  557|       |
  558|       |            // Increment block (only if it exists and is distinct from cond_block)
  559|      0|            if let Some(inc) = inc_fn {
  560|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_current_block(increment_block);
  561|      0|                inc(this);
  562|      0|                this.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(cond_block));
  563|      0|            }
  564|      0|        });
  565|       |
  566|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(exit_block);
  567|      0|        self.current_block = Some(exit_block);
  568|      0|    }

  614|      0|    fn lower_switch_statement(&mut self, cond: NodeRef, body: NodeRef) {
  615|      0|        let cond_op = self.lower_expression(cond, true);
  616|       |
  617|       |        // Integer promotions on controlling expression are handled by lower_expression if sema did it?
  618|       |        // Semantic analysis should have inserted implicit conversions.
  619|       |        // But we might need to cast case values to this type.
  620|      0|        let cond_ty_id = self.get_operand_type(&cond_op);
  621|       |
  622|      0|        let merge_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  623|       |
  624|      0|        let saved_break = self.break_target;
  625|      0|        self.break_target = Some(merge_block);
  626|       |
  627|       |        // Collect cases
  628|      0|        let cases = self.collect_switch_cases(body);
  629|       |
  630|       |        // Create blocks for cases
  631|      0|        let mut case_blocks = Vec::new();
  632|      0|        let mut default_block = None;
  633|       |
  634|      0|        for (node, val_opt) in cases {
  635|      0|            let block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  636|      0|            self.switch_case_map.insert(node, block);
  637|       |
  638|      0|            if let Some(val) = val_opt {
  639|      0|                case_blocks.push((val, block));
  640|      0|            } else {
  641|      0|                default_block = Some(block);
  642|      0|            }
  643|       |        }
  644|       |
  645|       |        // Generate dispatch
  646|      0|        let fallback_block = default_block.unwrap_or(merge_block);
  647|       |
  648|      0|        for (val_id, target_block) in case_blocks {
  649|      0|            let next_test_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  650|      0|            let val_const = self.mir_builder.get_constants().get(&val_id).unwrap().clone();
  651|       |
  652|       |            // Re-create constant with the same type as condition to ensure safe comparison
  653|       |            // This assumes the values are compatible (integral).
  654|       |            // Sema should ensure they are compatible.
  655|       |            // We just cast the constant value to the condition type for the comparison operand.
  656|       |            // Note: `val_const` is already lowered to some type.
  657|       |
  658|      0|            let val_op = Operand::Constant(val_id);
  659|      0|            let cast_val_op = if val_const.ty != cond_ty_id {
  660|      0|                Operand::Cast(cond_ty_id, Box::new(val_op))
  661|       |            } else {
  662|      0|                val_op
  663|       |            };
  664|       |
  665|       |            // Use Eq comparison
  666|       |            // If condition is float (illegal in C switch), we panic?
  667|       |            // Switch only works on integers.
  668|      0|            let cmp_rvalue = Rvalue::BinaryIntOp(BinaryIntOp::Eq, cond_op.clone(), cast_val_op);
  669|      0|            let bool_type_id = self.lower_type(self.registry.type_bool);
  670|      0|            let (_cmp_local, cmp_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(cmp_rvalue, bool_type_id);
  671|      0|            let cmp_op = Operand::Copy(Box::new(cmp_place));
  672|       |
  673|      0|            self.mir_builder
  674|      0|                .set_terminator(Terminator::If(cmp_op, target_block, next_test_block));
  675|       |
  676|      0|            self.mir_builder.set_current_block(next_test_block);
  677|      0|            self.current_block = Some(next_test_block);
  678|       |        }
  679|       |
  680|       |        // Final jump to default or merge
  681|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(fallback_block));
  682|       |
  683|       |        // Lower body
  684|       |        // Start a dummy unreachable block for the body entry (to catch unreachable statements)
  685|      0|        let body_entry_dummy = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  686|       |        // Do not jump to it. It is unreachable.
  687|       |
  688|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(body_entry_dummy);
  689|      0|        self.current_block = Some(body_entry_dummy);
  690|       |
  691|      0|        self.lower_node_ref(body);
  692|       |
  693|       |        // If body falls through, go to merge
  694|      0|        if self.mir_builder.current_block_has_terminator() == false {
  695|      0|            // Check if terminator is Unreachable (default) - if so, we can replace it or just leave it?
  696|      0|            // `current_block_has_terminator` returns false if it is Unreachable.
  697|      0|            // But if we are in body_entry_dummy and it's empty, we shouldn't jump to merge.
  698|      0|            // Actually, if execution falls through the body, it should hit merge.
  699|      0|            // But valid C code falling through end of switch goes to next stmt (merge).
  700|      0|            self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  701|      0|        }
  702|       |
  703|      0|        self.break_target = saved_break;
  704|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(merge_block);
  705|      0|        self.current_block = Some(merge_block);
  706|      0|    }

  708|      0|    fn lower_case_default_statement(&mut self, node: NodeRef, stmt: NodeRef) {

  711|       |        // Fallthrough from previous block

  714|      0|        }
  715|       |

  717|      0|        self.current_block = Some(target_block);
  718|       |
  719|      0|        self.lower_node_ref(stmt);
  720|      0|    }

  722|      0|    fn collect_switch_cases(&mut self, node: NodeRef) -> Vec<(NodeRef, Option<ConstValueId>)> {
  723|      0|        let mut cases = Vec::new();
  724|      0|        self.collect_switch_cases_recursive(node, &mut cases);
  725|      0|        cases
  726|      0|    }
  727|       |
  728|      0|    fn collect_switch_cases_recursive(&mut self, node: NodeRef, cases: &mut Vec<(NodeRef, Option<ConstValueId>)>) {
  729|      0|        let kind = *self.ast.get_kind(node);
  730|      0|        match kind {
  731|      0|            NodeKind::Case(expr, stmt) => {
  732|      0|                let op = self.lower_expression(expr, true);
  733|      0|                let val = self.operand_to_const_id_strict(op, "Case label must be constant");
  734|      0|                cases.push((node, Some(val)));
  735|      0|                self.collect_switch_cases_recursive(stmt, cases);
  736|      0|            }
  737|      0|            NodeKind::Default(stmt) => {
  738|      0|                cases.push((node, None));
  739|      0|                self.collect_switch_cases_recursive(stmt, cases);
  740|      0|            }
  741|      0|            NodeKind::Switch(..) => {
  742|      0|                // Do not recurse into nested switch
  743|      0|            }
  744|       |            _ => {
  745|      0|                kind.visit_children(|child| self.collect_switch_cases_recursive(child, cases));
  746|       |            }
  747|       |        }
  748|      0|    }

  750|      0|    pub(crate) fn emit_assignment(&mut self, place: Place, operand: Operand) {
  751|      0|        if self.mir_builder.current_block_has_terminator() {
  752|      0|            return;
  753|      0|        }
  754|       |
  755|       |        // Avoid identity assignments like %x = %x
  756|      0|        if let Operand::Copy(box_place) = &operand
  757|      0|            && **box_place == place
  758|       |        {
  759|      0|            return;
  760|      0|        }
  761|       |
  762|      0|        let rvalue = Rvalue::Use(operand);
  763|      0|        let stmt = MirStmt::Assign(place, rvalue);
  764|      0|        self.mir_builder.add_statement(stmt);
  765|      0|    }

  767|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_qual_type(&mut self, ty: QualType) -> TypeId {

  771|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_type(&mut self, type_ref: TypeRef) -> TypeId {
  772|      0|        if let Some(type_id) = self.type_cache.get(&type_ref) {
  773|      0|            return *type_id;
  774|      0|        }
  775|       |
  776|       |        // Return placeholder if already converting this type (recursion loop)
  777|      0|        if self.type_conversion_in_progress.contains(&type_ref) {
  778|      0|            return *self
  779|      0|                .type_cache
  780|      0|                .get(&type_ref)
  781|      0|                .expect("Placeholder must exist for recursive type");
  782|      0|        }
  783|       |
  784|      0|        let ast_type_kind = self.registry.get(type_ref).kind.clone();
  785|       |
  786|      0|        match ast_type_kind {
  787|       |            TypeKind::Record {
  788|      0|                tag,
  789|      0|                members,
  790|      0|                is_union,
  791|      0|                is_complete,

  942|      0|    fn lower_array_type(&mut self, type_ref: TypeRef, element_type: TypeRef, size: &ArraySizeType) -> MirType {

 1087|      0|    fn emit_conversion(&mut self, operand: Operand, conv: &Conversion, target_type_id: TypeId) -> Operand {
 1088|      0|        let to_ty_ref = match conv {
 1089|      0|            Conversion::IntegerCast { to, .. }
 1090|      0|            | Conversion::IntegerPromotion { to, .. }
 1091|      0|            | Conversion::PointerCast { to, .. } => Some(*to),
 1092|      0|            Conversion::PointerDecay { to } => Some(*to),
 1093|      0|            _ => None,
 1094|       |        };
 1095|       |
 1096|      0|        let from_ty_ref = match conv {
 1097|      0|            Conversion::IntegerCast { from, .. }
 1098|      0|            | Conversion::IntegerPromotion { from, .. }
 1099|      0|            | Conversion::PointerCast { from, .. } => Some(*from),
 1100|      0|            _ => None,
 1101|       |        };
 1102|       |
 1103|      0|        if let Some(to) = to_ty_ref
 1104|      0|            && (to.is_complex() || from_ty_ref.is_some_and(|f| f.is_complex()))
 1105|       |        {
 1106|      0|            return self.emit_complex_conversion(operand, from_ty_ref, to);
 1107|      0|        }
 1108|       |
 1109|      0|        let to_mir_type = match conv {
 1110|      0|            Conversion::IntegerCast { to, .. }
 1111|      0|            | Conversion::IntegerPromotion { to, .. }
 1112|      0|            | Conversion::PointerCast { to, .. } => self.lower_type(*to),
 1113|       |            Conversion::NullPointerConstant => {
 1114|       |                // Null pointer constant usually converts to void* first.
 1115|       |                // However, we can use target_type_id if it's already a pointer.
 1116|      0|                let void_ptr_mir = self.lower_type(self.registry.type_void_ptr);
 1117|      0|                if self.mir_builder.get_type(target_type_id).is_pointer() {
 1118|      0|                    target_type_id
 1119|       |                } else {
 1120|      0|                    void_ptr_mir
 1121|       |                }
 1122|       |            }
 1123|      0|            Conversion::PointerDecay { to } => self.lower_type(*to),
 1124|      0|            Conversion::LValueToRValue => target_type_id,
 1125|      0|            Conversion::QualifierAdjust { .. } => target_type_id,
 1126|       |        };
 1127|       |
 1128|       |        // Optimization: skip if already same type
 1129|      0|        let current_ty = self.get_operand_type(&operand);
 1130|      0|        if current_ty == to_mir_type && !matches!(conv, Conversion::PointerDecay { .. }) {
 1131|      0|            return operand;
 1132|      0|        }
 1133|       |
 1134|      0|        match conv {
 1135|       |            Conversion::IntegerCast { .. } | Conversion::IntegerPromotion { .. } | Conversion::PointerCast { .. } => {
 1136|      0|                Operand::Cast(to_mir_type, Box::new(operand))
 1137|       |            }
 1138|       |            Conversion::NullPointerConstant => {
 1139|      0|                let ty_id = self.lower_type(self.registry.type_int);
 1140|      0|                Operand::Cast(
 1141|      0|                    to_mir_type,
 1142|      0|                    Box::new(Operand::Constant(self.create_constant(ty_id, ConstValueKind::Int(0)))),
 1143|      0|                )
 1144|       |            }
 1145|       |            Conversion::PointerDecay { .. } => {
 1146|      0|                if let Operand::Copy(place) = &operand {
 1147|      0|                    let addr_of_array = Operand::AddressOf(place.clone());
 1148|      0|                    Operand::Cast(to_mir_type, Box::new(addr_of_array))
 1149|       |                } else {
 1150|       |                    // If it's not a place (e.g. String Literal might be lowered to Constant directly?)
 1151|       |                    // String literals usually LValue, so Copy(Place::Global/Local).
 1152|      0|                    Operand::Cast(to_mir_type, Box::new(operand))
 1153|       |                }
 1154|       |            }
 1155|      0|            _ => Operand::Cast(target_type_id, Box::new(operand)),
 1156|       |        }
 1157|      0|    }

    1|       |//! Constant expression evaluation
    2|       |//!
    3|       |//! This module provides the functionality to evaluate constant expressions
    4|       |//! at compile time, as required by the C11 standard for contexts like
    5|       |//! static assertions and array sizes.
    6|       |
    7|       |use crate::ast::{Ast, BinaryOp, NodeKind, NodeRef, UnaryOp, literal};
    8|       |use crate::semantic::{SemanticInfo, SymbolKind, SymbolTable, TypeRegistry};
    9|       |
   10|       |/// Context for constant expression evaluation
   11|       |pub(crate) struct ConstEvalCtx<'a> {
   12|       |    pub(crate) ast: &'a Ast,
   13|       |    pub(crate) symbol_table: &'a SymbolTable,
   14|       |    pub(crate) registry: &'a TypeRegistry,
   15|       |    pub(crate) semantic_info: Option<&'a SemanticInfo>,
   16|       |}
   17|       |
   18|       |/// Evaluate a constant expression node to an i64 value
   19|      0|pub(crate) fn eval_const_expr(ctx: &ConstEvalCtx, expr_node_ref: NodeRef) -> Option<i64> {
   20|      0|    let node_kind = ctx.ast.get_kind(expr_node_ref);
   21|      0|    match node_kind {
   22|      0|        NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Int { val, .. }) => Some(*val),
   23|      0|        NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::Char(val)) => Some(*val as i64),
   24|      0|        NodeKind::Ident(_, sym_ref) => {
   25|      0|            let symbol = ctx.symbol_table.get_symbol(*sym_ref);
   26|      0|            if let SymbolKind::EnumConstant { value } = &symbol.kind {
   27|      0|                Some(*value)
   28|       |            } else {
   29|      0|                None
   30|       |            }
   31|       |        }
   32|      0|        NodeKind::BinaryOp(op, left_ref, right_ref) => {
   33|      0|            let left_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *left_ref)?;
   34|       |
   35|       |            // Short-circuiting logic
   36|      0|            match op {
   37|       |                BinaryOp::LogicAnd => {
   38|      0|                    if left_val == 0 {
   39|      0|                        return Some(0);
   40|      0|                    }
   41|      0|                    let right_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *right_ref)?;
   42|      0|                    return Some((right_val != 0) as i64);
   43|       |                }
   44|       |                BinaryOp::LogicOr => {
   45|      0|                    if left_val != 0 {
   46|      0|                        return Some(1);
   47|      0|                    }
   48|      0|                    let right_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *right_ref)?;
   49|      0|                    return Some((right_val != 0) as i64);
   50|       |                }
   51|      0|                _ => {}
   52|       |            }
   53|       |
   54|      0|            let right_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *right_ref)?;
   55|      0|            match op {
   56|      0|                BinaryOp::Add => Some(left_val.wrapping_add(right_val)),
   57|      0|                BinaryOp::Sub => Some(left_val.wrapping_sub(right_val)),
   58|      0|                BinaryOp::Mul => Some(left_val.wrapping_mul(right_val)),
   59|       |                BinaryOp::Div => {
   60|      0|                    if right_val != 0 {
   61|      0|                        Some(left_val.wrapping_div(right_val))
   62|       |                    } else {
   63|      0|                        None
   64|       |                    }
   65|       |                }
   66|      0|                BinaryOp::Equal => Some((left_val == right_val) as i64),
   67|      0|                BinaryOp::NotEqual => Some((left_val != right_val) as i64),
   68|      0|                BinaryOp::Less => Some((left_val < right_val) as i64),
   69|      0|                BinaryOp::LessEqual => Some((left_val <= right_val) as i64),
   70|      0|                BinaryOp::Greater => Some((left_val > right_val) as i64),
   71|      0|                BinaryOp::GreaterEqual => Some((left_val >= right_val) as i64),
   72|       |                // LogicAnd/LogicOr handled above
   73|      0|                BinaryOp::BitOr => Some(left_val | right_val),
   74|      0|                BinaryOp::BitAnd => Some(left_val & right_val),
   75|      0|                BinaryOp::BitXor => Some(left_val ^ right_val),
   76|       |                BinaryOp::LShift => {
   77|       |                    // Safe shift, handle overflow or large shift count by wrapping or masking
   78|      0|                    Some(left_val.wrapping_shl(right_val as u32))
   79|       |                }
   80|      0|                BinaryOp::RShift => Some(left_val.wrapping_shr(right_val as u32)),
   81|      0|                _ => None,
   82|       |            }
   83|       |        }
   84|      0|        NodeKind::UnaryOp(op, operand_ref) => {
   85|      0|            let operand_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *operand_ref)?;
   86|      0|            match op {
   87|      0|                UnaryOp::LogicNot => Some((operand_val == 0) as i64),
   88|      0|                UnaryOp::Plus => Some(operand_val),
   89|      0|                UnaryOp::Minus => Some(operand_val.wrapping_neg()),
   90|      0|                UnaryOp::BitNot => Some(!operand_val),
   91|      0|                _ => None,
   92|       |            }
   93|       |        }
   94|      0|        NodeKind::SizeOfExpr(expr) => {
   95|      0|            let ty = ctx.ast.get_resolved_type(*expr).expect("Type not resolved");
   96|      0|            let layout = ctx.registry.get_layout(ty.ty());
   97|      0|            Some(layout.size as i64)
   98|       |        }
   99|      0|        NodeKind::AlignOf(ty) => {
  100|      0|            let layout = ctx.registry.get_layout(ty.ty());
  101|      0|            Some(layout.alignment as i64)
  102|       |        }
  103|      0|        NodeKind::SizeOfType(ty) => {
  104|      0|            let layout = ctx.registry.get_layout(ty.ty());
  105|      0|            Some(layout.size as i64)
  106|       |        }
  107|       |        NodeKind::GenericSelection(_) => {
  108|      0|            let info = ctx.semantic_info.or(ctx.ast.semantic_info.as_ref());
  109|      0|            if let Some(info) = info
  110|      0|                && let Some(selected_expr) = info.generic_selections.get(&expr_node_ref.index())
  111|       |            {
  112|      0|                return eval_const_expr(ctx, *selected_expr);
  113|      0|            }
  114|      0|            None
  115|       |        }
  116|      0|        NodeKind::TernaryOp(cond, then_ref, else_ref) => {
  117|      0|            let cond_val = eval_const_expr(ctx, *cond)?;
  118|      0|            if cond_val != 0 {
  119|      0|                eval_const_expr(ctx, *then_ref)
  120|       |            } else {
  121|      0|                eval_const_expr(ctx, *else_ref)
  122|       |            }
  123|       |        }
  124|      0|        _ => None,
  125|       |    }
  126|      0|}

    1|       |//! Implements C11 semantic conversions, such as usual arithmetic conversions
    2|       |//! and integer promotions.
    3|       |
    4|       |use crate::semantic::{BuiltinType, QualType, TypeKind, TypeRef, TypeRegistry};
    5|       |
    6|       |/// Performs the "usual arithmetic conversions" as specified in C11 6.3.1.8.
    7|      0|pub(crate) fn usual_arithmetic_conversions(ctx: &mut TypeRegistry, lhs: QualType, rhs: QualType) -> Option<QualType> {
    8|      0|    let lt = lhs.ty();
    9|      0|    let rt = rhs.ty();
   10|       |
   11|      0|    if lt.is_floating() || rt.is_floating() {
   12|      0|        let get_real_type = |registry: &TypeRegistry, ty: TypeRef| {
   13|      0|            if ty.is_complex() {
   14|      0|                match &registry.get(ty).kind {
   15|      0|                    TypeKind::Complex { base_type } => Some(*base_type),
   16|      0|                    _ => None,
   17|       |                }
   18|       |            } else {
   19|      0|                Some(ty)
   20|       |            }
   21|      0|        };
   22|       |
   23|      0|        let lr = get_real_type(ctx, lt)?;
   24|      0|        let rr = get_real_type(ctx, rt)?;
   25|       |
   26|      0|        let lb = lr.builtin();
   27|      0|        let rb = rr.builtin();
   28|       |
   29|      0|        let common_real = match (lb, rb) {
   30|      0|            (Some(BuiltinType::LongDouble), _) | (_, Some(BuiltinType::LongDouble)) => ctx.type_long_double,
   31|      0|            (Some(BuiltinType::Double), _) | (_, Some(BuiltinType::Double)) => ctx.type_double,
   32|      0|            _ => ctx.type_float,
   33|       |        };
   34|       |
   35|      0|        if lt.is_complex() || rt.is_complex() {
   36|      0|            return Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.complex_type(common_real)));
   37|       |        } else {
   38|      0|            return Some(QualType::unqualified(common_real));
   39|       |        }
   40|      0|    }
   41|       |
   42|       |    // Both types are promoted to at least 'int' or 'unsigned int'
   43|      0|    let lp = integer_promotion(ctx, lhs);
   44|      0|    let rp = integer_promotion(ctx, rhs);
   45|      0|    if lp == rp {
   46|      0|        return Some(lp);
   47|      0|    }
   48|       |
   49|      0|    let lbp = lp.ty().builtin()?;
   50|      0|    let rbp = rp.ty().builtin()?;
   51|      0|    let (ls, lr) = (lbp.is_signed(), lbp.rank());
   52|      0|    let (rs, rr) = (rbp.is_signed(), rbp.rank());
   53|       |
   54|       |    // Same signedness: higher rank wins
   55|      0|    if ls == rs {
   56|      0|        return Some(if lr >= rr { lp } else { rp });
   57|      0|    }
   58|       |
   59|       |    // Different signedness: Higher rank usually wins; if ranks are equal, unsigned wins.
   60|      0|    let (ut, ur, st, sr) = if ls { (rp, rr, lp, lr) } else { (lp, lr, rp, rr) };
   61|      0|    if ur >= sr {
   62|      0|        Some(ut)
   63|       |    } else {
   64|       |        // If the signed type can represent all values of the unsigned type, it wins.
   65|       |        // For currently supported targets (e.g. 32-bit int, 64-bit long), this holds.
   66|      0|        Some(st)
   67|       |    }
   68|      0|}
   69|       |
   70|       |/// Performs integer promotions as specified in C11 6.3.1.1.
   71|      0|pub(crate) fn integer_promotion(ctx: &TypeRegistry, ty: QualType) -> QualType {
   72|      0|    let t = ty.ty();
   73|      0|    if t.is_enum() {
   74|      0|        return QualType::unqualified(ctx.type_int);
   75|      0|    }
   76|      0|    match t.builtin() {
   77|      0|        Some(b) if b.is_integer() && b.rank() < BuiltinType::Int.rank() => QualType::unqualified(ctx.type_int),
   78|      0|        _ => ty,
   79|       |    }
   80|      0|}
   81|       |
   82|       |/// Performs default argument promotions as specified in C11 6.5.2.2.
   83|      0|pub(crate) fn default_argument_promotions(ctx: &TypeRegistry, ty: QualType) -> QualType {
   84|      0|    match ty.ty().builtin() {
   85|      0|        Some(BuiltinType::Float) => QualType::unqualified(ctx.type_double),
   86|      0|        _ => integer_promotion(ctx, ty),
   87|       |    }
   88|      0|}

  353|      0|    pub(crate) fn unify_binary_operands(
  354|      0|        &mut self,
  355|      0|        mut lhs: Operand,
  356|      0|        mut rhs: Operand,
  357|      0|        lhs_mir_ty: TypeId,
  358|      0|        rhs_mir_ty: TypeId,
  359|      0|    ) -> (Operand, Operand) {
  360|      0|        if lhs_mir_ty != rhs_mir_ty {
  361|      0|            let lhs_mir = self.mir_builder.get_type(lhs_mir_ty);
  362|      0|            let rhs_mir = self.mir_builder.get_type(rhs_mir_ty);
  363|       |
  364|      0|            if lhs_mir.is_int() && rhs_mir.is_int() {
  365|      0|                let w1 = lhs_mir.width();
  366|      0|                let w2 = rhs_mir.width();
  367|      0|                if w1 > w2 {
  368|      0|                    rhs = Operand::Cast(lhs_mir_ty, Box::new(rhs));
  369|      0|                } else if w2 > w1 {
  370|      0|                    lhs = Operand::Cast(rhs_mir_ty, Box::new(lhs));
  371|      0|                }
  372|      0|            } else if lhs_mir.is_pointer() && rhs_mir.is_int() {
  373|      0|                rhs = Operand::Cast(lhs_mir_ty, Box::new(rhs));
  374|      0|            } else if lhs_mir.is_int() && rhs_mir.is_pointer() {
  375|      0|                lhs = Operand::Cast(rhs_mir_ty, Box::new(lhs));
  376|      0|            }
  377|      0|        }
  378|      0|        (lhs, rhs)
  379|      0|    }
  380|       |
  381|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_binary_op_expr(
  382|      0|        &mut self,
  383|      0|        op: &BinaryOp,
  384|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  385|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  386|      0|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  387|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  388|      0|        debug_assert!(
  389|      0|            !op.is_assignment(),
  390|      0|            "lower_binary_op_expr called with assignment operator: {:?}",
  391|       |            op
  392|       |        );
  393|      0|        if matches!(op, BinaryOp::LogicAnd | BinaryOp::LogicOr) {
  394|      0|            return self.lower_logical_op(op, left_ref, right_ref, mir_ty);
  395|      0|        }
  396|       |
  397|      0|        let lhs = self.lower_expression(left_ref, true);
  398|      0|        let rhs = self.lower_expression(right_ref, true);
  399|       |
  400|       |        // Check types for correct MIR op
  401|       |        // For Comma operator, we just evaluate LHS for side effects and return RHS
  402|      0|        if matches!(op, BinaryOp::Comma) {
  403|       |            // Apply conversions for RHS to match result type (comma result type is RHS type)
  404|      0|            let rhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(rhs, right_ref, mir_ty);
  405|      0|            return self.ensure_explicit_cast(rhs_converted, right_ref);
  406|      0|        }
  407|       |
  408|      0|        let (rval, _op_ty) = self.lower_binary_arithmetic_logic(op, lhs, rhs, left_ref, right_ref, mir_ty);
  409|      0|        self.emit_rvalue_to_operand(rval, mir_ty)
  410|      0|    }
  411|       |
  412|      0|    fn lower_binary_arithmetic_logic(
  413|      0|        &mut self,
  414|      0|        op: &BinaryOp,
  415|      0|        lhs: Operand,
  416|      0|        rhs: Operand,
  417|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  418|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  419|      0|        context_ty: TypeId,
  420|      0|    ) -> (Rvalue, TypeId) {
  421|       |        // Handle pointer arithmetic
  422|      0|        if let Some(rval) = self.lower_pointer_arithmetic(op, lhs.clone(), rhs.clone(), left_ref, right_ref) {
  423|      0|            let res_ty = match &rval {
  424|      0|                Rvalue::PtrAdd(base, _) | Rvalue::PtrSub(base, _) => self.get_operand_type(base),
  425|      0|                Rvalue::PtrDiff(..) => self.lower_type(self.registry.type_long),
  426|      0|                _ => unreachable!(),
  427|       |            };
  428|      0|            return (rval, res_ty);
  429|      0|        }
  430|       |
  431|       |        // Apply implicit conversions from semantic info first to match AST
  432|      0|        let lhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(lhs, left_ref, context_ty);
  433|      0|        let rhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(rhs, right_ref, context_ty);
  434|       |
  435|      0|        let lhs_mir_ty = self.get_operand_type(&lhs_converted);
  436|      0|        let rhs_mir_ty = self.get_operand_type(&rhs_converted);
  437|       |
  438|      0|        let lhs_is_complex = self.mir_builder.get_type(lhs_mir_ty).is_aggregate()
  439|      0|            && self.ast.get_resolved_type(left_ref).is_some_and(|t| t.is_complex());
  440|      0|        let rhs_is_complex = self.mir_builder.get_type(rhs_mir_ty).is_aggregate()
  441|      0|            && self.ast.get_resolved_type(right_ref).is_some_and(|t| t.is_complex());
  442|       |
  443|      0|        if lhs_is_complex || rhs_is_complex {
  444|      0|            let op = self.lower_complex_binary_op(op, lhs_converted, rhs_converted, context_ty);
  445|      0|            return (Rvalue::Use(op), context_ty);
  446|      0|        }
  447|       |
  448|       |        // Ensure both operands have the same type for MIR operations.
  449|      0|        let (lhs_unified, rhs_unified) =
  450|      0|            self.unify_binary_operands(lhs_converted, rhs_converted, lhs_mir_ty, rhs_mir_ty);
  451|       |
  452|      0|        let lhs_final = self.ensure_explicit_cast(lhs_unified, left_ref);
  453|      0|        let rhs_final = self.ensure_explicit_cast(rhs_unified, right_ref);
  454|       |
  455|      0|        let common_ty = self.get_operand_type(&lhs_final);
  456|       |
  457|      0|        let common_mir_type = self.mir_builder.get_type(common_ty);
  458|      0|        let rval = mir_ops::emit_binary_rvalue(op, lhs_final, rhs_final, common_mir_type.is_float());
  459|       |
  460|      0|        let result_ty = match op {
  461|       |            BinaryOp::Equal
  462|       |            | BinaryOp::NotEqual
  463|       |            | BinaryOp::Less
  464|       |            | BinaryOp::LessEqual
  465|       |            | BinaryOp::Greater
  466|      0|            | BinaryOp::GreaterEqual => self.get_int_type(),
  467|      0|            _ => common_ty,
  468|       |        };
  469|       |
  470|      0|        (rval, result_ty)
  471|      0|    }
  472|       |
  473|      0|    pub(crate) fn ensure_explicit_cast(&mut self, operand: Operand, node_ref: NodeRef) -> Operand {
  474|      0|        match operand {
  475|       |            Operand::Constant(_) => {
  476|      0|                if let Some(ty) = self.ast.get_resolved_type(node_ref) {
  477|      0|                    let mir_type_id = self.lower_qual_type(ty);
  478|      0|                    Operand::Cast(mir_type_id, Box::new(operand))
  479|       |                } else {
  480|      0|                    operand
  481|       |                }
  482|       |            }
  483|      0|            _ => operand,
  484|       |        }
  485|      0|    }
