  487|      0|    pub(crate) fn emit_bool_normalization(
  488|      0|        &mut self,
  489|      0|        value_op: Operand,
  490|      0|        result_place: Place,
  491|      0|        merge_block: crate::mir::MirBlockId,
  492|      0|    ) {
  493|      0|        let true_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  494|      0|        let false_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  495|       |
  496|      0|        self.mir_builder
  497|      0|            .set_terminator(Terminator::If(value_op, true_block, false_block));
  498|       |
  499|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(true_block);
  500|      0|        let one_op = self.create_int_operand(1);
  501|      0|        self.mir_builder
  502|      0|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(result_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(one_op)));
  503|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  504|       |
  505|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(false_block);
  506|      0|        let zero_op = self.create_int_operand(0);
  507|      0|        self.mir_builder
  508|      0|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(result_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(zero_op)));
  509|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  510|      0|    }
  511|       |
  512|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_logical_op(
  513|      0|        &mut self,
  514|      0|        op: &BinaryOp,
  515|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  516|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  517|      0|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  518|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  519|       |        // Short-circuiting logic for && and ||
  520|      0|        let (_res_local, res_place) = self.create_temp_local(mir_ty);
  521|       |
  522|      0|        let eval_rhs_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  523|      0|        let merge_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  524|      0|        let short_circuit_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
  525|       |
  526|       |        // 1. Evaluate LHS
  527|      0|        let lhs_op = self.lower_condition(left_ref);
  528|       |
  529|       |        // Pre-create constants to avoid double borrow
  530|      0|        let zero_op = self.create_int_operand(0);
  531|      0|        let one_op = self.create_int_operand(1);
  532|       |
  533|      0|        let (short_circuit_val, true_target, false_target) = match op {
  534|      0|            BinaryOp::LogicAnd => (zero_op.clone(), eval_rhs_block, short_circuit_block),
  535|      0|            BinaryOp::LogicOr => (one_op.clone(), short_circuit_block, eval_rhs_block),
  536|      0|            _ => unreachable!(),
  537|       |        };
  538|       |
  539|       |        // if lhs { goto true_target } else { goto false_target }
  540|      0|        self.mir_builder
  541|      0|            .set_terminator(Terminator::If(lhs_op, true_target, false_target));
  542|       |
  543|       |        // Short circuit case
  544|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(short_circuit_block);
  545|      0|        self.mir_builder
  546|      0|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(res_place.clone(), Rvalue::Use(short_circuit_val)));
  547|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(merge_block));
  548|       |
  549|       |        // 2. Evaluate RHS
  550|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(eval_rhs_block);
  551|      0|        let rhs_val = self.lower_condition(right_ref);
  552|       |
  553|      0|        self.emit_bool_normalization(rhs_val, res_place.clone(), merge_block);
  554|       |
  555|       |        // Merge
  556|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(merge_block);
  557|      0|        self.current_block = Some(merge_block);
  558|       |
  559|      0|        Operand::Copy(Box::new(res_place))
  560|      0|    }

  562|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_pointer_arithmetic(
  563|      0|        &mut self,
  564|      0|        op: &BinaryOp,
  565|      0|        lhs: Operand,
  566|      0|        rhs: Operand,
  567|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  568|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  569|      0|    ) -> Option<Rvalue> {
  570|      0|        let lhs_type = self.ast.get_resolved_type(left_ref).unwrap();
  571|      0|        let rhs_type = self.ast.get_resolved_type(right_ref).unwrap();
  572|       |
  573|      0|        match op {
  574|       |            BinaryOp::Add => {
  575|      0|                if lhs_type.is_pointer() {
  576|      0|                    let rhs_mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(rhs_type);
  577|      0|                    let rhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(rhs, right_ref, rhs_mir_ty);
  578|      0|                    Some(self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(lhs, rhs_converted, BinaryOp::Add))
  579|      0|                } else if rhs_type.is_pointer() {
  580|      0|                    let lhs_mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(lhs_type);
  581|      0|                    let lhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(lhs, left_ref, lhs_mir_ty);
  582|      0|                    Some(self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(rhs, lhs_converted, BinaryOp::Add))
  583|       |                } else {
  584|      0|                    None
  585|       |                }
  586|       |            }
  587|       |            BinaryOp::Sub => {
  588|      0|                if lhs_type.is_pointer() {
  589|      0|                    if rhs_type.is_pointer() {
  590|      0|                        Some(Rvalue::PtrDiff(lhs, rhs))
  591|      0|                    } else if rhs_type.is_integer() {
  592|      0|                        let rhs_mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(rhs_type);
  593|      0|                        let rhs_converted = self.apply_conversions(rhs, right_ref, rhs_mir_ty);
  594|      0|                        Some(self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(lhs, rhs_converted, BinaryOp::Sub))
  595|       |                    } else {
  596|      0|                        None
  597|       |                    }
  598|       |                } else {
  599|      0|                    None
  600|       |                }
  601|       |            }
  602|      0|            _ => None,
  603|       |        }
  604|      0|    }

  606|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_assignment_expr(
  607|      0|        &mut self,
  608|      0|        node_ref: NodeRef,
  609|      0|        op: &BinaryOp,
  610|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  611|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  612|      0|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  613|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  614|      0|        debug_assert!(
  615|      0|            op.is_assignment(),
  616|      0|            "lower_assignment_expr called with non-assignment operator: {:?}",
  617|       |            op
  618|       |        );
  619|       |
  620|       |        // Ensure the LHS is a place. If not, this is a semantic error.
  621|      0|        if self.ast.get_value_category(left_ref) != Some(ValueCategory::LValue) {
  622|      0|            panic!("LHS of assignment must be an lvalue");
  623|      0|        }
  624|       |
  625|       |        // Use lower_expression_as_place to properly resolve the destination place
  626|      0|        let place = self.lower_expression_as_place(left_ref);
  627|       |
  628|      0|        let rhs_op = self.lower_expression(right_ref, true);
  629|       |
  630|      0|        let final_rhs = if let Some(compound_op) = op.without_assignment() {
  631|      0|            self.lower_compound_assignment(
  632|      0|                node_ref,
  633|      0|                compound_op,
  634|      0|                place.clone(),
  635|      0|                rhs_op,
  636|      0|                left_ref,
  637|      0|                right_ref,
  638|      0|                mir_ty,
  639|       |            )
  640|       |        } else {
  641|       |            // Simple assignment, just use the RHS
  642|      0|            self.apply_conversions(rhs_op, right_ref, mir_ty)
  643|       |        };
  644|       |
  645|      0|        self.emit_assignment(place, final_rhs.clone());
  646|      0|        final_rhs // C assignment expressions evaluate to the assigned value
  647|      0|    }
  648|       |
  649|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_compound_assignment(
  650|      0|        &mut self,
  651|      0|        node_ref: NodeRef,
  652|      0|        compound_op: BinaryOp,
  653|      0|        place: Place,
  654|      0|        rhs_op: Operand,
  655|      0|        left_ref: NodeRef,
  656|      0|        right_ref: NodeRef,
  657|      0|        mir_ty: TypeId,
  658|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  659|       |        // This is a compound assignment, e.g., a += b
  660|       |        // Use the already-evaluated place to read the current value.
  661|      0|        let lhs_copy = Operand::Copy(Box::new(place));
  662|       |
  663|      0|        let (rval, op_ty) =
  664|      0|            self.lower_binary_arithmetic_logic(&compound_op, lhs_copy, rhs_op, left_ref, right_ref, mir_ty);
  665|      0|        let result_op = self.emit_rvalue_to_operand(rval, op_ty);
  666|      0|        self.apply_conversions(result_op, node_ref, mir_ty)
  667|      0|    }

  669|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_function_call(&mut self, call_expr: &ast::nodes::CallExpr, dest_place: Option<Place>) {
  670|      0|        let callee = self.lower_expression(call_expr.callee, true);
  671|       |
  672|      0|        let arg_operands = self.lower_function_call_args(call_expr);
  673|       |
  674|      0|        let call_target = if let Operand::Constant(const_id) = callee {
  675|       |            if let ConstValue {
  676|      0|                kind: ConstValueKind::FunctionAddress(func_id),
  677|       |                ..
  678|      0|            } = self.mir_builder.get_constants().get(&const_id).unwrap()
  679|       |            {
  680|      0|                CallTarget::Direct(*func_id)
  681|       |            } else {
  682|      0|                panic!("Expected function address");
  683|       |            }
  684|       |        } else {
  685|      0|            CallTarget::Indirect(callee)
  686|       |        };
  687|       |
  688|      0|        let stmt = MirStmt::Call {
  689|      0|            target: call_target,
  690|      0|            args: arg_operands,
  691|      0|            dest: dest_place,
  692|      0|        };
  693|      0|        self.mir_builder.add_statement(stmt);
  694|      0|    }
  695|       |
  696|      0|    fn lower_function_call_args(&mut self, call_expr: &ast::nodes::CallExpr) -> Vec<Operand> {
  697|      0|        let mut arg_operands = Vec::new();
  698|       |
  699|       |        // Get the function type to determine parameter types for conversions
  700|      0|        let func_node_kind = self.ast.get_kind(call_expr.callee);
  701|      0|        let func_type_kind = if let NodeKind::Ident(_, symbol_ref) = func_node_kind {
  702|      0|            let resolved_symbol = *symbol_ref;
  703|      0|            let func_entry = self.symbol_table.get_symbol(resolved_symbol);
  704|      0|            Some(self.registry.get(func_entry.type_info.ty()).kind.clone())
  705|       |        } else {
  706|      0|            None
  707|       |        };
  708|       |
  709|      0|        let param_types = if let Some(TypeKind::Function { parameters, .. }) = func_type_kind.as_ref() {
  710|       |            Some(
  711|      0|                parameters
  712|      0|                    .iter()
  713|      0|                    .map(|param| self.lower_qual_type(param.param_type))
  714|      0|                    .collect::<Vec<_>>(),
  715|       |            )
  716|       |        } else {
  717|      0|            None
  718|       |        };
  719|       |
  720|      0|        for (i, arg_ref) in call_expr.arg_start.range(call_expr.arg_len).enumerate() {
  721|       |            // Note: lower_expression(CallArg) will just lower the inner expression.
  722|       |            // But we use arg_ref (the CallArg node) for implicit conversion lookup.
  723|      0|            let arg_operand = self.lower_expression(arg_ref, true);
  724|       |
  725|       |            // Apply conversions for function arguments if needed
  726|       |            // The resolved type of CallArg is same as inner expr.
  727|      0|            let arg_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(arg_ref).unwrap();
  728|      0|            let arg_mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(arg_ty);
  729|       |
  730|       |            // Use the parameter type as the target type for conversions, if available
  731|      0|            let target_mir_ty = if let Some(ref param_types_vec) = param_types {
  732|      0|                if i < param_types_vec.len() {
  733|      0|                    param_types_vec[i]
  734|       |                } else {
  735|       |                    // Variadic argument: Logic handled by implicit conversions (Promotion/Decay) calculated in analyzer.rs
  736|       |                    // We just need a placeholder type, or the promoted type if we could calculate it.
  737|       |                    // Since semantic analysis has inserted promoted type casts/conversions, we can start with the argument's own type.
  738|      0|                    arg_mir_ty
  739|       |                }
  740|       |            } else {
  741|       |                // Unprototyped function: Logic handled by implicit conversions
  742|      0|                arg_mir_ty
  743|       |            };
  744|       |
  745|      0|            let converted_arg = self.apply_conversions(arg_operand, arg_ref, target_mir_ty);
  746|       |
  747|      0|            arg_operands.push(converted_arg);
  748|       |        }
  749|      0|        arg_operands
  750|      0|    }

  752|      0|    pub(crate) fn find_member_path(&self, record_ty: semantic::TypeRef, field_name: ast::NameId) -> Option<Vec<usize>> {
  753|      0|        let mut flat_members = Vec::new();
  754|      0|        let ty = self.registry.get(record_ty);
  755|      0|        ty.flatten_members(self.registry, &mut flat_members);
  756|       |
  757|      0|        if let Some(idx) = flat_members.iter().position(|m| m.name == Some(field_name)) {
  758|      0|            return Some(vec![idx]);
  759|      0|        }
  760|      0|        None
  761|      0|    }
  762|       |
  763|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_member_access(
  764|      0|        &mut self,
  765|      0|        obj_ref: NodeRef,
  766|      0|        field_name: &ast::NameId,
  767|      0|        is_arrow: bool,
  768|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  769|      0|        let obj_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(obj_ref).unwrap();
  770|      0|        let record_ty = if is_arrow {
  771|      0|            self.registry
  772|      0|                .get_pointee(obj_ty.ty())
  773|      0|                .expect("Arrow access on non-pointer type")
  774|      0|                .ty()
  775|       |        } else {
  776|      0|            obj_ty.ty()
  777|       |        };
  778|       |
  779|      0|        if record_ty.is_record() {
  780|       |            // Validate that the field exists and get its layout information
  781|      0|            let path = self
  782|      0|                .find_member_path(record_ty, *field_name)
  783|      0|                .expect("Field not found - should be caught by semantic analysis");
  784|       |
  785|       |            // Apply the chain of field accesses
  786|       |
  787|       |            // Resolve base place
  788|      0|            let mut current_place = self.lower_expression_as_place(obj_ref);
  789|       |
  790|      0|            if is_arrow {
  791|      0|                // Dereference: *ptr
  792|      0|                current_place = self.deref_place(current_place);
  793|      0|            }
  794|       |
  795|      0|            for field_idx in path {
  796|      0|                current_place = Place::StructField(Box::new(current_place), field_idx);
  797|      0|            }
  798|       |
  799|      0|            Operand::Copy(Box::new(current_place))
  800|       |        } else {
  801|      0|            panic!("Member access on non-record type");
  802|       |        }
  803|      0|    }
  804|       |
  805|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_index_access(&mut self, arr_ref: NodeRef, idx_ref: NodeRef) -> Operand {
  806|      0|        let arr_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(arr_ref).unwrap();
  807|       |
  808|       |        // Handle both array and pointer types for index access
  809|       |        // In C, arr[idx] is equivalent to *(arr + idx)
  810|      0|        if arr_ty.is_array() || arr_ty.is_pointer() {
  811|      0|            let arr_place = self.lower_expression_as_place(arr_ref);
  812|      0|            let idx_operand = self.lower_expression(idx_ref, true);
  813|       |
  814|      0|            Operand::Copy(Box::new(Place::ArrayIndex(Box::new(arr_place), Box::new(idx_operand))))
  815|       |        } else {
  816|      0|            panic!("Index access on non-array, non-pointer type");
  817|       |        }
  818|      0|    }

  820|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_inc_dec_expression(
  821|      0|        &mut self,
  822|      0|        operand_ref: NodeRef,
  823|      0|        is_inc: bool,
  824|      0|        is_post: bool,
  825|      0|        need_value: bool,
  826|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  827|      0|        let operand = self.lower_expression(operand_ref, true);
  828|      0|        let operand_ty = self.ast.get_resolved_type(operand_ref).unwrap();
  829|      0|        let mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(operand_ty);
  830|       |
  831|      0|        if self.ast.get_value_category(operand_ref) != Some(ValueCategory::LValue) {
  832|      0|            panic!("Inc/Dec operand must be an lvalue");
  833|      0|        }
  834|       |
  835|      0|        let place = if let Operand::Copy(place) = operand.clone() {
  836|      0|            place
  837|       |        } else {
  838|      0|            panic!("Inc/Dec operand is not a place");
  839|       |        };
  840|       |
  841|       |        // If it's post-inc/dec and we need the value, save the old value
  842|      0|        let old_value = if is_post && need_value {
  843|      0|            let rval = Rvalue::Use(operand.clone());
  844|      0|            let (_, temp_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(rval, mir_ty);
  845|      0|            Some(Operand::Copy(Box::new(temp_place)))
  846|       |        } else {
  847|      0|            None
  848|       |        };
  849|       |
  850|       |        // Determine MIR operation and Rvalue
  851|      0|        let rval = self.create_inc_dec_rvalue(operand.clone(), operand_ty, is_inc);
  852|       |
  853|       |        // Perform the assignment
  854|      0|        if is_post && !need_value {
  855|      0|            // Optimization: assign directly to place if old value not needed
  856|      0|            self.mir_builder.add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(*place.clone(), rval));
  857|      0|        } else {
  858|       |            // If we needed old value (is_post), or if it is pre-inc (need new value),
  859|       |            // we compute to a temp first to ensure correctness and return the right value.
  860|      0|            let (_, new_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(rval, mir_ty);
  861|      0|            self.emit_assignment(*place.clone(), Operand::Copy(Box::new(new_place.clone())));
  862|       |
  863|      0|            if !is_post {
  864|       |                // Pre-inc: return the new value
  865|      0|                return Operand::Copy(Box::new(new_place));
  866|      0|            }
  867|       |        }
  868|       |
  869|      0|        if is_post {
  870|      0|            if need_value {
  871|      0|                old_value.unwrap()
  872|       |            } else {
  873|      0|                self.create_int_operand(0)
  874|       |            }
  875|       |        } else {
  876|       |            // Pre-inc: we already returned inside the block above.
  877|       |            // RE-FETCH from place as a fallback (should not be reached)
  878|      0|            Operand::Copy(place)
  879|       |        }
  880|      0|    }
  881|       |
  882|      0|    pub(crate) fn create_inc_dec_rvalue(&mut self, operand: Operand, operand_ty: QualType, is_inc: bool) -> Rvalue {
  883|      0|        let one_const = self.create_int_operand(1);
  884|      0|        let minus_one_const = self.create_int_operand(-1);
  885|       |
  886|      0|        if operand_ty.is_pointer() {
  887|      0|            let op = if is_inc { BinaryOp::Add } else { BinaryOp::Sub };
  888|      0|            self.create_pointer_arithmetic_rvalue(operand, one_const, op)
  889|       |        } else {
  890|       |            // For Integers: Add(delta) (Note: we use Add with negative delta for decrement
  891|       |            // to support proper wrapping arithmetic and fix previous bugs)
  892|      0|            let rhs = if is_inc { one_const } else { minus_one_const };
  893|      0|            Rvalue::BinaryIntOp(BinaryIntOp::Add, operand, rhs)
  894|       |        }
  895|      0|    }

  899|      0|            BinaryOp::Add => Rvalue::PtrAdd(lhs, rhs),
  900|      0|            BinaryOp::Sub => Rvalue::PtrSub(lhs, rhs),
  901|      0|            _ => panic!("Invalid pointer arithmetic op"),
  902|       |        }
  903|      0|    }

  981|      0|    fn lower_atomic_cmpxchg(&mut self, args: &[Operand], order: AtomicMemOrder, mir_ty: TypeId) -> Operand {
  982|      0|        let ptr = args[0].clone();
  983|      0|        let expected_ptr = args[1].clone();
  984|      0|        let desired = args[2].clone();
  985|       |        // args[3] weak, args[4] success, args[5] failure (ignored side effects were handled by lowering args)
  986|       |
  987|      0|        let expected_place = match expected_ptr {
  988|      0|            Operand::Copy(p) => Place::Deref(Box::new(Operand::Copy(p))),
  989|      0|            _ => Place::Deref(Box::new(expected_ptr)),
  990|       |        };
  991|      0|        let expected_val_op = Operand::Copy(Box::new(expected_place.clone()));
  992|       |
  993|      0|        let weak = false;
  994|      0|        let cas_rval = Rvalue::AtomicCompareExchange(ptr, expected_val_op.clone(), desired.clone(), weak, order, order);
  995|       |
  996|      0|        let val_ty = self.get_operand_type(&desired);
  997|      0|        let (_, old_val_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(cas_rval, val_ty);
  998|      0|        let old_val = Operand::Copy(Box::new(old_val_place));
  999|       |
 1000|      0|        let mir_type_info = self.mir_builder.get_type(val_ty);
 1001|      0|        let cmp_rval = if mir_type_info.is_float() {
 1002|      0|            Rvalue::BinaryFloatOp(crate::mir::BinaryFloatOp::Eq, old_val.clone(), expected_val_op)
 1003|       |        } else {
 1004|      0|            Rvalue::BinaryIntOp(BinaryIntOp::Eq, old_val.clone(), expected_val_op)
 1005|       |        };
 1006|       |
 1007|      0|        let (_, success_place) = self.create_temp_local_with_assignment(cmp_rval, mir_ty);
 1008|      0|        let success_op = Operand::Copy(Box::new(success_place));
 1009|       |
 1010|      0|        let update_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
 1011|      0|        let end_block = self.mir_builder.create_block();
 1012|       |
 1013|      0|        self.mir_builder
 1014|      0|            .set_terminator(Terminator::If(success_op.clone(), end_block, update_block));
 1015|       |
 1016|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(update_block);
 1017|      0|        self.mir_builder
 1018|      0|            .add_statement(MirStmt::Assign(expected_place, Rvalue::Use(old_val)));
 1019|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_terminator(Terminator::Goto(end_block));
 1020|       |
 1021|      0|        self.mir_builder.set_current_block(end_block);
 1022|      0|        success_op
 1023|      0|    }

 1040|      0|    fn lower_complex_binary_op(&mut self, op: &BinaryOp, lhs: Operand, rhs: Operand, mir_ty: TypeId) -> Operand {

 1042|      0|        let rhs_ty = self.get_operand_type(&rhs);
 1043|       |

 1045|      0|        let (rhs_real, rhs_imag) = self.get_complex_components(rhs, rhs_ty);
 1046|       |

 1048|      0|            crate::mir::MirType::Record { field_types, .. } => field_types[0],

 1050|       |        };

 1055|       |            BinaryOp::Add | BinaryOp::Sub => {

 1060|       |            }

 1062|      0|                let ac = self.emit_float_binop(Mul, lhs_real.clone(), rhs_real.clone(), element_ty);

 1064|      0|                let real = self.emit_float_binop(Sub, ac, bd, element_ty);
 1065|       |

 1067|      0|                let bc = self.emit_float_binop(Mul, lhs_imag, rhs_real, element_ty);

 1069|       |
 1070|      0|                self.emit_complex_struct(real, imag, mir_ty)
 1071|       |            }
 1072|       |            BinaryOp::Div => {
 1073|      0|                let cc = self.emit_float_binop(Mul, rhs_real.clone(), rhs_real.clone(), element_ty);
 1074|      0|                let dd = self.emit_float_binop(Mul, rhs_imag.clone(), rhs_imag.clone(), element_ty);
 1075|      0|                let denom = self.emit_float_binop(Add, cc, dd, element_ty);
 1076|       |

 1078|      0|                let bd = self.emit_float_binop(Mul, lhs_imag.clone(), rhs_imag.clone(), element_ty);

 1090|      0|                let bool_ty = self.lower_type(self.registry.type_bool);
 1091|      0|                if *op == BinaryOp::Equal {

 1095|       |                } else {

 1101|      0|            _ => panic!("Unsupported complex binary operator: {:?}", op),
 1102|       |        }
 1103|      0|    }

   30|      0|    fn lower_struct_fields_recursive(
   31|      0|        &mut self,
   32|      0|        iter: &mut Peekable<impl Iterator<Item = NodeRef>>,
   33|      0|        pending_initializer: Option<NodeRef>,

   35|      0|    ) -> Vec<(usize, Operand)> {
   36|      0|        let TypeKind::Record { members, .. } = &self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).kind else {
   37|      0|            return Vec::new();
   38|       |        };
   39|      0|        let is_union = self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).is_union();
   40|      0|        let members = members.clone();
   41|       |
   42|       |        // Precalculate flattened offsets for hierarchical members

   44|      0|        let mut offset = 0;
   45|      0|        for m in &members {
   46|      0|            hierarchical_offsets.push(offset);
   47|      0|            if !is_union {
   48|      0|                offset += self.count_flattened_members(m);
   49|      0|            }
   50|       |        }
   51|       |
   52|      0|        let mut field_operands = Vec::new();

   54|      0|        let mut first_item_processed = false;
   55|       |
   56|       |        loop {
   57|      0|            let (item_ref, is_pending) = if let Some(pending) = pending_initializer

  103|      0|                iter.next();

  166|      0|    fn should_recurse_aggregate(&self, target_ty: QualType, initializer: NodeRef) -> bool {
  167|      0|        let kind = &self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).kind;
  168|      0|        if !matches!(kind, TypeKind::Record { .. } | TypeKind::Array { .. }) {
  169|      0|            return false;
  170|      0|        }
  171|       |
  172|      0|        let init_kind = self.ast.get_kind(initializer);
  173|      0|        if matches!(init_kind, NodeKind::InitializerList(_)) {
  174|      0|            return false;
  175|      0|        }
  176|       |
  177|      0|        if let NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::String(_)) = init_kind
  178|      0|            && let TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } = kind
  179|      0|            && self.registry.is_char_type(*element_type)
  180|       |        {
  181|      0|            return false;
  182|      0|        }
  183|       |
  184|      0|        let is_compatible = self.ast.get_resolved_type(initializer).is_some_and(|ty| {
  185|      0|            self.registry
  186|      0|                .is_compatible(QualType::unqualified(ty.ty()), QualType::unqualified(target_ty.ty()))
  187|      0|        });
  188|       |
  189|      0|        !is_compatible
  190|      0|    }

  192|      0|    fn lower_initializer_with_path_recursive(
  193|      0|        &mut self,
  194|      0|        path: &[usize],
  195|      0|        extra_designators: Option<&mut dyn Iterator<Item = NodeRef>>,
  196|      0|        initializer: NodeRef,
  197|      0|        target_ty: QualType,
  198|      0|    ) -> Vec<(usize, Operand)> {
  199|      0|        if path.is_empty() {
  200|      0|            let op = if let Some(designators) = extra_designators {
  201|      0|                self.lower_initializer_with_designators(designators, initializer, target_ty, None)
  202|       |            } else {
  203|      0|                self.lower_initializer(initializer, target_ty, None)
  204|       |            };
  205|      0|            return vec![(0, op)];
  206|      0|        }
  207|       |
  208|      0|        let target_type = self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).into_owned();
  209|      0|        let members = match &target_type.kind {
  210|      0|            TypeKind::Record { members, .. } => members.clone(),
  211|      0|            _ => panic!("Expected record type for designator path"),
  212|       |        };
  213|       |
  214|      0|        let field_idx = path[0];
  215|      0|        let mut flat_offset = 0;
  216|      0|        for member in members.iter().take(field_idx) {
  217|      0|            flat_offset += self.count_flattened_members(member);
  218|      0|        }
  219|       |
  220|      0|        let sub_fields = self.lower_initializer_with_path_recursive(
  221|      0|            &path[1..],
  222|      0|            extra_designators,
  223|      0|            initializer,
  224|      0|            members[field_idx].member_type,
  225|       |        );
  226|       |
  227|      0|        sub_fields
  228|      0|            .into_iter()
  229|      0|            .map(|(idx, op)| (flat_offset + idx, op))
  230|      0|            .collect()
  231|      0|    }

  233|      0|    pub(crate) fn resolve_designator_range(&mut self, designator_ref: NodeRef) -> (usize, usize) {
  234|      0|        match self.ast.get_kind(designator_ref) {
  235|      0|            NodeKind::Designator(Designator::ArrayIndex(idx_expr)) => {
  236|      0|                let idx = self.evaluate_constant_usize(*idx_expr, "Array designator must be constant");
  237|      0|                (idx, idx)
  238|       |            }
  239|      0|            NodeKind::Designator(Designator::GnuArrayRange(start, end)) => {
  240|      0|                let s = self.evaluate_constant_usize(*start, "Range start must be constant");
  241|      0|                let e = self.evaluate_constant_usize(*end, "Range end must be constant");
  242|      0|                if e < s {
  243|      0|                    panic!("Array range end < start");
  244|      0|                }
  245|      0|                (s, e)
  246|       |            }
  247|      0|            _ => panic!("Invalid designator for array"),
  248|       |        }
  249|      0|    }

  264|      0|    fn lower_array_initializer_from_iter(
  265|      0|        &mut self,
  266|      0|        iter: &mut Peekable<impl Iterator<Item = NodeRef>>,
  267|      0|        pending_initializer: Option<NodeRef>,
  268|      0|        element_ty: QualType,
  269|      0|        size: usize,
  270|      0|        target_ty: QualType,
  271|      0|        destination: Option<Place>,
  272|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  273|      0|        let mut elements: Vec<Option<Operand>> = vec![None; size];
  274|      0|        let mut current_idx = 0;
  275|      0|        let mut first_item_processed = false;
  276|       |
  277|       |        loop {
  278|       |            // Determine next item
  279|      0|            let (item_ref, is_pending) = if let Some(pending) = pending_initializer
  280|      0|                && !first_item_processed
  281|       |            {
  282|      0|                first_item_processed = true;

  284|      0|            } else if let Some(r) = iter.peek() {
  285|      0|                (*r, false)
  286|       |            } else {
  287|      0|                break;
  288|       |            };
  289|       |
  290|      0|            let (initializer, designator_info) = if is_pending {
  291|      0|                (item_ref, None)

  294|      0|                    iter.next();

  296|       |                };
  297|       |                (
  298|      0|                    init.initializer,
  299|      0|                    if init.designator_len > 0 {
  300|      0|                        Some((init.designator_start, init.designator_len))
  301|       |                    } else {
  302|      0|                        None
  303|       |                    },
  304|       |                )
  305|       |            };
  306|       |
  307|       |            // Stop if we have filled the array with positional initializers

  309|      0|                break;
  310|      0|            }
  311|       |
  312|      0|            let (start, end) = if let Some((d_start, _)) = designator_info {
  313|      0|                match self.ast.get_kind(d_start) {
  314|       |                    NodeKind::Designator(Designator::ArrayIndex(_))

  316|       |                    _ => {

  318|      0|                        if !is_pending {
  319|      0|                            break;
  320|      0|                        }
  321|      0|                        panic!("Field designator in array initializer");
  322|       |                    }
  323|       |                }
  324|       |            } else {
  325|      0|                (current_idx, current_idx)
  326|       |            };
  327|       |
  328|      0|            if !is_pending {
  329|      0|                iter.next();
  330|      0|            }
  331|       |
  332|      0|            let operand = if let Some((d_start, d_len)) = designator_info
  333|      0|                && d_len > 1
  334|       |            {
  335|      0|                let range = d_start.range(d_len);
  336|      0|                let sub_iter = range.skip(1);
  337|      0|                self.lower_initializer_with_designators(sub_iter, initializer, element_ty, None)
  338|      0|            } else if self.should_recurse_aggregate(element_ty, initializer) {
  339|      0|                match &self.registry.get(element_ty.ty()).kind {
  340|       |                    TypeKind::Record { .. } => {
  341|      0|                        let fields = self.lower_struct_fields_recursive(iter, Some(initializer), element_ty);
  342|      0|                        self.finalize_struct_initializer(fields, element_ty, None)
  343|       |                    }
  344|       |                    TypeKind::Array {
  345|      0|                        element_type: inner_elem,
  346|      0|                        size: inner_size,
  347|       |                    } => {
  348|      0|                        let array_size = if let ArraySizeType::Constant(s) = inner_size {
  349|      0|                            *s
  350|       |                        } else {
  351|      0|                            0
  352|       |                        };
  353|      0|                        self.lower_array_initializer_from_iter(
  354|      0|                            iter,
  355|      0|                            Some(initializer),
  356|      0|                            QualType::unqualified(*inner_elem),
  357|      0|                            array_size,
  358|      0|                            element_ty,
  359|      0|                            None,
  360|       |                        )
  361|       |                    }
  362|      0|                    _ => unreachable!(),
  363|       |                }
  364|       |            } else {
  365|      0|                self.lower_initializer(initializer, element_ty, None)
  366|       |            };

  368|      0|                elements.resize(end + 1, None);
  369|      0|            }
  370|      0|            for item in elements.iter_mut().take(end + 1).skip(start) {
  371|      0|                *item = Some(operand.clone());
  372|      0|            }
  373|      0|            current_idx = end + 1;
  374|       |        }
  375|       |
  376|      0|        let mir_elem_ty = self.lower_qual_type(element_ty);
  377|      0|        let final_elements = elements
  378|      0|            .into_iter()

  380|      0|            .collect();
  381|       |
  382|      0|        self.finalize_array_initializer(final_elements, target_ty, destination)
  383|      0|    }

  385|      0|    pub(crate) fn finalize_initializer_generic<T, C, R>(
  386|      0|        &mut self,
  387|      0|        target_ty: QualType,
  388|      0|        data: T,
  389|      0|        create_const: C,
  390|      0|        create_rvalue: R,
  391|      0|        destination: Option<Place>,
  392|      0|    ) -> Operand
  393|      0|    where
  394|      0|        C: FnOnce(&mut Self, T) -> ConstValueKind,
  395|      0|        R: FnOnce(T) -> Rvalue,
  396|       |    {
  397|      0|        let mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(target_ty);
  398|      0|        if self.current_function.is_none() {
  399|      0|            let const_kind = create_const(self, data);
  400|      0|            Operand::Constant(self.create_constant(mir_ty, const_kind))
  401|      0|        } else if let Some(place) = destination {
  402|      0|            let rval = create_rvalue(data);
  403|      0|            self.mir_builder
  404|      0|                .add_statement(crate::mir::MirStmt::Assign(place.clone(), rval));
  405|      0|            Operand::Copy(Box::new(place))
  406|       |        } else {
  407|      0|            let rval = create_rvalue(data);
  408|      0|            self.emit_rvalue_to_operand(rval, mir_ty)
  409|       |        }
  410|      0|    }

  412|      0|    pub(crate) fn finalize_struct_initializer(
  413|      0|        &mut self,
  414|      0|        field_operands: Vec<(usize, Operand)>,
  415|      0|        target_ty: QualType,
  416|      0|        destination: Option<Place>,
  417|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  418|       |        // Dedup by index, taking the last one for each index
  419|      0|        let mut final_fields: Vec<(usize, Operand)> = Vec::new();
  420|      0|        for (idx, op) in field_operands {
  421|      0|            if let Some(existing) = final_fields.iter_mut().find(|(i, _)| *i == idx) {
  422|      0|                existing.1 = op;
  423|      0|            } else {
  424|      0|                final_fields.push((idx, op));
  425|      0|            }
  426|       |        }
  427|      0|        final_fields.sort_by_key(|(idx, _)| *idx);
  428|       |
  429|      0|        self.finalize_initializer_generic(
  430|      0|            target_ty,
  431|      0|            final_fields,
  432|      0|            |this, fields| {
  433|      0|                let const_fields = fields
  434|      0|                    .into_iter()
  435|      0|                    .map(|(idx, op)| (idx, this.operand_to_const_id_strict(op, "Global struct init error")))
  436|      0|                    .collect();
  437|      0|                ConstValueKind::StructLiteral(const_fields)
  438|      0|            },
  439|       |            Rvalue::StructLiteral,
  440|      0|            destination,
  441|       |        )
  442|      0|    }

  465|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_initializer(
  466|      0|        &mut self,
  467|      0|        init_ref: NodeRef,
  468|      0|        target_ty: QualType,
  469|      0|        destination: Option<Place>,
  470|      0|    ) -> Operand {
  471|      0|        let kind = *self.ast.get_kind(init_ref);
  472|      0|        let target_type = self.registry.get(target_ty.ty()).into_owned();
  473|       |
  474|      0|        match (&kind, &target_type.kind) {
  475|      0|            (NodeKind::InitializerList(list), TypeKind::Record { .. }) => {
  476|      0|                self.lower_initializer_list(list, target_ty, destination)
  477|       |            }
  478|      0|            (NodeKind::InitializerList(list), TypeKind::Array { element_type, size }) => {
  479|      0|                let array_size = if let ArraySizeType::Constant(s) = size { *s } else { 0 };
  480|      0|                self.lower_array_initializer(
  481|      0|                    list,
  482|      0|                    QualType::unqualified(*element_type),
  483|      0|                    array_size,
  484|      0|                    target_ty,
  485|      0|                    destination,
  486|       |                )
  487|       |            }
  488|       |            // ...
  489|      0|            (NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::String(val)), TypeKind::Array { element_type, size }) => {
  490|      0|                let fixed_size = if let ArraySizeType::Constant(s) = size {
  491|      0|                    Some(*s)
  492|       |                } else {
  493|      0|                    None
  494|       |                };
  495|      0|                Operand::Constant(self.create_array_const_from_string(
  496|      0|                    val,
  497|      0|                    fixed_size,
  498|      0|                    Some(QualType::unqualified(*element_type)),
  499|      0|                ))
  500|       |            }
  501|      0|            (NodeKind::InitializerList(list), _) => {
  502|      0|                if list.init_len == 0 {
  503|      0|                    let mir_ty = self.lower_qual_type(target_ty);
  504|      0|                    return Operand::Constant(self.create_constant(mir_ty, ConstValueKind::Zero));
  505|      0|                }
  506|      0|                let NodeKind::InitializerItem(item) = self.ast.get_kind(list.init_start) else {
  507|      0|                    unreachable!()
  508|       |                };
  509|      0|                self.lower_initializer(item.initializer, target_ty, destination)
  510|       |            }
  511|       |            _ => {
  512|      0|                let operand = self.lower_expression(init_ref, true);
  513|      0|                let mir_target_ty = self.lower_qual_type(target_ty);
  514|       |
  515|      0|                if self.get_operand_type(&operand) == mir_target_ty {
  516|      0|                    return operand;
  517|      0|                }
  518|       |
  519|       |                // Brace elision: scalar -> aggregate
  520|      0|                self.lower_brace_elision(operand, init_ref, target_ty, destination)
  521|       |            }
  522|       |        }
  523|      0|    }
  524|       |
  525|      0|    pub(crate) fn create_array_const_from_string(
  526|      0|        &mut self,
  527|      0|        val: &ast::NameId,
  528|      0|        fixed_size: Option<usize>,
  529|      0|        elem_ty: Option<QualType>,
  530|      0|    ) -> crate::mir::ConstValueId {
  531|      0|        let parsed = crate::semantic::literal_utils::parse_string_literal(*val);
  532|      0|        let size = fixed_size.unwrap_or(parsed.size);
  533|       |
  534|      0|        let (mir_elem_ty, layout) = if let Some(qt) = elem_ty {
  535|      0|            (self.lower_qual_type(qt), self.registry.get_layout(qt.ty()).into_owned())
  536|       |        } else {
  537|      0|            let ty_ref = self.registry.get_builtin_type(parsed.builtin_type);

  818|       |/// Merge base types according to C type combination rules
  819|      1|fn merge_base_type(
  820|      1|    existing: Option<QualType>,
  821|      1|    new_type: QualType,
  822|      1|    ctx: &mut LowerCtx,
  823|      1|    span: SourceSpan,
  824|      1|) -> Option<QualType> {
  825|      1|    match existing {
  826|      1|        None => Some(new_type),
  827|      0|        Some(existing_ref) => {
  828|      0|            let existing_type = ctx.registry.get(existing_ref.ty());
  829|      0|            let new_type_info = ctx.registry.get(new_type.ty());
  830|       |
  831|      0|            match (&existing_type.kind, &new_type_info.kind) {
  832|      0|                (TypeKind::Builtin(existing_builtin), TypeKind::Builtin(new_builtin)) => {
  833|      0|                    match (existing_builtin, new_builtin) {
  834|       |                        // 1. Same types (redundancy)
  835|      0|                        (a, b) if a == b => {
  836|       |                            // C99/C11: int int is NOT allowed, but long long is.
  837|       |                            // However, many compilers allow redundant specifiers.
  838|       |                            // In Cendol, we'll allow it if they are identical,
  839|       |                            // EXCEPT for types that already have a combined form (like long long).
  840|      0|                            if *a == BuiltinType::Long {
  841|      0|                                Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_long))
  842|       |                            } else {
  843|      0|                                Some(existing_ref)
  844|       |                            }
  845|       |                        }
  846|       |
  847|       |                        // 2. Handle Signed as a modifier
  848|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(new_type),
  849|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::Signed) => Some(existing_ref),
  850|       |
  851|       |                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::Char) => {
  852|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_schar))
  853|       |                        }
  854|       |                        (BuiltinType::Char, BuiltinType::Signed) => {
  855|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_schar))
  856|       |                        }
  857|       |
  858|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::Short) => Some(new_type),
  859|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Short, BuiltinType::Signed) => Some(existing_ref),
  860|       |
  861|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::Long) => Some(new_type),
  862|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::Signed) => Some(existing_ref),
  863|       |
  864|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::LongLong) => Some(new_type),
  865|      0|                        (BuiltinType::LongLong, BuiltinType::Signed) => Some(existing_ref),
  866|       |
  867|       |                        // 3. Unsigned overrides signed/marker
  868|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::UInt) => Some(new_type),
  869|      0|                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  870|       |
  871|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Signed, BuiltinType::UInt) => Some(new_type),
  872|      0|                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::Signed) => Some(existing_ref),
  873|       |
  874|       |                        // Char + Unsigned -> UChar
  875|       |                        (BuiltinType::Char, BuiltinType::UInt) => {
  876|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_char_unsigned))
  877|       |                        }
  878|       |                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::Char) => {
  879|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_char_unsigned))
  880|       |                        }
  881|       |
  882|       |                        // Short + Unsigned -> UShort
  883|       |                        (BuiltinType::Short, BuiltinType::UInt) => {
  884|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_short_unsigned))
  885|       |                        }
  886|       |                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::Short) => {
  887|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_short_unsigned))
  888|       |                        }
  889|       |
  890|       |                        // Long + Unsigned -> ULong
  891|       |                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::UInt) => {
  892|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_unsigned))
  893|       |                        }
  894|       |                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::Long) => {
  895|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_unsigned))
  896|       |                        }
  897|       |
  898|       |                        // LongLong + Unsigned -> ULongLong
  899|       |                        (BuiltinType::LongLong, BuiltinType::UInt) => {
  900|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_long_unsigned))
  901|       |                        }
  902|       |                        (BuiltinType::UInt, BuiltinType::LongLong) => {
  903|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_long_unsigned))
  904|       |                        }
  905|       |
  906|       |                        // 4. Redundant 'int' combined with other specifiers
  907|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Short, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  908|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::Short) => Some(new_type),
  909|      0|                        (BuiltinType::UShort, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  910|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::UShort) => Some(new_type),
  911|       |
  912|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  913|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::Long) => Some(new_type),
  914|      0|                        (BuiltinType::ULong, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  915|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::ULong) => Some(new_type),
  916|       |
  917|      0|                        (BuiltinType::LongLong, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  918|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::LongLong) => Some(new_type),
  919|      0|                        (BuiltinType::ULongLong, BuiltinType::Int) => Some(existing_ref),
  920|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Int, BuiltinType::ULongLong) => Some(new_type),
  921|       |
  922|       |                        // 5. Long + Long -> LongLong (handled by case 1 above partially, but let's be explicit if needed)
  923|       |                        // (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::Long) is already handled in case 1.
  924|       |
  925|       |                        // Long + LongLong -> LongLong
  926|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::LongLong) => Some(new_type),
  927|      0|                        (BuiltinType::LongLong, BuiltinType::Long) => Some(existing_ref),
  928|       |
  929|       |                        // ULong + Long -> ULongLong
  930|       |                        (BuiltinType::ULong, BuiltinType::Long) => {
  931|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_long_unsigned))
  932|       |                        }
  933|       |                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::ULong) => {
  934|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_long_unsigned))
  935|       |                        }
  936|       |
  937|       |                        // Long + ULongLong -> ULongLong
  938|      0|                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::ULongLong) => Some(new_type),
  939|      0|                        (BuiltinType::ULongLong, BuiltinType::Long) => Some(existing_ref),
  940|       |
  941|       |                        // Long + Double -> LongDouble
  942|       |                        (BuiltinType::Double, BuiltinType::Long) => {
  943|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_double))
  944|       |                        }
  945|       |                        (BuiltinType::Long, BuiltinType::Double) => {
  946|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_long_double))
  947|       |                        }
  948|       |
  949|       |                        // Complex combinations
  950|       |                        (BuiltinType::Complex, BuiltinType::Float) | (BuiltinType::Float, BuiltinType::Complex) => {
  951|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(
  952|      0|                                ctx.registry.complex_type(ctx.registry.type_float),
  953|      0|                            ))
  954|       |                        }
  955|       |                        (BuiltinType::Complex, BuiltinType::Double) | (BuiltinType::Double, BuiltinType::Complex) => {
  956|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(
  957|      0|                                ctx.registry.complex_type(ctx.registry.type_double),
  958|      0|                            ))
  959|       |                        }
  960|       |                        (BuiltinType::Complex, BuiltinType::LongDouble)
  961|      0|                        | (BuiltinType::LongDouble, BuiltinType::Complex) => Some(QualType::unqualified(
  962|      0|                            ctx.registry.complex_type(ctx.registry.type_long_double),
  963|      0|                        )),
  964|       |
  965|       |                        // Error for other combinations (e.g. double int)
  966|       |                        _ => {
  967|      0|                            ctx.report_error(SemanticError::ConflictingTypeSpecifiers {
  968|      0|                                prev: ctx.registry.display_qual_type(existing_ref),
  969|      0|                                span,
  970|      0|                            });
  971|      0|                            Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_error))
  972|       |                        }
  973|       |                    }
  974|       |                }
  975|       |                _ => {
  976|      0|                    ctx.report_error(SemanticError::ConflictingTypeSpecifiers {
  977|      0|                        prev: ctx.registry.display_qual_type(existing_ref),
  978|      0|                        span,
  979|      0|                    });
  980|      0|                    Some(QualType::unqualified(ctx.registry.type_error))
  981|       |                }
  982|       |            }
  983|       |        }
  984|       |    }

 2442|      0|    pub(crate) fn lower_expression_into(&mut self, node: ParsedNodeRef, target: NodeRef) -> NodeRef {

 2642|      0|    fn deduce_array_size_full(&self, init_node: NodeRef) -> Option<usize> {
 2643|      0|        match self.ast.get_kind(init_node) {
 2644|      0|            NodeKind::InitializerList(list) => {
 2645|      0|                let mut max_index: i64 = -1;
 2646|      0|                let mut current_index: i64 = 0;
 2647|      0|                let eval = |e| const_eval::eval_const_expr(&self.const_ctx(), e);
 2648|       |
 2649|      0|                for item_ref in list.init_start.range(list.init_len) {
 2650|      0|                    let NodeKind::InitializerItem(init) = self.ast.get_kind(item_ref) else {
 2651|      0|                        continue;
 2652|       |                    };
 2653|       |
 2654|      0|                    if init.designator_len > 0 {
 2655|      0|                        match self.ast.get_kind(init.designator_start) {
 2656|      0|                            NodeKind::Designator(Designator::ArrayIndex(idx)) => {
 2657|      0|                                current_index = eval(*idx)?;
 2658|       |                            }
 2659|      0|                            NodeKind::Designator(Designator::GnuArrayRange(start, end)) => {
 2660|      0|                                let (s_v, e_v) = (eval(*start)?, eval(*end)?);
 2661|      0|                                if s_v > e_v {
 2662|      0|                                    return None;
 2663|      0|                                }
 2664|      0|                                current_index = e_v;
 2665|       |                            }
 2666|      0|                            _ => return None,
 2667|       |                        }
 2668|      0|                    }
 2669|       |
 2670|      0|                    max_index = max_index.max(current_index);
 2671|      0|                    current_index += 1;
 2672|       |                }
 2673|       |
 2674|      0|                Some((max_index + 1) as usize)
 2675|       |            }
 2676|      0|            NodeKind::Literal(literal::Literal::String(s)) => Some(s.as_str().len() + 1),
 2677|      0|            _ => None,
 2678|       |        }
 2679|      0|    }

   29|      0|pub(crate) fn map_ast_binary_op_to_mir_int(ast_op: &BinaryOp) -> BinaryIntOp {
   30|      0|    let op = ast_op.without_assignment().unwrap_or(*ast_op);
   31|      0|    match op {
   32|      0|        BinaryOp::Add => BinaryIntOp::Add,
   33|      0|        BinaryOp::Sub => BinaryIntOp::Sub,
   34|      0|        BinaryOp::Mul => BinaryIntOp::Mul,
   35|      0|        BinaryOp::Div => BinaryIntOp::Div,
   36|      0|        BinaryOp::Mod => BinaryIntOp::Mod,
   37|      0|        BinaryOp::BitAnd => BinaryIntOp::BitAnd,
   38|      0|        BinaryOp::BitOr => BinaryIntOp::BitOr,
   39|      0|        BinaryOp::BitXor => BinaryIntOp::BitXor,
   40|      0|        BinaryOp::LShift => BinaryIntOp::LShift,
   41|      0|        BinaryOp::RShift => BinaryIntOp::RShift,
   42|      0|        BinaryOp::Equal => BinaryIntOp::Eq,
   43|      0|        BinaryOp::NotEqual => BinaryIntOp::Ne,
   44|      0|        BinaryOp::Less => BinaryIntOp::Lt,
   45|      0|        BinaryOp::LessEqual => BinaryIntOp::Le,
   46|      0|        BinaryOp::Greater => BinaryIntOp::Gt,
   47|      0|        BinaryOp::GreaterEqual => BinaryIntOp::Ge,

   49|      0|        BinaryOp::LogicAnd | BinaryOp::LogicOr => panic!("Logic ops should be handled separately"),

   51|      0|        _ => panic!("Unsupported integer binary operator: {:?}", ast_op),
   52|       |    }

  304|      0|        debug_assert!(r.is_inline_pointer());
  305|      0|        let depth = r.pointer_depth();
  306|      0|        if depth > 1 {
  307|       |            // Decrement depth
  308|      0|            TypeRef::new(r.base(), r.class(), depth - 1, 0).unwrap()
  309|       |        } else {
  310|       |            // Depth becomes 0. Class becomes Class of Base.
  311|       |            // Look up base in registry.
  312|      0|            let base_idx = r.base();
  313|      0|            let base_type = &self.types[base_idx as usize];
  314|      0|            let base_class = base_type.kind.to_class();
  315|      0|            TypeRef::new(base_idx, base_class, 0, 0).unwrap()
  316|       |        }
  317|      0|    }
  318|       |
  319|      0|    fn reconstruct_element(&self, r: TypeRef) -> TypeRef {
  320|      0|        debug_assert!(r.is_inline_array());
  321|       |        // Array becomes non-array (arr=0). Class becomes Class of Base.
  322|      0|        let base_idx = r.base();
  323|      0|        let base_type = &self.types[base_idx as usize];
  324|      0|        let base_class = base_type.kind.to_class();
  325|      0|        TypeRef::new(base_idx, base_class, 0, 0).unwrap()
  326|      0|    }

  331|      1|    pub(crate) fn pointer_to(&mut self, base: QualType) -> TypeRef {
  332|       |        // Try inline if unqualified
  333|      1|        if base.qualifiers().is_empty() {
  334|      1|            let base_ty = base.ty();
  335|       |            // 1. If base is Inline Pointer (depth 1..2), we can increment depth (max 3).
  336|      1|            if base_ty.is_inline_pointer() {
  337|      0|                let depth = base_ty.pointer_depth();
  338|      0|                if depth < 3 {
  339|      0|                    return TypeRef::new(base_ty.base(), TypeClass::Pointer, depth + 1, 0).unwrap();
  340|      0|                }
  341|      1|            }
  342|       |
  343|       |            // 2. If base is Simple (Ptr=0, Arr=0), we can make Inline Pointer depth 1.
  344|      1|            if base_ty.pointer_depth() == 0 && base_ty.array_len().is_none() {
  345|      1|                return TypeRef::new(base_ty.base(), TypeClass::Pointer, 1, 0).unwrap();
  346|      0|            }
  347|      0|        }
  348|       |
  349|       |        // Fallback to Registry
  350|      0|        if let Some(&ptr) = self.pointer_cache.get(&base) {
  351|      0|            return ptr;
  352|      0|        }
  353|       |
  354|      0|        let ptr = self.alloc(Type::new(TypeKind::Pointer { pointee: base }));
  355|      0|        self.pointer_cache.insert(base, ptr);
  356|      0|        ptr
  357|      1|    }

  359|      0|    pub(crate) fn array_of(&mut self, elem: TypeRef, size: ArraySizeType) -> TypeRef {
  360|       |        // Try inline
  361|      0|        if let ArraySizeType::Constant(len) = size
  362|      0|            && len <= 31
  363|      0|            && elem.pointer_depth() == 0
  364|      0|            && elem.array_len().is_none()

  366|       |            // Check if elem is Simple
  367|      0|            return TypeRef::new(elem.base(), TypeClass::Array, 0, len as u32).unwrap();
  368|      0|        }
  369|       |
  370|      0|        let key = (elem, size.clone());
  371|      0|        if let Some(&arr) = self.array_cache.get(&key) {
  372|      0|            return arr;
  373|      0|        }
  374|       |

  376|      0|            element_type: elem,
  377|      0|            size,
  378|      0|        }));
  379|      0|        self.array_cache.insert(key, arr);
  380|      0|        arr
  381|      0|    }
