  479|      0|    pub(crate) fn get_layout(&self, ty: TypeRef) -> Cow<'_, TypeLayout> {
  480|      0|        if ty.is_inline_pointer() {
  481|      0|            return Cow::Owned(TypeLayout {
  482|      0|                size: 8,
  483|      0|                alignment: 8,
  484|      0|                kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  485|      0|            });
  486|      0|        }
  487|       |
  488|      0|        if ty.is_inline_array() {
  489|      0|            let elem = self.reconstruct_element(ty);
  490|      0|            let elem_layout = self.get_layout(elem);
  491|      0|            let len = ty.array_len().unwrap() as u64;
  492|      0|            return Cow::Owned(TypeLayout {
  493|      0|                size: elem_layout.size * (len as u16), // Potential overflow if not careful, but C rules apply
  494|      0|                alignment: elem_layout.alignment,
  495|      0|                kind: LayoutKind::Array { element: elem, len },
  496|      0|            });
  497|      0|        }
  498|       |
  499|      0|        let idx = ty.index();
  500|      0|        match self.types[idx].layout.as_ref() {
  501|      0|            Some(x) => Cow::Borrowed(x),
  502|      0|            None => panic!("ICE: TypeRef {ty} layout not computed. make sure layout is computed in previous phase"),
  503|       |        }
  504|      0|    }
  505|       |
  506|      0|    pub(crate) fn get_array_layout(&self, ty: TypeRef) -> (u16, u16, TypeRef, u64) {
  507|      0|        let layout = self.get_layout(ty);
  508|      0|        match layout.kind {
  509|      0|            LayoutKind::Array { element, len } => (layout.size, layout.alignment, element, len),
  510|      0|            _ => panic!("ICE: layout is not array"),
  511|       |        }
  512|      0|    }
  513|       |
  514|      1|    pub(crate) fn ensure_layout(&mut self, ty: TypeRef) -> Result<Cow<'_, TypeLayout>, SemanticError> {
  515|      1|        if ty.is_inline_pointer() {
  516|      0|            return Ok(Cow::Owned(TypeLayout {
  517|      0|                size: 8,
  518|      0|                alignment: 8,
  519|      0|                kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  520|      0|            }));
  521|      1|        }
  522|       |
  523|      1|        if ty.is_inline_array() {
  524|       |            // Recursive check
  525|      0|            let elem = self.reconstruct_element(ty);
  526|      0|            let elem_layout = self.ensure_layout(elem)?; // returns Cow
  527|      0|            let len = ty.array_len().unwrap() as u64;
  528|      0|            let size = (elem_layout.size as u64 * len) as u16;
  529|       |
  530|      0|            return Ok(Cow::Owned(TypeLayout {
  531|      0|                size,
  532|      0|                alignment: elem_layout.alignment,
  533|      0|                kind: LayoutKind::Array { element: elem, len },
  534|      0|            }));
  535|      1|        }
  536|       |
  537|      1|        let idx = ty.index();
  538|      1|        if self.types[idx].layout.is_some() {
  539|      0|            return Ok(Cow::Borrowed(self.types[idx].layout.as_ref().unwrap()));
  540|      1|        }
  541|       |
  542|      1|        let layout = self.compute_layout(ty)?;
                                                          ^0
  543|      1|        self.types[idx].layout = Some(layout);
  544|       |
  545|      1|        Ok(Cow::Borrowed(self.types[idx].layout.as_ref().unwrap()))
  546|      1|    }
  547|       |
  548|      1|    fn compute_layout(&mut self, ty: TypeRef) -> Result<TypeLayout, SemanticError> {
  549|      1|        if self.layout_in_progress.contains(&ty) {
  550|      0|            return Err(SemanticError::RecursiveType { ty });
  551|      1|        }
  552|       |
  553|       |        // We clone Kind to release borrow on self
  554|      1|        let type_kind = self.get(ty).kind.clone();
  555|       |
  556|      1|        self.layout_in_progress.insert(ty);
  557|       |
  558|      1|        let layout = match type_kind {
  559|      1|            TypeKind::Builtin(b) => match b {
  560|      0|                BuiltinType::Void => TypeLayout {
  561|      0|                    size: 0,
  562|      0|                    alignment: 1,
  563|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  564|      0|                },
  565|      0|                BuiltinType::Bool | BuiltinType::Char | BuiltinType::SChar | BuiltinType::UChar => TypeLayout {
  566|      0|                    size: 1,
  567|      0|                    alignment: 1,
  568|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  569|      0|                },
  570|      0|                BuiltinType::Short | BuiltinType::UShort => TypeLayout {
  571|      0|                    size: 2,
  572|      0|                    alignment: 2,
  573|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  574|      0|                },
  575|      0|                BuiltinType::Int | BuiltinType::UInt | BuiltinType::Float => TypeLayout {
  576|      0|                    size: 4,
  577|      0|                    alignment: 4,
  578|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  579|      0|                },
  580|       |                BuiltinType::Long | BuiltinType::ULong => {
  581|       |                    // long is usually pointer width
  582|      0|                    let size = match self.target_triple.pointer_width() {
  583|      0|                        Ok(PointerWidth::U16) => 2,
  584|      0|                        Ok(PointerWidth::U32) => 4,
  585|      0|                        Ok(PointerWidth::U64) => 8,
  586|      0|                        Err(_) => 8, // Default to 64-bit if unknown
  587|       |                    };
  588|      0|                    TypeLayout {
  589|      0|                        size,
  590|      0|                        alignment: size,
  591|      0|                        kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  592|      0|                    }
  593|       |                }
  594|      1|                BuiltinType::LongLong | BuiltinType::ULongLong | BuiltinType::Double => TypeLayout {
  595|      1|                    size: 8,
  596|      1|                    alignment: 8,
  597|      1|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  598|      1|                },
  599|       |                BuiltinType::LongDouble => {
  600|       |                    // On x86_64, long double is typically 80-bit (10 bytes) but padded to 16 bytes for alignment.
  601|       |                    // We use 16 bytes to match the System V ABI size.
  602|      0|                    let size = 16;
  603|      0|                    TypeLayout {
  604|      0|                        size,
  605|      0|                        alignment: size,
  606|      0|                        kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  607|      0|                    }
  608|       |                }
  609|      0|                BuiltinType::Signed => TypeLayout {
  610|      0|                    size: 4,
  611|      0|                    alignment: 4,
  612|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  613|      0|                },
  614|      0|                BuiltinType::VaList => TypeLayout {
  615|      0|                    size: 24,
  616|      0|                    alignment: 8,
  617|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Record {
  618|      0|                        fields: vec![
  619|      0|                            FieldLayout { offset: 0 },
  620|      0|                            FieldLayout { offset: 4 },
  621|      0|                            FieldLayout { offset: 8 },
  622|      0|                            FieldLayout { offset: 16 },
  623|      0|                        ],
  624|      0|                        is_union: false,
  625|      0|                    },
  626|      0|                },
  627|      0|                BuiltinType::Complex => TypeLayout {
  628|      0|                    size: 0,
  629|      0|                    alignment: 1,
  630|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  631|      0|                },
  632|       |            },
  633|       |
  634|       |            TypeKind::Pointer { .. } => {
  635|      0|                let size = match self.target_triple.pointer_width() {
  636|      0|                    Ok(PointerWidth::U16) => 2,
  637|      0|                    Ok(PointerWidth::U32) => 4,
  638|      0|                    Ok(PointerWidth::U64) => 8,
  639|      0|                    Err(_) => 8,
  640|       |                };
  641|      0|                TypeLayout {
  642|      0|                    size,
  643|      0|                    alignment: size,
  644|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  645|      0|                }
  646|       |            }
  647|       |
  648|      0|            TypeKind::Complex { base_type } => {
  649|      0|                let base_layout = self.ensure_layout(base_type)?;
  650|      0|                TypeLayout {
  651|      0|                    size: base_layout.size * 2,
  652|      0|                    alignment: base_layout.alignment,
  653|      0|                    kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  654|      0|                }
  655|       |            }
  656|       |
  657|      0|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, size } => match size {
  658|      0|                ArraySizeType::Constant(len) => {
  659|      0|                    let element_layout = self.ensure_layout(element_type)?;
  660|      0|                    let total_size = element_layout.size as u64 * len as u64;
  661|      0|                    TypeLayout {
  662|      0|                        size: total_size as u16,
  663|      0|                        alignment: element_layout.alignment,
  664|      0|                        kind: LayoutKind::Array {
  665|      0|                            element: element_type,
  666|      0|                            len: len as u64,
  667|      0|                        },
  668|      0|                    }
  669|       |                }
  670|       |                _ => {
  671|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  672|      0|                        feature: "incomplete/VLA array layout".to_string(),
  673|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::dummy(),
  674|      0|                    });
  675|       |                }
  676|       |            },
  677|       |
  678|      0|            TypeKind::Function { .. } => TypeLayout {
  679|      0|                size: 0,
  680|      0|                alignment: 1,
  681|      0|                kind: LayoutKind::Scalar,
  682|      0|            },
  683|       |
  684|       |            TypeKind::Record {
  685|      0|                members,
  686|      0|                is_complete,
  687|      0|                is_union,
  688|       |                ..
  689|       |            } => {
  690|      0|                if !is_complete {
  691|       |                    // This is the correct error when sizeof is used on an incomplete type.
  692|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::SizeOfIncompleteType {
  693|      0|                        ty,
  694|      0|                        // The span from the caller (e.g., the sizeof expression) is used,
  695|      0|                        // so a dummy span here is acceptable.
  696|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::dummy(),
  697|      0|                    });
  698|      0|                }
  699|      0|                self.compute_record_layout(&members, is_union)?
  700|       |            }
  701|       |
  702|       |            TypeKind::Enum {
  703|      0|                base_type, is_complete, ..
  704|       |            } => {
  705|      0|                if !is_complete {
  706|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  707|      0|                        feature: "incomplete enum type layout".to_string(),
  708|      0|                        span: SourceSpan::dummy(),
  709|      0|                    });
  710|      0|                }
  711|      0|                self.ensure_layout(base_type)?.into_owned()
  712|       |            }
  713|       |
  714|       |            TypeKind::Error => {
  715|      0|                return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  716|      0|                    feature: "error layout".to_string(),
  717|      0|                    span: SourceSpan::dummy(),
  718|      0|                });
  719|       |            }
  720|       |        };
  721|       |
  722|      1|        self.layout_in_progress.remove(&ty);
  723|      1|        Ok(layout)
  724|      1|    }
  725|       |
  726|      0|    fn compute_record_layout(&mut self, members: &[StructMember], is_union: bool) -> Result<TypeLayout, SemanticError> {
  727|      0|        let mut max_align = 1;
  728|      0|        let mut current_size = 0;
  729|      0|        let mut field_layouts = Vec::with_capacity(members.len());
  730|       |        // For C11 6.7.2.1p18 flexible array check:
  731|       |        // "the last element of a structure with more than one named member may have an incomplete array type"
  732|       |        // But incomplete array types are NOT allowed in unions.
  733|       |        // We will check validity as we iterate.
  734|       |        // Note: The count of members might include anonymous struct/union members which are technically members.
  735|       |
  736|      0|        let member_count = members.len();
  737|       |
  738|      0|        for (i, member) in members.iter().enumerate() {
  739|      0|            let member_ty = member.member_type.ty();
  740|       |
  741|       |            // Special handling for flexible array member (FAM)
  742|       |            // Need to check if it is incomplete array
  743|       |            // We can't use is_complete because that recurses. We check TypeKind directly.
  744|      0|            let is_incomplete_or_vla_array = if member_ty.is_inline_array() {
  745|      0|                false // inline array always has len
  746|       |            } else {
  747|      0|                matches!(
  748|      0|                    self.get(member_ty).kind,
  749|       |                    TypeKind::Array {
  750|       |                        size: ArraySizeType::Incomplete | ArraySizeType::Variable(_),
  751|       |                        ..
  752|       |                    }
  753|       |                )
  754|       |            };
  755|       |
  756|      0|            if is_incomplete_or_vla_array {
  757|      0|                if is_union {
  758|       |                    // Incomplete or VLA types not allowed in union
  759|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  760|      0|                        feature: "incomplete/VLA array in union".to_string(),
  761|      0|                        span: member.span,
  762|      0|                    });
  763|      0|                }
  764|       |
  765|       |                // Must be last member
  766|      0|                if i != member_count - 1 {
  767|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayNotLast { span: member.span });
  768|      0|                }
  769|       |
  770|       |                // Must have at least one other named member.
  771|       |                // Or rather, "structure with more than one named member".
  772|       |                // If this is the only member, it's invalid.
  773|      0|                if member_count < 2 {
  774|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayInEmptyStruct { span: member.span });
  775|      0|                }
  776|       |
  777|       |                // If valid FAM:
  778|       |                // Size of structure is as if FAM was omitted.
  779|       |                // But we must respect its alignment for the struct's alignment.
  780|       |                // We need to get the element type to find alignment.
  781|      0|                let elem_ty = match &self.get(member_ty).kind {
  782|      0|                    TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } => *element_type,
  783|      0|                    _ => unreachable!(),
  784|       |                };
  785|      0|                let elem_layout = self.ensure_layout(elem_ty)?;
  786|       |
  787|      0|                max_align = max_align.max(elem_layout.alignment);
  788|       |
  789|       |                // FAM has size 0 for layout purposes of the struct size,
  790|       |                // but its offset is where it would start.
  791|       |                // The standard says: "size of the structure is as if the flexible array member were omitted"
  792|       |                // This means current_size stays as is (after padding for alignment of FAM? No, omitted means omitted).
  793|       |                // "except that it may have more trailing padding than the omission would imply"
  794|       |                // Usually this is interpreted as: sizeof(struct) = max(sizeof(struct_without_fam), offsetof(fam)).
  795|       |                // Or simply: layout the FAM, but don't increment current_size by its size (which is unknown/0).
  796|       |                // But we might need to add padding to current_size to reach FAM alignment?
  797|       |                // "as if the flexible array member were omitted" implies we don't even add padding for it?
  798|       |                // BUT "except that it may have more trailing padding".
  799|       |                // Most compilers align the end of the struct to the alignment of the FAM.
  800|       |
  801|       |                // Let's compute offset.
  802|      0|                let offset = (current_size + elem_layout.alignment - 1) & !(elem_layout.alignment - 1);
  803|      0|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  804|       |
  805|       |                // We do NOT update current_size with FAM size (which is effectively 0 or variable).
  806|       |                // But we might update current_size to offset?
  807|       |                // GCC: sizeof(struct { int x; int y[]; }) == 4.
  808|       |                //      sizeof(struct { char c; int y[]; }) == 4 (aligned to 4).
  809|       |                // So we do align current_size.
  810|      0|                current_size = offset;
  811|       |
  812|      0|                continue;
  813|      0|            }
  814|       |
  815|      0|            let layout = self.ensure_layout(member_ty)?;
  816|      0|            let mut member_align = layout.alignment;
  817|      0|            if let Some(req_align) = member.alignment {
  818|      0|                member_align = member_align.max(req_align as u16);
  819|      0|            }
  820|      0|            max_align = max_align.max(member_align);
  821|       |
  822|      0|            if is_union {
  823|      0|                current_size = current_size.max(layout.size);
  824|      0|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset: 0 });
  825|      0|            } else {
  826|      0|                // Align current_size to member's alignment to find its offset
  827|      0|                let offset = (current_size + member_align - 1) & !(member_align - 1);
  828|      0|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  829|      0|                current_size = offset + layout.size;
  830|      0|            }
  831|       |        }
  832|       |
  833|       |        // Final size is padded to the record's max alignment
  834|      0|        let final_size = (current_size + max_align - 1) & !(max_align - 1);
  835|       |
  836|      0|        Ok(TypeLayout {
  837|      0|            size: final_size,
  838|      0|            alignment: max_align,
  839|      0|            kind: LayoutKind::Record {
  840|      0|                fields: field_layouts,
  841|      0|                is_union,
  842|      0|            },
  843|      0|        })
  844|      0|    }
  845|       |
  846|      0|    pub(crate) fn decay(&mut self, qt: QualType, ptr_qualifiers: TypeQualifiers) -> QualType {
  847|      0|        let kind = self.get(qt.ty()).kind.clone();
  848|      0|        match kind {
  849|      0|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } => {
  850|       |                // Correct logic: Array of T decays to Pointer to T.
  851|       |                // Qualifiers on Array apply to the element in the resulting pointer type.
  852|      0|                let elem_qt = QualType::new(element_type, qt.qualifiers());
  853|      0|                let ptr = self.pointer_to(elem_qt);
  854|       |                // Apply the extracted pointer qualifiers (e.g. from static/const inside [])
  855|      0|                QualType::new(ptr, ptr_qualifiers)
  856|       |            }
  857|       |            TypeKind::Function { .. } => {
  858|      0|                let ptr = self.pointer_to(qt);
  859|      0|                QualType::new(ptr, ptr_qualifiers)
  860|       |            }
  861|      0|            _ => qt,
  862|       |        }
  863|      0|    }

  895|      0|                    element_type: elem_a,
  896|      0|                    size: size_a,
  897|       |                },

  899|      0|                    element_type: elem_b,
  900|      0|                    size: size_b,
  901|       |                },
  902|       |            ) => {

  904|      0|                    return false;
  905|      0|                }

  907|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Incomplete, _) => true,
  908|      0|                    (_, ArraySizeType::Incomplete) => true,
  909|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Constant(sa), ArraySizeType::Constant(sb)) => sa == sb,
  910|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Star, _) => true,
  911|      0|                    (_, ArraySizeType::Star) => true,
  912|      0|                    _ => false,
  913|       |                }
  914|       |            }

  916|       |                TypeKind::Function {
  917|      0|                    return_type: ret_a,
  918|      0|                    parameters: params_a,
  919|      0|                    is_variadic: var_a,
  920|       |                    ..
  921|       |                },
  922|       |                TypeKind::Function {
  923|      0|                    return_type: ret_b,
  924|      0|                    parameters: params_b,
  925|      0|                    is_variadic: var_b,
  926|       |                    ..
  927|       |                },

  929|      0|                if var_a != var_b {
  930|      0|                    return false;
  931|      0|                }

  933|      0|                    return false;
  934|      0|                }
  935|      0|                if params_a.len() != params_b.len() {
  936|      0|                    return false;
  937|      0|                }

  939|       |                    // Ignore top-level qualifiers on parameters

  943|      0|                        return false;
  944|      0|                    }

  946|      0|                true
  947|       |            }
  948|      0|            (TypeKind::Pointer { pointee: p_a }, TypeKind::Pointer { pointee: p_b }) => self.is_compatible(p_a, p_b),
  949|      0|            _ => false,
  950|       |        }
  951|      0|    }

  953|      0|    pub(crate) fn composite_type(&mut self, a: QualType, b: QualType) -> Option<QualType> {
  954|      0|        if a.qualifiers() != b.qualifiers() {
  955|      0|            return None;
  956|      0|        }
  957|       |
  958|      0|        if a.ty() == b.ty() {
  959|      0|            return Some(a);
  960|      0|        }
  961|       |
  962|      0|        let kind_a = self.get(a.ty()).kind.clone();
  963|      0|        let kind_b = self.get(b.ty()).kind.clone();
  964|       |
  965|      0|        match (kind_a, kind_b) {
  966|       |            (
  967|       |                TypeKind::Array {
  968|      0|                    element_type: elem_a,
  969|      0|                    size: size_a,
  970|       |                },
  971|       |                TypeKind::Array {
  972|      0|                    element_type: elem_b,
  973|      0|                    size: size_b,

  977|      0|                    self.composite_type(QualType::unqualified(elem_a), QualType::unqualified(elem_b))?;

  979|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Incomplete, s) => s,
  980|      0|                    (s, ArraySizeType::Incomplete) => s,
  981|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Constant(sa), ArraySizeType::Constant(sb)) if sa == sb => {
  982|      0|                        ArraySizeType::Constant(sa)
  983|       |                    }
  984|      0|                    (ArraySizeType::Star, s) => s,
  985|      0|                    (s, ArraySizeType::Star) => s,
  986|      0|                    _ => return None,
  987|       |                };

  989|      0|                Some(QualType::new(res_ty, a.qualifiers()))
  990|       |            }
  991|       |            (
  992|       |                TypeKind::Function {
  993|      0|                    return_type: ret_a,
  994|      0|                    parameters: params_a,
  995|      0|                    is_variadic: var_a,
  996|      0|                    is_noreturn: noreturn_a,
  997|       |                },
  998|       |                TypeKind::Function {
  999|      0|                    return_type: ret_b,
 1000|      0|                    parameters: params_b,
 1001|      0|                    is_variadic: var_b,
 1002|      0|                    is_noreturn: noreturn_b,
 1003|       |                },
 1004|       |            ) => {
 1005|      0|                if var_a != var_b {
 1006|      0|                    return None;
 1007|      0|                }
 1008|      0|                let composite_ret = self.composite_type(QualType::unqualified(ret_a), QualType::unqualified(ret_b))?;
 1009|      0|                if params_a.len() != params_b.len() {
 1010|      0|                    return None;
 1011|      0|                }
 1012|      0|                let mut composite_params = Vec::with_capacity(params_a.len());
 1013|      0|                for (p_a, p_b) in params_a.iter().zip(params_b.iter()) {
 1014|       |                    // C11 6.7.6.3p15: each parameter declared with qualified type is taken as
 1015|       |                    // having the unqualified version of its declared type.
 1016|      0|                    let type_a = QualType::unqualified(p_a.param_type.ty());
 1017|      0|                    let type_b = QualType::unqualified(p_b.param_type.ty());
 1018|      0|                    let cp = self.composite_type(type_a, type_b)?;
 1019|       |
 1020|      0|                    composite_params.push(FunctionParameter {
 1021|      0|                        param_type: cp,
 1022|      0|                        name: p_b.name.or(p_a.name),
 1023|      0|                    });
 1024|       |                }
 1025|      0|                let res_ty = self.function_type(composite_ret.ty(), composite_params, var_a, noreturn_a || noreturn_b);
 1026|      0|                Some(QualType::new(res_ty, a.qualifiers()))
 1027|       |            }
 1028|      0|            (TypeKind::Pointer { pointee: p_a }, TypeKind::Pointer { pointee: p_b }) => {

 1030|      0|                let res_ty = self.pointer_to(composite_pointee);
 1031|      0|                Some(QualType::new(res_ty, a.qualifiers()))
 1032|       |            }
 1033|       |            _ => {
 1034|      0|                if self.is_compatible(a, b) {
 1035|      0|                    Some(a)
 1036|       |                } else {
 1037|      0|                    None
 1038|       |                }
 1039|       |            }
 1040|       |        }
 1041|      0|    }

 1043|      0|    pub(crate) fn is_complete(&self, ty: TypeRef) -> bool {
 1044|      0|        if ty.is_inline_pointer() {
 1045|      0|            return true;
 1046|      0|        }
 1047|      0|        if ty.is_inline_array() {
 1048|       |            // Array is complete if element is complete
 1049|       |            // But strict C says array valid if element type is complete (except local VLA which is complete at runtime allocation point?)
 1050|       |            // Here we just check element kind.
 1051|      0|            let elem = self.reconstruct_element(ty);
 1052|      0|            return self.is_complete(elem);
 1053|      0|        }
 1054|       |
 1055|      0|        let kind = &self.types[ty.index()].kind;
 1056|      0|        match kind {
 1057|      0|            TypeKind::Record { is_complete, .. } => *is_complete,
 1058|      0|            TypeKind::Enum { is_complete, .. } => *is_complete,
 1059|      0|            TypeKind::Array { element_type, size } => {
 1060|      0|                if let ArraySizeType::Incomplete = size {
 1061|      0|                    return false;
 1062|      0|                }
 1063|      0|                self.is_complete(*element_type)
 1064|       |            }
 1065|      0|            TypeKind::Builtin(BuiltinType::Void) => false,
 1066|      0|            _ => true, // Scalars are always complete
 1067|       |        }
 1068|      0|    }

 1081|      0|                    return true;
 1082|      0|                }
 1083|       |            }
 1084|      0|        }

    3|       |//! This module defines the semantic type system used during analysis,
    4|       |//! distinct from the syntactic TypeSpecifier constructs used in parsing.
    5|       |

   14|       |/// Type representation (for semantic analysis)
   15|       |/// This is a canonical type, distinct from TypeSpecifier which is a syntax construct.
   16|       |/// Types are stored in a separate Vec<Type> with TypeRef references.
   17|       |/// invariant:
   18|       |/// - layout == None for incomplete types
   19|       |/// - layout is computed according to C abstract machine rules
   20|       |/// - layout may differ from MIR layout
   21|       |
   22|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
   23|       |pub struct Type {
   24|       |    pub kind: TypeKind,
   25|       |    pub layout: Option<TypeLayout>,
   26|       |}
   27|       |
   28|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
   29|       |pub struct TypeLayout {
   30|       |    pub size: u16,
   31|       |    pub alignment: u16,
   32|       |    pub kind: LayoutKind,
   33|       |}
   34|       |
   35|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
   36|       |pub enum LayoutKind {
   37|       |    Scalar,
   38|       |    Array { element: TypeRef, len: u64 },
   39|       |    Record { fields: Vec<FieldLayout>, is_union: bool },
   40|       |}
   41|       |
   42|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
   43|       |pub struct FieldLayout {
   44|       |    pub offset: u16,
   45|       |}

   49|       |    /// can only be called by TypeRegistry

   52|     20|    }

   54|      0|    pub(crate) fn flatten_members(&self, registry: &super::TypeRegistry, flat_members: &mut Vec<StructMember>) {

   56|      0|            for member in members.iter().cloned() {

   60|      0|                } else {
   61|      0|                    flat_members.push(member);
   62|      0|                }
   63|       |            }
   64|      0|        }
   65|      0|    }

   67|      0|    pub(crate) fn flatten_members_with_layouts(

   70|      0|        flat_members: &mut Vec<StructMember>,

   83|      0|                    if member.name.is_none() {

   86|      0|                    } else {

  246|       |/// Opaque reference to a canonical type.
  247|       |/// Internally index + 1 (NonZeroU32 for niche optimization).
  248|       |#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, Hash, Serialize)]
  249|       |#[repr(transparent)]
  250|       |pub struct TypeRef(NonZeroU32);
  251|       |
  252|       |impl TypeRef {
  253|       |    // Layout:
  254|       |    // bit  0..=17  (18 bit)  BASE INDEX
  255|       |    // bit 18..=20  (3 bit)   TYPE CLASS
  256|       |    // bit 21..=22  (2 bit)   POINTER DEPTH (0..3)
  257|       |    // bit 23..=27  (5 bit)   ARRAY LEN INLINE (0..31)
  258|       |
  259|       |    const BASE_BITS: u32 = 18;
  260|       |    const CLASS_BITS: u32 = 3;
  261|       |    const PTR_BITS: u32 = 2;
  262|       |    const ARR_BITS: u32 = 5;
  263|       |
  264|       |    const BASE_SHIFT: u32 = 0;
  265|       |    const CLASS_SHIFT: u32 = Self::BASE_BITS;
  266|       |    const PTR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::CLASS_SHIFT + Self::CLASS_BITS;
  267|       |    const ARR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::PTR_SHIFT + Self::PTR_BITS;
  268|       |
  269|       |    const BASE_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::BASE_BITS) - 1;
  270|       |    const CLASS_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::CLASS_BITS) - 1;
  271|       |    const PTR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::PTR_BITS) - 1;
  272|       |    const ARR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::ARR_BITS) - 1;
  273|       |
  274|       |    #[inline]
  275|     20|    pub(crate) fn new(base_index: u32, class: TypeClass, ptr_depth: u8, arr_len: u32) -> Option<Self> {
  276|     20|        if base_index == 0 || base_index > Self::BASE_MASK {
  277|      0|            return None; // Base index must be non-zero and fit in 18 bits
  278|     20|        }
  279|     20|        if ptr_depth as u32 > Self::PTR_MASK {
  280|      0|            return None;
  281|     20|        }
  282|     20|        if arr_len > Self::ARR_MASK {
  283|      0|            return None;
  284|     20|        }
  285|       |
  286|       |        // Validate combinations
  287|     20|        match class {
  288|       |            TypeClass::Builtin => {
  289|     19|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
  290|      0|                    return None;
  291|     19|                }
  292|       |            }
  293|       |            TypeClass::Pointer => {
  294|      1|                if arr_len != 0 {
  295|      0|                    return None;
  296|      1|                }
  297|       |                // Pointer depth 0 means "Registry Pointer" (valid)
  298|       |                // Pointer depth 1..3 means "Inline Pointer" (valid)
  299|       |            }
  300|       |            TypeClass::Array => {
  301|       |                // Array len 0 means "Registry Array" (valid)
  302|       |                // Array len 1..31 means "Inline Array" (valid)
  303|      0|                if ptr_depth != 0 {
  304|      0|                    return None;
  305|      0|                }
  306|       |            }
  307|       |            TypeClass::Function | TypeClass::Record | TypeClass::Enum | TypeClass::Typedef | TypeClass::Complex => {
  308|      0|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
  309|      0|                    return None;
  310|      0|                }
  311|       |            }
  312|       |        }
  313|       |
  314|     20|        let mut raw = 0u32;
  315|     20|        raw |= base_index & Self::BASE_MASK;
  316|     20|        raw |= (class as u32) << Self::CLASS_SHIFT;
  317|     20|        raw |= (ptr_depth as u32) << Self::PTR_SHIFT;
  318|     20|        raw |= (arr_len) << Self::ARR_SHIFT;
  319|       |
  320|     20|        NonZeroU32::new(raw).map(TypeRef)
  321|     20|    }
  322|       |
  323|       |    // Unsafe constructor for internal use / tests
  324|       |    #[inline]
  325|     33|    pub(crate) unsafe fn from_raw_unchecked(n: u32) -> Self {
  326|     33|        unsafe { TypeRef(NonZeroU32::new_unchecked(n)) }
  327|     33|    }
  328|       |

  334|     21|    }

  359|      1|        if val == 0 { None } else { Some(val) }
                                                  ^0
  360|      1|    }

  581|       |/// The kind of type
  582|       |#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Default)]
  583|       |pub enum TypeKind {
  584|       |    Builtin(BuiltinType),
  585|       |    Complex {
  586|       |        base_type: TypeRef,
  587|       |    },
  588|       |    Pointer {
  589|       |        pointee: QualType,
  590|       |    },
  591|       |    Array {
  592|       |        element_type: TypeRef,
  593|       |        size: ArraySizeType,
  594|       |    },
  595|       |    Function {
  596|       |        return_type: TypeRef,
  597|       |        parameters: Vec<FunctionParameter>,
  598|       |        is_variadic: bool,
  599|       |        is_noreturn: bool,
  600|       |    },
  601|       |    Record {
  602|       |        tag: Option<NameId>,
  603|       |        members: Vec<StructMember>,
  604|       |        is_complete: bool,
  605|       |        is_union: bool,
  606|       |    },
  607|       |    Enum {
  608|       |        tag: Option<NameId>,
  609|       |        base_type: TypeRef,
  610|       |        enumerators: Vec<EnumConstant>,
  611|       |        is_complete: bool,
  612|       |    },
  613|       |    #[default]
  614|       |    Error,
  615|       |}

  449|       |    /// Get line and column for a source location
  450|      0|    pub(crate) fn get_line_column(&self, loc: SourceLoc) -> Option<(u32, u32)> {
  451|      0|        let file_info = self.get_file_info(loc.source_id())?;
  452|      0|        let offset = loc.offset();
  453|       |
  454|      0|        let line_starts = &file_info.line_starts;
  455|      0|        if line_starts.is_empty() {
  456|       |            // If line_starts not calculated yet, assume single line starting at 0
  457|      0|            return Some((1, offset + 1));
  458|      0|        }
  459|       |
  460|       |        // Use partition_point which performs a binary search
  461|      0|        let idx = line_starts.partition_point(|&start| start <= offset);
  462|       |
  463|      0|        if idx == 0 {
  464|      0|            return Some((0, 1));
  465|      0|        }
  466|       |
  467|       |        // idx is the index of the first element GREATER than offset.
  468|       |        // The line index corresponds to the element immediately preceding usage.
  469|      0|        let line_idx = idx - 1;
  470|      0|        let line_start = line_starts[line_idx];
  471|      0|        let column = offset - line_start;
  472|       |
  473|      0|        Some((line_idx as u32 + 1, column + 1)) // 1-based indexing
  474|      0|    }
  475|       |
  476|       |    /// Get the presumed location (logical line and file) for a source location
  477|      0|    pub(crate) fn get_presumed_location(&self, loc: SourceLoc) -> Option<(u32, u32, Option<&str>)> {
  478|      0|        let file_info = self.get_file_info(loc.source_id())?;
  479|      0|        let physical_line = self.get_line_column(loc)?.0;
  480|       |
  481|      0|        let (logical_line, logical_file) = file_info.line_map.presumed_location(physical_line);
  482|      0|        let column = self.get_line_column(loc)?.1;
  483|       |
  484|       |        // If no logical file specified, use the physical filename
  485|      0|        let filename = logical_file.or_else(|| file_info.path.to_str());
  486|       |
  487|      0|        Some((logical_line, column, filename))
  488|      0|    }
